loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, shirts and sweaters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beans for resale

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: Leader du groupe d’affaire « Mapatano » est entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont certains étudient et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers.Son mari est un chauffeur de direction auprès d’une entreprise privée.La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires au marché sectoriel Nyabushongo.Il ya 20 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 2 chèvres pour son petit élevage et le reste sera injecté dans son business habituel de vente de denrées alimentaires. En plus,elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une seconde maison pour le locataire.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Mapatano» est majoritairement féminins composé de 28 membres et des 3 autres collègues du marche qui ont voulu participer dans l’ambiance à la photo de souvenir.
texts.en:
The leader of the business group “Mapatano” is an entrepreneur who is 52 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. Some of her children are in school, and others have their own homes. Her husband is a management chauffeur for a private company. Our client sells foodstuffs at the sector market Nyabushongo. She has been in this business for twenty years. However, she has just completed eight loan cycles with Hekima. 

This new loan must be enough for her to buy two goats for her livestock farm, and the rest will be reinvested in her usual business selling grocery items. In addition, she has the ambition to educate her children and to build a second house to rent out. 

Our client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banks. It is appropriate to note that this 28-member business group “Mapatano” is composed mostly of women plus three colleagues from the marketplace who wanted to be part of this souvenir photo.

loans.use: to buy two goats and more

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Abdufato

texts.en:
Abdufato is married and has two children. Abdufato is a cheerful and nimble man. He works very hard. Abdufato has a great responsibility of caring for his family and he is the only breadwinner. His wife is a housewife. For more than 12 years, he has run his family’s bakery business, assisted by his two brothers. Abdufato would like to get a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase flour in order to expand his business. He is requesting his fifth loan, and he has a good credit history. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, a 39-year-old married father of four children in school, has been selling second-hand clothes to earn a living for 12 years.  He joined Faulu Kenya to  easily access financial support and open a savings account. Julius is requesting a loan of 20, 000 Kes to buy more second-hand clothes. His aspiration is to build his own shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his business.

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en:
This is Yawa. She is 39 years old and married to a school teacher. The couple has four children ages 8, 10, 15 and 17. Yawa has two additional dependents that live with her because they are her husband’s relatives. Since 2006, Yawa has been selling local and imported food such as magi, onion salt and other items. She never attended school and began her business because it was the only skill she was trained in. Yawa works six days a week and 18 hours a day to earn a monthly income of 1,000,000 SLL. 

Yawa is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy local and imported merchandise for her business. She hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Yawa plans to acquire a building to use as a store and educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy local and imported foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Thúy's Group

texts.en:
Thúy is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if one is delinquent or defaults on her portion of the loan. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đoài 1 - nhóm 07.

Thúy is a 28-year-old, married woman living in Yen Phong district in Bac Ninh province. Thúy and her husband have two school-age children. To earn a living, Thúy owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from providing medicinal services to local community members. Thúy has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND per month from these activities.

In 2008, Thúy joined SEDA to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, she was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Recently, Thúy successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA. That prior loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital purposes. She is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. Notably, this loan would be the fourth loan taken out by Thúy from SEDA. Thúy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to pay her children's tuition fees.

The following is a brief summary of the other borrowers in the group: (1) Tỉnh is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business (she has a furniture-making business, where she makes things such as tables, chairs, beds, and wardrobes); (2) Dung is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her retail business (she has a specialized retail store, where she sells goods such as rice, flour, and tea); (3) Hanh is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her food sales business (she makes and sells foods such as rice noodles); (4) Dung is a 32-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business (she has a furniture-making business, where she makes beds, wardrobes, etc.); and (5) Ngau is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her retail business (she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells SIM cards and phones).

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim. He is 31 years old and single with an 8-year-old child. Ibrahim also has two dependents that live with him and help with his business.  In 2004, Ibrahim established his cinema and top-up cards (mobile phone card) business. He started his business because he wanted to be employed and self-reliant. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, Ibrahim earns about 900,000 SLL a month. 

Ibrahim is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy recharge cards and improve his cinema business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a permanent structure for his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone charge cards and improve his cinema business

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 45 years old and married to Nancy, who is a housewife. They have six children ages six, nine, 12, 14, 16 and 18. For the past eight years, Josphat has run a retail shop in the Chemase trading center. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

Josphat was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he is applying for his first loan. He is requesting 20,000 KES to buy more stock such as sugar, wheat flour, and bags of rice. Josphat will use the profit from his loan to increase his shop’s inventory. In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as sugar, wheat flour and bags of rice

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is 45 years old and lives with her mother and two sons, who are 11 and 19 years old respectively. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in a small house. Her youngest son attends public school while her oldest son works as a packer at a local bakery factory. Ganchimeg’s mother is retired. 

Ganchimeg helps support her family by operating a retail stall at the Kharkhorin market, one of the largest outdoor markets in Mongolia, where she sells building materials and tools. When she first began her business in 1998, she had 500,000 MNT in working capital, but she has since expanded and now has 1,600,000 MNT in working capital. Over the past thirteen years, Ganchimeg has been able to gradually improve her living conditions and she has built her own small house in her yard with her business earnings.

Ganchimeg is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy more materials, tools, and implements to sell to her customers during the busy shopping season ahead. Her main goal for 2011 is to expand the size of her small house so her family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more building materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is Mohamed. He is 32 years old and married to a trader. The couple has no children but Mohamed is raising two of his younger brothers who live with him and he is helping with their education. In 2005, Mohamed established a drink and mobile-phone-recharge-card business. He works seven days a week and thirteen hours a day and is able to earn abut 1,000,000 SLL a month. 

Mohamed is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more beverages and mobile phone cards for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. Mohamed intends to use the proceeds from his loan to pay school fees for his dependents and help buy a piece of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks and mobile phone cards for his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer and also operates a clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru town. She has operated her clothes shop for the last two years. She is 53 years old and a single mother of one child.
Mary was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of her friends and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 12,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes for resale. In the future, she hopes to expand her clothes shop into a bigger boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr: La représentante du groupe d’affaire « Lumière »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, tous étudient. Son mari est un chauffeur – Taximan motard dans la ville de Goma. La cliente  est commerçante des articles divers  au marché sectoriel Nyabushongo.  Il ya 7 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 4 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter  10 paires de souliers, dizaine de bassins plastics, 1 carton biscuits, 1 box du sel de cuisine, dizaine de gobelet, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison dans sa propre parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Lumière» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The representative of the "Lumière" business group is a 30-year old entrepreneur, who is married and mother to five children, all of whom are studying. Her husband is a motorbike taxi-driver in the town of Goma. The customer is a trader of various items in the Nyabushongo sector market. She has been carrying out this activity for the past seven years. She has had four loans from Hékima. This new loan will enable her to buy ten pairs of shoes, ten plastic bowls, a carton of biscuits, a box of kitchen salt, ten cups etc. Her ambition is for her children to be able to study and to build a house on her own piece of land. The customer is grateful to Hekima for the help it gives to poor women who do not have access to classic banks. It should be noted that the majority of the "Lumière" business group are women.

loans.use: to buy ten pairs of shoes, ten plastic bowls, a carton of biscuits, a box of kitchen salt, ten cups, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Sisian with her husband and their two children. She works in Torunik village, where she is engaged in the agriculture business.

Gayane would like to cultivate land, but she does not have sufficient financial means to do so. As a result, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds. In turn, she hopes to cultivate the land, which would help to increase her income. In the future, she hopes that additional revenue generated as a result of the loan proceeds will allow her to purchase a house in Sisian and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: After his retirement, Ahmad, 53 years old, decided to open a new business since his retirement salary is not enough to support his 7-member family.  After getting support from his wife and children, he used his savings to open a mini-market in his area three months ago. He was happy to see that his mini-market has attracted a lot of customers because of the products he sells. Seeing the success gave him the urge to expand the mini-market, so he decided to take a loan to include frozen products and vegetables in addition to the food supplies and snacks.

loans.use: To add frozen products and vegetables to the products he sells

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg is a 50-year-old widow. She lives with her daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are both university students. They own a plot of land and a family house. Altantsetseg used to work for a state-owned leather processing factory until 1991 when it was privatized and she lost her job due to job cuts. Then, together with her two girlfriends, she established a partnership, rented a work space and started producing leather garments. She still works there as a tailor. She has a sewing machine at home and in her spare time she makes leather jackets with different designs and sells them to customers to earn extra cash. She has to support her two student children and pay their annual fees as well. Altantsetseg is applying for a loan to buy leather materials to make different types of leather jacket to sell.

loans.use: to buy leather materials to make different type of leather jackets to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 34 years old, married and a father of three lovely children. He lives in Kitale, where he sells second-hand clothes. He has been in this business for two years now, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings.
This will be Henry's second loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a bale of clothes so that he can add to his stock. With the income that he will get, he plans to invest in his motorbike business. In the future, he wants to educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Areg village, in the Aragatsotn region of Armenia. She works as a librarian. Unfortunately, her salary as a librarian is too low to meet her family’s living expenses. So, she is also engaged in the agriculture business. Specifically, she raises livestock and cultivates the land.

Gohar could use some capital to expand her farming operations. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. By cultivating the land, Gohar expects to increase her income and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a 34-year-old married man and a father of three children. He lives in Botwa on the outskirts of Kitale town. Caleb keeps poultry, which he sells when they have matured. He has been in this business for three years now and earns a monthly income of 16,000 Kenyan Shillings.
This will be Caleb's second loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more chicks to rear and then sell later at a profit. With the income that he will get, he plans to plough back into the business. In the future, he wants to expand his business and also support his family financially.

loans.use: to buy poultry for resale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Vilma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Artsvi

texts.en:
This Kiva client lives in Yerevan together with his wife and parents. He earns a living by purchasing household items and stationery in bulk and delivers these to his customers, using a rented car. 

He would like to be able to purchase and deliver more goods. With the help of this loan, he will be able to make a bulk purchase of stationery and household items, as well as to increase his working capital. 

Additional income will help him to ensure better living conditions for his family in the future.

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of stationery and household items

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 48 years old and is married to Murungi.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jecinta hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Rowena is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rowena sells vegetables like cauliflowers and broccoli. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rowena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like broccoli and cauliflower. This will be the first loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like broccoli and cauliflower to resell.

loans.name: Piledrina

texts.en:
Piledrina is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Piledrina is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Piledrina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Piledrina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Piledrina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Piledrina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be the first loan taken out by Piledrina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 21-year-old farmer from the village of Bejano, South Georgia. She lives with her husband, his parents and brother and two-year-old daughter. Anna’s husband and his brother are musicians. Anna and all the family members are involved in agriculture. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow potatoes, carrots and beets. The harvested vegetables are sold locally to the wholesalers. Along with the above-mentioned business, the family owns a small dairy farm. 

With the requested loan, Anna plans to purchase calves and seeds for potatoes. Potatoes will be sown in their plot. The calves will be raised and sold after six months for a higher price. 

With the income from the sales of the potatoes and calves, the family plans to purchase a house in the village.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and seeds to sow

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru: Анорхол проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 52 года. Она замужем, имеет 8 детей. Ее дети находятся в России на заработках. Сама Анорхол имеет среднее образование. Она более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется небольшой участок земли, где она выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности. То есть она хочет купить участок земли рядом с домом.
texts.en: Anorhol lives in the Shahrituz Region. She is 52 years old. She is married and is the mother of eight. Her children are migrant workers in Russia. Anorhol has secondary education. She has been working in agriculture for over five years. She has a small plot next to her house, where she grows vegetables. She is taking out a loan to expand her business, that is, she would like to buy a land plot nearby.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a land plot

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 41-year-old woman from Jabalia Refugee camp. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. Eman's husband has a small accessories and cosmetics store.

Eman took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband could purchase a larger amount of accessories and cosmetics to increase his profits and be able to save for a move to a bigger store.

Eman's husband appears in the picture here instead of her, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in Yerevan with her husband who works in construction.

Hasmik sells women’s clothing. She would like to develop her business by selling more clothes. With the help of a loan she will increase her income, which will help to cover daily costs, as well as grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 63 years old and is married to Mary.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers which he will use on his farm in this planting season.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar, 37 years old, is married to Mahmoud who is a 39-year-old electrical technician. Because of her ambitious character, three years ago, Myassar started to buy different fabrics and make clothes, gloves, and table covers to sell. At first, she started selling them to the people she knows, who encouraged her to continue in this path. Her family and neighbors supported her and started to tell other people about her products, which helped her to expand her customer base. Now Myassar has applied for a loan to buy more fabric and materials to sew more clothes at her customers' requests.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and materials

loans.name: Saidasror

texts.en:
Saidasror is a hardworking man who is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife. 

Saidasror is engaged in the farming business. He cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes and wheat. He sells agricultural products in the market.

Saidasror would like to get a loan of 4,000 TJS to purchase fertilizers and seedlings in order to expand his business and improve his living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

***

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Chuluunsuh

texts.en: Chuluunsuh is 53 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. All his adult children work and live separately. Chuluunsuh manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2006 after working as a driver in a public organization for 29 years. Taxi service is not an easy business to conduct. However, Chuluunsuh has worked hard to stabilize his business. In 2010, he managed to change his car in order to provide safe and comfortable service for his customers. The taxi service business is the only source of income for his family, so he is planning to expand and continue his business in the future. Chuluunsuh is a friendly man who says, "I would like to renew my car again." He is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Shamam

texts.en:
Shamam lives in Yerevan with her daughter and son. She sells clothes from a rented booth at the city market.

Shamam wishes to sell more clothes and increase her working capital. With the requested loan she plans to purchase more clothing and increase her trade. As a result Shamam will increase her income and be able to insure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is a 27-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and her only daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her parents are pensioners and they help by looking after her daughter, giving Battsetseg a chance to work full time. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Battsetseg runs a garment and underwear retail business. Once a month she travels to China to buy her products at wholesale price and resells them to customers. We see that her business is improving dramatically in recent years. 

In spring 2010, she started a building project for the family house. The house is half complete. The basement and walls are erected. This year, she is planning to complete the building project, but she lacks funding. Battsetseg is planning to build her house greener than ordinary houses. She wants to put foam insulation materials between the walls and roof, and also to install double glazed windows to make the house more insulated from the cold and wind. She is also planning to install an efficient central heating system in the house to save on heating costs. She says all these additional things will make the house warm, cost effective and green in terms of smoke emission. She is asking for a loan to buy necessary building materials and recruit a builder to complete her building project.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials and recruit a builder to complete her building project

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: Le client Bembeleza, représentant du groupe d’affaire « Ahadi », est entrepreneur, âgé de 34 ans, marié, père de 5 enfants, tous étudient. il est vendeur de souliers. Il s’entraide mutuellement dans les affaires  avec son epouse dans la vente de souliers  au marché central de Virunga. Il ya 3 ans révolus qu’il exerce cette activité avec son epouse. Cependant, il démarrait son activité avec un fonds reçu de son beau père sous forme d’assistance non remboursable. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter  35 paires de souliers à revendre. En plus, il ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et avoir sa propre parcelle. Le client, représentant du groupe d'affaires Ahadi, remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres et gagnes petits exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «Ahadi» est majoritairement féminins. Parfois, les maris (hommes)agissent valablement au nom de leurs femmes lors des opérations de remboursement et d’octroi de crédit pour la bonne marche des affaires.
texts.en:
Representing the loan group "Ahadi" is a businessman aged 34, married and the father of five children, all enrolled in school. Hesells shoes. He and his wife work at selling shoes together at the Virunga central open-air market.   

They have been working at this business together for three years. They were able to start it up with money given them by their father as a gift, not a loan. The present loan will be used to buy 35 pairs of shoes for resale. Moreover, they would like to grow their business, pay school fees for their children, and have their own plot of land. 

This client, who represents the Ahadi group, thanks Hekima for its work on behalf of the poor and of those who earn little, who are excluded from the conventional banking system. It must be noted that the business group "Ahadi" is mostly made up of women. Sometimes husbands are authorized to act in the name of their wives when repayments are made or the loan amount is handed over, to facilitate such transactions.

loans.use: to buy 35 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag is a 58-year-old widower, who lives with his young son in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Songino-Hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ganhuyag manages a public transportation business. He started his business in 2008 and gained much experience. He is planning to continue his business in the future. He is an honest man who says, "I would like to make some repair work in my car." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to fix his fence.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to fix his fence

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is married and has three children. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Rano sells blinds and curtains. She has been in this business for eight years and she owns the business. Now she plans to purchase a new assortment of goods and for this she has requested a loan of 9,000 TJS.  
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new blinds and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher lives in Yerevan together with his wife, mother and daughter. He sells men’s clothing, which is the family’s main source of income. His wife helps him in the business.

Mher needs to refresh his stock of clothing so he can offer his clientele continuous good service. The loan will help Mher generate more income and cover the family’s daily costs.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar is 47 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Dornod province of Mongolia. His daughter, age 13, goes to a local secondary school. His wife works as a cleaner. 

He manages a shoe-repair business in his backyard. He started his business based on his work experience in 1996. He specialized in rebuilding shoes with materials that are as good if not better than the original materials. He provides a variety of services including shining, suede conditioning, reheeling, resoling, strap repair, strap shortening, and restitching. 

He is a polite man who is planning to continue his business in the future. He is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase shoe parts and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase shoe parts and materials.

loans.name: Tuydi

texts.ru: Туйди житель Яванского района. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. А сын зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. Сам он более 18 лет занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи. Кроме того он сажает фруктовые деревья, то есть занимается садоводством. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Tuydi lives in Yavan. He is 54 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. His son is a day laborer in construction.  He has been farming for more than eighteen years. Primarily he grows vegetables. Additionally, he grows fruit trees; that is to say he has an orchard. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a 39-year-old farmer from the village of Ninotsminda. He lives with his wife Lucine, two sons (7 and 5 years old) and his mother. Armen works as a provider in a local hospital. Besides his regular job, he is actively involved in the family agricultural businesses. The family owns two milk cows. The dairy products from the cows are sold locally. The family also has 25 beehives with bee colonies. Honey is sold locally to the retailers. Along with the above-mentioned, they own an agricultural plot (.15 hectare) where they grow potatoes. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to the retailers. 

With the requested loan, Armen will purchase 700 kg seeds for potatoes and start sowing. Part of the profit will be used to purchase additional beehives and bee colonies.

loans.use: to purchase seed to grow potatoes

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
This Kiva client lives in Yerevan together with her husband and son, who is serving in the army. She trades in women’s clothing and shoes, and her business is the family’s main source of income.

She would like to expand the business by offering more variety in the items of clothing she offers. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase clothes and shoes and increase her trade. With the loan’s help, the client will increase her income and will be able to ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothing and shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg is 54 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. 

She manages a vegetable and fruit trading business with the help of her husband. She started her business at a rented booth at a local market in 1995. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to make her booth into small store. She is planning to expand and continue her business in the future. 

She is a polite and friendly woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skill. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase an abundant amount of vegetables and fruits in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase an abundant amount of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.en:
Safarmo is married and the loving mother of her two children. Her husband is a master. 

Safarmo works hard to provide for her family. At the present time, she has her own place at the market where she sells children’s clothes and manufactured goods. 

She has been in this business for six years and she would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase new children’s clothes. She thanks all lenders who will support her and allow her to increase the assortment of her goods as this will attract more customers. 
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes.

loans.name: Erdenesolongo

texts.en:
Erdenesolongo is 26 years old and lives with her daughter and parents in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her daughter is five years old and attends kindergarten. 

Erdenesolongo manages a clothing-trading business in her town. She started her business in 2010. 

Before she started her clothing business, she used to conduct a grocery-trading business at a rented booth. Back then, her business was unprofitable and stagnant. So she decided to start a mobile clothing-trading business in her town. 

First she collects her customer's orders and then she brings the products. This kind of business is quite profitable in her town. She managed to build a house with her earnings a year ago. 

She is a polite and hardworking lady who attributes her success to her good communication skill. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 56 years old and married to Duncan Wamugunda. The couple has five children. For the past eight years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town. Her customers are community members and people who operate in the same market. 

Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends. This will be her first loan and she will use the money to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

In future, Jane hopes to expand her business and sell fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetable to sell

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is an ambitious 21-year-old young man. He started to work and support himself when he was young so that he could save for his future to get a house and to have a family. He built a special tent to sell watermelon and vegetables based on the season.

Hamzah started his own business four years ago selling different kinds of vegetables (mainly watermelon) and has been successfully running since then. People trust buying from his because he makes sure that his vegetables are always fresh and his prices are reasonable. After having good experience in this field, Hamzah has applied for a new loan to expand his business by opening another branch in another area and to start selling fruits in addition to vegetables.

loans.use: To open another branch to sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adiyajav

texts.en:
Adiyajav is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. His daughter is three years old and goes to kindergarten. Adiyajav manages a transportation service business in his town. He started his business three years ago after working with his father for several years. Adiyajav transports coal, wood, luggage, and goods from local markets to his customers’ homes. He is a safe and reliable driver who provides a quick and cheap service for his customers. 

Adiyajav is a hardworking and polite man who possesses good managerial skills. He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts. In the future, he is planning to purchase a much bigger truck.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: This Kiva client trades in men’s clothing from a rented booth at the city market. To continue running the business, she needs to purchase new clothing inventory. This is the client’s second loan from Kiva, and, like her first one, it will allow her to continue running her business successfully, increase her work capital, and ensure profit stability.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri is 29 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Dornod province, Mongolia. His son is six years old and attends kindergarten and his wife works as an officer at NGO. Since 2009, Batsuuri has managed a transportation service business that runs between Dornod province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He transports coal, wood, metal and other items. 

Batsuuri is a hardworking man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skills. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase new truck. Batsuuri is planning to expand his business and also to open a grocery store near his home.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 29 and married to Salome. The couple has been blessed with one child. For the past 21 years, Michael has been selling shoes in an open air market in Nairobi. 

Michael is requesting his sixth loan from KADET LTD to buy more shoes to sell. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. Michael hopes to open another outlet with the anticipated profits from his loan and to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase five bales of shoes to sell

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
This Kiva client runs a small car wash business that uses Karcher washing machinery. He has built a garage next to the car wash, and he would like to operate a garage business there. To start operating this new business, he needs to purchase necessary instruments and tools. 

The income from the business improve the quality of life for the client’s family. He and his wife have two children.

loans.use: to purchase necessary instruments and tools for his garage business

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством, а также у него имеется виноградник. В основном он выращивает виноград и овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и саженцев.
texts.en: Kamoliddin lives in Yavan. Hi is 41 years old and married. He has a secondary education. He is a farmer, and he also has a vineyard. Basically he grows grapes and vegetables. He has been doing this work for twenty years. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Makindye Development Group

texts.en:
Seguya is 45 and the happily married mother of five buoyant and high-spirited kids who all go to schools in and around Kampala. For the last five years, she has run a used clothing business in the biggest market in Kampala. Seguya says she has been able to provide for her family with earnings from this business. As anyone in Kampala would testify, business in this boisterous market is good and the market is highly popular with all communities in Kampala. In addition, other people from Uganda frequently visit it to buy the cheap second-hand commodities that are sold there. 

Seguya began her business under the financial auspices of her brother and she currently generates a monthly profit of 700,000 UGX. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of used clothing to sell. This is a group loan, and one of the clients, named Aisha, is partly obscured in this photo and another client, named Moses, is not pictured. Seguya, who is the lead client of this group, is in the front row wearing a red t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is a 36-year-old farmer from the village of Kotelia, Akhalkalaki District. Nargiz is married and lives with her husband and three children: a 16-year-old son and 13- and 7-year-old daughters. Both of her daughters have health problems and receive pensions for persons with disabilities from the government. 

Nargiz and his husband Zurab have four milk cows. They sell milk to the milk collection center in the same village. Also they have 4.5 ha of land. 0.6 ha is used for growing potatoes and 1.0 ha is used for growing wheat. Part of the harvested vegetables is sold locally and the bigger part is sold in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. 

Approximately 50% of the requested loan will be used to purchase fertilizers. With the remaining 50%, she will purchase diesel for the tractor to till the land. 

According to Nargiz and Zurab’s estimations, after fertilization they will have a better crop, which will be sold for a good price. The received income will be used for treatment for their daughters.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and diesel fuel

loans.name: Peter Njuguna

texts.en:
Peter, aged 32, is married to Josephine, and they are blessed with two children, 12 and 18 years old.

He practices farming. He grows crops and also keeps livestock, which he has been doing for the last 20 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 36,650.

This is his third loan from KADET Ltd. He has successfully managed to repay the previous loans.

He intends to use the loan funds to purchase a dairy cow to start producing milk for sale. 

Peter hopes to educate his children and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives together with her husband, parents-in-law and two children.

In a rented factory space she makes bed linens. To meet the increased demand Anna needs to purchase necessary fabrics and other materials. With the loan’s help Anna will increase her trade and income.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics and other materials.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 20 years old and married, with two children. One of the children goes to school. 

Sarah currently sells sugar, oil and rice. She borrowed a loan to stock more sugar, oil and rice to sell. 

She hopes to open a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more sugar, oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Sattor

texts.ru: Саттор проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него 7 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам он занимается растениеводством. Арендует участок земли, где сеет рис и выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 25 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Sattor lives in Shahrituz. He is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife is a housewife, and his son is in the Russian Federation. He is a farmer. He rents a plot of land ground where he grows rice and vegetables for sale. He has been doing this for 25 years. He is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a gas balloon for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a gas balloon for his car.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Khurshed is married and has one child. His family lives in Kurgantyube. 

Khurshed has a grocery store and sells food items. His business boasts fresh groceries, reasonable prices, flexible and quality client service, and uniqueness and variety of merchandise. Khurshed works hard to develop his business and make his business profitable. 

Khurshed is requesting a loan of 13,500 TJS to reconstruct and modernize his grocery store to increase turnover capital and purchase an assortment of goods for retail sale. Khurshed is planning to use the generated profit to buy a new vehicle and remodel his private house. 

Khurshed is a conscientious and focused manager of his resources and always plans his time and finances. In all his business dealings, he is guided by a sense of trust and goodwill towards others. We believe these qualities will help him repay his loan without any delinquencies.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to modernize his store and purchase more items for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more beans and cow-peas to sell.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Rugiatu, who is married and has one child aged two years. In 2007, Rugiatu established her food (Tea & Achekeh) business as a means of earning income for herself and her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month.

Rugiatu would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy provisions such as milk, sugar, tea and garri (used to prepare Achekeh). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Rugiatu plans to open a restaurant, employ workers to run the shop, and educate her children. Very determined and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as milk, sugar, tea and garri for her business.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.en: Suhrobjon is married with three children. He sells food items. His grocery store is located in a very busy place, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries from Suhrobjon. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. Suhrobjon has been running this business for 15 years. Lending services from IMON International have promoted the expansion of his small venture. Suhrobjon’s business is the only source of income for his family. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet the needs of his family. Today he is requesting a loan of 12,000 Somoni to purchase a new refrigerator to keep the product he sells in his grocery store fresh. Suhrobjon is hoping that from the profit of his business, he can expand his grocery store. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator to keep the product he sells in his grocery store fresh.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 44 years old and a mother of two children, aged 28 years and 13 years old. She has rental houses as her primary business, which she has been doing for 11 years. Besides this, she also sells porridge in the Dallas Kangemi area. 

Pauline plans to buy iron sheets for 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs), nails and paint for Kshs 20,000 and timber for Kshs 25,000. With the returns from her business, she wants to expand the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs), nails and paint for Kshs 20,000 and timber for Kshs 25,000.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a gas balloon for her car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more rice, sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Ghazar G

texts.en: The client lives in Zovasar village, Aragatsotn region, together with his family of five members. He is engaged in agriculture. Living in a mountainous region with tough climate makes the living quite challenging.  For most of the locals, it is the livestock and potato fields that serve as a source of income.  The client keeps livestock and cultivates the land. He would like to increase the livestock and develop agriculture. With the increased income, the client will improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Zaton

texts.en: Zaton sells  beans and onions.She is 38 years old, married,with 5 children. 4 of the children go to school. Zaton is asking for a loan to stock more beans and onions to sell. Zaton hopes to buy goats in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is a thirty year old married woman with four children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in produce for six years.  Eliza  lacks capital. She is asking for a loan to buy cassava flour to sell. Eliza's vision is to own a food store.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan sells beans, simsim (sesame) and maize. She is 26 years old, married and has 1 child. Susan is asking a loan to stock more beans, simsim and maize to sell. She hopes to open a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more beans, simsim (sesame) and maize to sell.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is a forty-five year-old single mother with two children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the clothing business for ten years and started with 2,000,000 shillings.  She now has 20,000,000 shillings as working capital. Her challenge is theft.  Her vision is to start up a new shop. 

Sophie wants the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, fish, margi, pepper, salt, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: This client lives in Zovasar village, Aragatsotn region, with her family of six members. The client is engaged in agriculture, which is her family’s main source of income. The client wants to increase her livestock and develop agriculture. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase more livestock and forage. With the loan’s help, the client will increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, rice and other food items.

loans.name: Kapili

texts.en: Kapili is a forty-eight year-old divorced woman with seven children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for eight years. She started with 280,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her challenge is lack of enough capital.  Her vision is to expand her business and to complete construction of the house.  Kapili needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anatori

texts.en: Anatori is a forty-three year-old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in carpentry for eighteen years.  He started with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. His challenges are an increase in timber prices and debtors.  His vision is to have an electrical machine and to educate his children.  Anotori needs the loan to buy mahogany timber.

loans.use: to buy mahogany timber .

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a thirty eight year old married woman with  two children.  She owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has had a retail business for three years. Joy needs a loan  to buy clothes and shoes for her shop. Her vision is to educate her children and to  have a wholesale shop to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, a 27-year-old married father of four children, has been selling curios along Kijabe Street in Nairobi for five years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 21,000.  This will be his first loan from KADET LTD with which he intends to buy more curios such as beads, flower pots, etc. for resale.  Charles hopes to generate another business from the anticipated profits and join a group of international curio exporters in the future.

loans.use: to buy more curios.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bricks for sale.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: This client lives in Sisian together with her son and daughter-in-law. She works at school as a teacher. Unfortunately, her teacher’s salary is too low to meet the family needs. The client is also engaged in agriculture. She wants to increase her livestock and cultivate her land. With the requested loan, the client plans to purchase two calves and a special sort of potato seed. With the loan’s help, the client will increase her income and insure better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for calves and special potato seeds

loans.name: Bikwasire

texts.en:
Bikwasire is a 30 year-old married father of 7 children, aged 8 to 2 years. His wife is a housewife, which makes him the only income earner in the family. He lives with his family in his own home in Karuguuza, Uganda. He runs a retail shop and has been doing it for 8 years. He has been able to buy land and build a house from this business and he wishes in future to upgrade his business to a wholesale business. 

Bikwasire needs a loan to purchase general store items like sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar. salt, cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet sells rice, sugar and onions.  She is 40 years old and married, with 2 children.  Both of them go to school.  

Janet requested a loan to stock more rice, sugar and onions to sell.  She hopes to open a wholesale enterprise in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more rice, sugar and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap making materials in order to produce more Africana soap for sale

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 34 year-old father of 9 children, aged 1-16 years.   He is the sole bread winner for his family of 11 people, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He works tirelessly to see that his family's welfare is well taken care of.  His goal is to pay school fees for his children.  

For 7 years, he has been operating a retail shop, and from it he has been able to buy land and build a family house, despite the challenges of inadequate capital.  Leonard needs a loan to purchase general store items for resale.

loans.use: to purchase general store items like sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her stock of fish

loans.name: Yusifu S.

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Yusifu, a married father of two children aged 3 and 15 years. In 1989, Yusifu established his ready-made items business as a means of generating income to support his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 950,000 every month. 

Having already received and repaid one loan, Yusifu is requesting a new one in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to buy more ready-made clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Yusifu plans to open a shop for his wife, buy a car for commercial use, and educate his children to college level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ready-made clothing for his business.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
This Kiva client trades in electrical and bathroom accessories for home construction. The income generated from his business is the main source of income for the client’s family, including his wife and pensioner parents. 

He would like to increase sales and develop his business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase a new stock of merchandise, thus increasing working capital.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of merchandise

loans.name: Kusiima Women Group

texts.en:
Frida is 40 years old and a single mother of 2 children, aged 8 and 14.  She is the leader of Kusiima Women's group. She lives with her 2 children in her own house in Hoima, Uganda, and her dream is to educate her children up to university. 

She owns a salon and has been running it for the past 10 years. It is with profits from this salon that she has been able to build her current home despite challenges of high prices due to a high inflation rate. Frida needs a loan to buy hair dryers.

loans.use: to purchase hair dryers

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Laneh Kuru” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Wara is the leader of this group.  Wara is 40 yeas old and married, with three children who are no longer attending school. Wara sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Wara will invest in her business by buying gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc., in order to produce a large number of gara cloths for sale.

loans.use: to buy gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. in order to produce a large number of gara cloths for sale

loans.name: Alozious

texts.en:
Alozious wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. Aged 31 years, Alozious hails from Kyenjojo District of Uganda.  He is a father of eight children.  He lives with them and their mother in a semi-permanent house. 

Having acquired his first motorcycle from timber sales, he dreams of owning at least six motorcycles over the years.  He would also like to start up a bar as another source of income.  Alozious needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
This Kiva client lives in the village of Verishen in the region of Syunik, together with her daughter. Her husband has passed away, making it challenging for her, as a widow and as a woman, to manage all the difficulties of village life. 

She is engaged in agriculture, and her work is the family’s main source of income. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase two cows. With the additional income generated from this investment, she will be able to support the family and pay for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Arshiraph

texts.en:
Arshiraph, 38, is a Ugandan man who needs a loan to buy cows for his butcher shop and dry produce for a business that he has operated for 5 years. He hails from the Kyenjojo district, is a father of six, and lives in a semi-permanent house with six people that he takes care of. 

He dreams of acquiring land to set up a good tea garden, and of educating his children. 

He acquired his initial capital from growing bananas and savings from the sale of the same.

loans.use: To buy cows for his butcher shop and dry produce for resale

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, 27, is married to Lilian and they are blessed with one child who is one year old. 

He owns a curio shop in Westlands where for the last three years he has been selling a variety of curios. The business earns him a monthly income of 19,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. with which he wants to buy more curios for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to build a house for his family and hopes to have another curio shop.

loans.use: to buy more curios for resale

loans.name: Sasunik

texts.en:
This Kiva client is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. He would like to increase his livestock and further develop his  agricultural efforts. 

With the requested loan, he plans to purchase calves. 

Expanding his agricultural efforts will help this client to increase his income and ensure better living conditions for his family. He lives with his family of five members.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen, a mother of four, is married and hails from the Kyenjojo district. She is 39. She needs a loan to purchase clothes for resale. She owns a boutique and offers bridal services. 

She dreams of educating her children and completing the commercial house she is building so that she can earn an extra income from it. She acquired her initial capital from her husband.

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's wear for resale in her boutique

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a 36-year-old Ugandan man, needs a loan to buy a bicycle and motorcycle spare parts for resale in his shop that he has operated for three years. 

He is a father of four and hails from the Kyenjojo district. His wife sells fresh foods in the same area. He lives in a semi-permanent house with six people that he takes care of; he dreams of acquiring land on which to build a  house and of educating his child. 

He acquired his initial capital from maize faming from which he accumulated his savings to start off the shop and faces a problem of price increases in spare parts.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a fifty-five-year-old married man with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been working in agriculture for five years. He started his business with 1,500,000 shillings and the business has grown to a value of 9,000,000 shillings. His biggest challenge is the lack of capital.  His vision is to become a famous commercial farmer. Charles needs the loan to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seasonings in large quantities to sell in her business.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a thirty-three-year-old married man with one child. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Tom has been dealing in stationery and computer services for three years. He started with one computer and capital of 800,000 shillings and now has two computers, a scanner, two printers and a binding machine. He has limited funds to meet his expenses. His vision is to own a big staionery firm and to build a house. Tom wants the loan to buy stationery materials.

loans.use: to buy stationery materials

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old, married to Andrew, and has four children. She has been knitting sweaters and school uniforms as a primary business. She also sells rice to her customers in Mwiki. She earns an income of KES. 22,700 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use the entire loan amount to buy knitting wools and to buy rice to sell. She will use the generated profit to invest in the rice business.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy knitting wools and rice to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a forty-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the hotel business for eight years. She started with 100,000 shillings and now has 800,000 shillings. Her biggest obstacle is lack of capital. Her vision is to own a big restuarant in town and educate her children. Janet needs the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Living

texts.en:
Living is a 27-year-old married man with three children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been charging batteries for two years. He started with 600,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. His vision is to have an electronics shop plus an educated family. Living intends to use the credit to buy a photocopier.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for selling.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for 20 years. She started with capital of 700,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is debtors, and her vision is a bigger business plus educating her children. Margret needs the loan to buy hair chemicals and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last one year, Margaret has been keeping poultry and also offers outside catering services. She is 38 years old and married to David. They are blessed with three children.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI (microfinance institution). She is applying for her first loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy poultry feeds. The anticipated profit, she will use to improve her family's living standards.

In the future, she hopes to venture into greenhouse farming so as to ensure there is food security in the country.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
