Harriet is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, and their desire is to educate their children until they attain a degree as a minimum qualification. 

She has had a retail shop for four years, and the business is profitable despite the hardship of limited funds for capital. Her vision is to have a wholesale business. Harriet needs the loan to buy sodas, Omo (detergent) and flour for selling.

loans.use: To buy sodas, Omo (detergent) and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla, 31 years old, is married to Nidal who is a taxi driver. They live in Madaba with their five children in a rented house. Khawla started a year ago selling different types of home supplies, as shown in the photo. She does this to help her husband support their family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more goods and open her own home supplies store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more home supplies to sell

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
For five years Peris has been managing rental houses as her primary business, and she also operates a posho mill (grinds maize into corn flour). She gets an income of about $285 per month. She is 60 years old and the mother of two children who are all grown up. 

She has applied for her second loan and she plans to use the entire loan amount to complete the construction of a rental house that is halfway done. With the anticipated income she will invest to build more rental houses.

In future she hopes to grow her business and build over twenty rental houses.

loans.use: to complete the construction of a house.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 49-year-old hardworking widow and the mother of five children between the ages of 20 and 28, three of whom are working. She also has two other dependents. She lives with a family of six at her own home in Hoima, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her young children and to build more houses to rent. 

She runs a retail shop and has been doing it for the past six years. She started the shop from her rental income. She faces the challenge of a high default rate, and hopes to build more rental houses. Claudia needs the loan to renovate her houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a forty-one-year-old married woman with four children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has a been in the hotel business for seven years, which she started by selling produce and saving enough money to start a hotel. Her hardships are limited funds and market fluctuations and her vision is a bigger hotel plus a well educated family. Joyce needs the loan facility to buy rice, cassava flour, cooking oil and beans.

loans.use: to buy rice, cassava flour, cooking oil and beans.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 49-year-old single woman who supports her mother and her sisters' children. For four years, she has been selling secondhand clothes, and at the same time she manages rental houses.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a friend. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

In future she plans to grow her business, buy another plot of land to build more rental houses and also to educate the children that she supports.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik is 28 years old and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10. Malik’s spouse is a housewife and he lives with his family of 5 in his own home. His family goal is to build more houses and his home address is Hoima, Uganda. 

For ten years this hardworking father has been operating a business of art and design. He started by making paper stamps and later diversified to T-shirt making. He faces a challenge of clients not paying on time. He hopes in future to capture a wider market in order to be able to add more art items to his business. Malik needs a loan to purchase T-shirts and printing chemicals.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts and chemicals for his art shop.

loans.name: Luganda Kulya Women's Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Aisha has been plying her clothing sales business in Kampala for close to five years. The happily married mother of three bubbling kids says she began this business with persuasion from her sister. She had no previous business experience but she was undeterred in her desire to take root. The pep talk from her friends contributed a lot, too. This determined tenacity, coupled with her personal abilities, are calling cards which will count a lot as she continues on her business Journey. 

She says this business generates approximately $42 a month in profits.  Aisha says that with this loan she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to resell. Two female clients by the names of Sarah and Rehema had their faces partly obscured when the group photo was taken. I have marked them as not pictured. Aisha, the group leader, is the lady with the white blouse seated in the front row.

loans.use: to purchase of more bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en: Fatina is a thirty-year-old single mother of four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in agriculture for two years, which she started with one acre of maize, and now she has three acres. Her hardships are climatic changes and high transport costs, and her vision is to establish a produce store. Fatina needs the loan to pay laborers to weed her fields.

loans.use: to pay laborers to weed her fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been selling shoes as a primary business, with a sideline of secondhand clothes, for the last 12 years. He earns an income of KES 15,000 per month. Peter is 34 years old, married to Marietta and they do not yet have children.

Peter learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer, and he is applying for his fourth loan after repaying the previous ones well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more shoes and secondhand clothes for sale. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes and secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius has been running a retail shop for 14 years in Ngalaiya Tala and he earns an income of KES 10,000 per month. He is 48 years old, married to Muthiani, and they do not have children yet.

Pius has never borrowed from any other MFI and has good credit history with KADET LTD. This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy cooking fat, sugar, flour and tea leaves for sale. Pius will reinvest the income generated from this loan back into the business. In the future, he desires to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, flour and tea leaves.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana trabaja como secretaria en un estudio jurídico. El crédito lo requiere para comprar una computadora portátil esto para que sus hijos realicen sus trabajos de colegio con mayor rapidez. Vive en alquiler en la casa de sus abuelos  la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Los Pinos de la ciudad de La Paz;  es casada  y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana works as a secretary at a law firm. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a laptop computer so that her children can complete their schoolwork more quickly. Ana lives with her grandparents in a rented house located in the District of Los Pinos in the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer so that her children can complete their schoolwork.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a hard-working mother of two children aged four and seven. Her spouse is a driver and they have no other dependents. Justine lives with her husband and their two children in her own home at Mparo Hoima. Her family's goal is to educate their children. 

She has been operating a retail shop for nine years, however she faces stiff competition. Justine sold her cow in order to get capital for starting the business and she would like her business to grow into a wholesale shop. Justine needs a loan to purchase general store items like sugar, soap, salt & rice.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize, salt, & rice.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es:
Patrocinia, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y ropa, vive con su esposo y tienen 3 hijos. El negocio de ella es el comercio de ropa que lo realiza durante la semana en horas del día, por las tardes vende pupusas.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar la pupusas como, quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, condimentos, también compra de ropa como faldas, blusas, ropa interior.
Este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y generar mayores ganancias, el sueño de ella es poder obtener su propia casa, para vivir dignamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Patrocinia sells pupusas and clothes. She lives with her husband and they have three children. Patrocinia sells clothes throughout the week during the day and then sells pupusas in the evenings.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for preparing pupusas such as cheese, pork, corn, and condiments. Patrocinia will also buy clothes such as skirts, blouses, and undergarments.

This loan will help strengthen her businesses so that she can generate more income. Her dream is to obtain her own house so that her family can live decently.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, es empleado y al mismo tiempo vende medicinas, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, él trabaja como seguridad y vende medicinas en catalogo, parte de sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo.
Actualmente necesita comprar un lote de medicinas, con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de cancelar un nuevo lote de medicamento y diversificar sus productos.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia, donde vivir con su familia de una forma digna.
texts.en:
Miguel is employed and also has a business selling medicines. He and his wife do not have children.

Miguel works as a security guard and also sells medicines through a catalog. Some of his customers are his coworkers. He currently needs to buy a shipment of medicines. With this loan, he will have the opportunity to place a new order of medicines and diversify his products.

His dream is to have a house of his own so that his family can live in a decent manner.

loans.use: to pay for a new shipment of medicines.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana Maria se dedica a la venta de leña, bananos y hielo. Tiene más de 11 años con su negocio, por lo que disfruta de tener un ingreso diario. Su negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a su hijo que necesita vestimenta, educación y alimento. Es una persona muy tranquila y disfruta de tener este medio de vida para poder sobrevivir. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leña, bananos y bolsas para hacer hielo. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día de una manera muy humilde y luchadora.
texts.en:
Juana Maria sells firewood, bananas and ice. She has been running this business for more than 11 years, so she has daily income. She began the business to help her son, who needs clothing, education and food.

Juana María is a very calm person, and she enjoys having this means to get by. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy firewood, bananas and bags for making ice. She dreams of increasing her income each day in a humble and hardworking way.

loans.use: to buy wood, bananas and bags for making ice

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Asunta;  La socia tiene 44 años de edad; La socia es casada;  La socia  tiene 4 hijos varones y 1 mujer; La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su negocio la socia tiene una picantería (tienda en la que se expende diferentes tipos de platillos, están desde los tradicionales platos tres en uno, hasta los choclos con queso y ensalada; lo peculiar de estas picanterías es que en ellas se puede probar las bebidas hechas a base de maíz y fresas, llamadas frutilladas); la socia en esta ocasión desea implementar su picantería desde la compra de más servicios como platos se segundos, vasos para las bebidas los famosos caporales que son vasos grandes y anchos una réplica de los keros, los vasos de los inkas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de servicios para el negocio.  

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” [Working Mothers] community bank. This bank is located in the district of Tica Tica, province of Cuzco, departament of Cuzco.

This member is named Asunta. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 sons and 1 daughter. She alternates her activities between the home and attending to her business. She has a picantería, a store that sells different types of small dishes, from traditional thre in one dishes, to corn with cheese and salad. What is particular about these picanterías is that you can try beverages made from corn and strawberries, called frutilladas. Asunta decided to outfit her picantería at this time. She will buy materials such as plates, glasses for the beverages called "caporales", which are large, thick glasses that are a replica of the "keros", the glasses the Incas used. She will use the loan to buy these materials.   

Asunta is satisfied with the loan and is committed to making the payment according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for her business

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia, se dedica a la venta de artesanías, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 8 años de edad, ella vende en las escuelas de los pueblos, su mercadería son juguetes, pulseras, lápices y artesanías, lo realiza desde hace 10 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  más mercadería, como artesanías, collares, pulceras, llaveros y accesorios para los jóvenes estudiantes, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
Su aspiración es ser una comerciante estable, tener un local fijo para ofrecer la mercadería.
texts.en:
Claudia sells crafts. She lives with her husband and an 8-year-old son. She makes sales in the towns' schools, and her merchandise is toys, bracelets, pencils and crafts. She has been doing this for 10 years.

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like crafts, necklaces, bracelets, key rings and accessories for young students. This loan will help her to increase her family's income.

Her dream is to be a stable businesswoman with a storefront to sell her merchandise from.

loans.use: to buy crafts, necklaces, bracelets and key rings.

loans.name: Ramiro Eduardo

texts.es:
Ramiro de 32 años,  vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa trabaja en un comedor la cual es un negocio familiar y tienen 2 hijos de 3 y 2 años. Tiene una panadería.

En la actualidad es asalariado y con el préstamo quiere implementar su panaderia en la casa, labora en el negocio en las tardes ya que la mama lo ayuda en las mañana. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en su negocio de panadería, es decir comprar harina, lacteos, huevos para hacer mas panes. En un futuro quiere tener su casa propia, que su negocio crezca y su esposa pueda estar en el y seguir con D-miro.
texts.en: Ramiro, aged 32, lives in the built-up area of El Guasmo. (The name is derived from Guazuma ulmifolia, the scientific name of a species of trees that is known by the common name of bastard cedar or bay cedar.) El Guasmo was formerly a ranch. Now it is a working-class neighborhood of Guayaquil with people of humble origin. Ramiro lives in a house built with cement, where all basic utilities are available. His wife works in a cafeteria, which is a family business. They have two children, aged 3 and 2. Ramiro owns a bakery. He is currently employed. He wants to use the loan to install his bakery at home. He works in his business in the afternoon, while his mother helps him in the morning. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to invest in his bakery and buy flour, milk and eggs to produce more bread. For the future he has several goals: he wants to become a home-owner, his business should expand, his wife can work in it, and he wants to stay with the microfinance institution D-MIRO.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk and eggs for his bakery.

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 3 años, él se dedica a la venta de ropa, lleva tres años y medio de dedicarse al negocio, el cual lo hace de forma ambulante, junto a su esposa recorren las calles de la ciudad de 7:00am a 2:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, blusas y ropa para niños, esta inversión le ayudara para crear mayores ventas, ya que al surtir el negocio  los clientes tienen mejores opciones para escoger las prendas de vestir.
Su aspiración es en el futuro comprarse un lote para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
José, 28, lives with his wife and 3-year-old daughter.  He sells clothes.  He’s been in this business for three and a half years.  He works as a street vendor.  He and his wife wander through the streets from 7am until 2pm.

He is asking for the loan to buy pants, blouses and children’s clothes.  This investment will help him create larger sales since having the business better stocked will provide better options of clothing items to choose for his customers.  

His wish for the future is to buy a lot to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen de 56 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta separada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad que están casados. Ella tiene su negocio de confecciones.

Comenzó esta actividad porque desde muy joven le enseñaron y luego una persona muy amable le provee materia prima y es así como ella empezó su actividad. Ella no tiene un horario determinado ya que ella tiene que cumplir con su contrato, existen días donde solo se dedica a su casa y otros a su actividad comercial. 

Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales para su vivienda y memas mercadería para su negocio. En un futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen, 56, lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio in Guayaquil.  She’s separated and has five adult, married children.  She has a Dressmaking business.

She started this occupation because she learned it very young and a very kind person provides her with raw materials and that’s how she got into this activity.  She does not have a set work schedule because she has to fulfill her contract.  There are days when she only does her housework and others when she does her commercial activities.

With help from the loan she wants to buy materials for her house and more merchandise for her business.  In the future she’d like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread and to do home improvements buying building materials like cement, bricks and lumber.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Tica Tica, provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nicasia;  La socia tiene 56 años D. edad; La socia es casada;  La socia tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son independientes; La socia tiene un puesto ambulatorio D. venta D. golosinas, la socia venD. en la esquina del colegio Civirichi todo tipo D. golosinas en una carreta, ella venD. también galletas, dulces, papitas fritas, canchitas, habitas saladas, kekes entre otras golosinas. La socia suele pedir que le otorguen el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería y D. este modo implementar su carreta y abastecer a los niños y jóvenes que son sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. golosinas para implementar su carreta. 

 La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "Working Mothers" communal bank.  This bank is located in the Tica Tica district, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.
The associate is Señora Nicasia.  She is 56 years of age and married with 2 children who are already independent.  The associate has a mobile cart for the sale of sweets.  The associate sells all kinds of delicacies in a wagon at the corner of the Civirichi school.  She also sells cookies, candy, French Fries, popcorn, salted beans, and cakes, among other delicacies.  The associate is accustomed to asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise and in this way stock her wagon to supply the children and youth that are her clients.  The associate requests the loan to invest in the purchase of delicacies for stocking her wagon.  

The associate is satisfied with the loan offered and she promises to comply with the payment schedule in the time limit established.

loans.use: to buy treats to sell from her food cart.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Fredy;  El socio tiene 24 años de edad; El socio es conviviente;  El socio tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad, el socio trabaja de manera independiente prestando el servicio de transporte de taxi, el socio tiene su propia unidad de taxi y requiere el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de llantas y algunos repuestos para su carro, el socio es muy trabajador y poco a poco el compro su casa, su carro y ahora desea darle mantenimiento para que siga creciendo y dando a su familia mejor calidad de vida que el que el socio tuvo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas y repuestos para su taxi.

El socio se encuentra satisfecho con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "WORKING MOTHERS" communal bank.  This bank is located in the district of Tica Tica, province of Cusco, department of Cusco. 

The associate is Señor Fredy.  He is 24 years of age and lives in a shared home.  The associate has one son, 3 years of age. He works as an independent taxi driver.  The associate has his own taxi unit and requires the loan to invest in tires and some repairs for his car.  The associate is very hard-working and little-by-little he bought his house, his car and now he wants to maintain it so that he can continue to grow and give his family the best quality of life that he can. The associate requests the loan to buy tires and pay for repairs to his taxi. 

The associate is satisfied with the loan offered and promised to comply with the payment schedule in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for repairs for his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
María, tiene 56 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y un sobrino D. 13 años D. edad, ella tiene un negocio D. artículos D. primera necesidad,  este surgió debido a la necesidad que tenían en su hogar, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 7:00pm, gracias a este negocio ha logrado mantener su hogar u ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería: harinas, bebidas, detergentes, frijoles y arroz, con esta mercadería podrá surtir el negocio y atender mejor las demandas D. los clientes.
Ella quiere tener el negocio por muchos años más, ayudar a su sobrino en los estudios y pues alcanzar una mejor solvencia.
texts.en: María is 56 years of age.  She lives with her husband and nephew, age 13.  She has a grocery business.  The business arose due to the need that she had in her home.  She tends it from 6:00am to 7:00pm.  Thanks to this business she has managed to maintain her home and help her family.  She requests a loan for the purchase of merchandise: flour, beverages, detergent, beans and rice.  With this merchandise she will be able to supply the business and better tend to the demands of her clients.  She wants to have the business for many more years to help her nephew with his studies and to become more solvent.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as flour, beverages, detergent, beans and rice.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: ETOILE est un groupe de sept personnes, dont les membres appartiennent au même groupe d’artisan et vivent dans la même localité. La représentante du groupe, Lydie Bibiane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 22 décembre 1966 à Sakété dans l’ouémé. Lydie Bibiane est mariée à un instituteur nommé Fagnon. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Lydie Bibiane assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Lydie Bibiane a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, mais a appris ensuite la couture. Lydie Bibiane exerce cette activité depuis dix sept ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Lydie Bibiane vend des fournitures scolaires et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Lydie Bibiane s’approvisionne à cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Lydie Bibiane et son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
ETOILE (STAR) is a group composed of seven persons who belong to the same group of tradespeople and live in the same locality. The representative of the group, Lydie Bibiane, who is raising her hand in the photo, was born on December 22, 1966 in Sakété in the Ouémé district and is married to a teacher by the name of Fagnon. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school and living under their roof. She and her husband share in supporting their family. 

Lydie Bibiane stopped school at the secondary level and then learned to sew. She has been working at this business for seventeen years. Alongside this business, she sells school supplies and charcoal at her house. She buys her supplies in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the first time that Lydie Bibiane and her group have requested the help of ALIDé so as to reinforce their working capital and their businesses and better respond to the needs of their clientele.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing notions.

loans.name: Solidario Kairos Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO KAIROS.

ESTE GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR LAS SIGUIENTES SEÑORAS VILMA ,ETELVINA Y MARTA, VILMA ES MADRE DE DOS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS ,ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS A MANO FAJAS Y GUIPILES, Y TAMBIEN VENDE JUGOS DE NARANJA POR LAS MAÑANAS,SOLICICTA SU CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION DE TEJIDOS. ETELVINA, ELLA SE DEDICA ALA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO ELLA TIENE A UNA PERSONA QUE LA AYUDA A ELABORAR SU PRODUCTO, MARTA OTILIA ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO A ELLA LA AYUDA UNA SU HIJA, LAS TRES NECESITAN SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELAVORACION DE TEJIDOS PORQUE ELLAS EXPRESAN QUE SU PRODUCTO SE VENDE TIENE DEMANDA PERO LO QUE LES HACE FALTA ES MATERIA PRIMA PARA ELABORAR MAS PRODUCTO.
texts.en:
SOLIDARIO KAIROS.

This group is made up of the following ladies: Vilma, Etelvina and Marta.

Vilma is a mother of two young children.  She weaves belts and traditional blouses by hand.  She also sells orange juice in the mornings.  She is requesting her loan to buy raw materials for making her woven products.

Etelvina weaves traditional blouses by hand.  She has one person who helps her to make her products.

Marta Otilia also weaves traditional blouses by hand.  One of her daughters helps her in her work.

The three ladies need this loan so that they can buy raw materials for making their woven products.  They say that they have demand for their products but lack raw materials which they need to make more of them.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving products

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana de 43 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, esta casada y tienen 3 hijos 2 mellizos de 23 años y 1 de 5 años. Tiene una tienda .

Ella comenzó en su negocio hace 20 años gracia a la motivación que le dio su padres, al inicio vendía caramelos pero con el tiempo lo fue surtiendo. Ella labora de 6H00 am a 10H00 pm. Ella vende pollos a $2,00 cada uno por 1.20 libras, arroz 30qq , azúcar 35qq. Con ala ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas productos para su negocio como verduras, abastos, pollos. En un futuro desea surtir mas su negocio y agrandarla y poner una papelería.
texts.en:
Juana, aged 43, lives in the built-up area of El Guasmo. (The name is derived from Guazuma ulmifolia, the scientific name of a species of trees that is known by the common name of bastard cedar or bay cedar.) El Guasmo was formerly a ranch. Now it is a working-class neighborhood of Guayaquil with people of humble origin. Juana lives in a house built with cement, where all basic utilities are available. She is married and the mother of three children, 23-year-old twins and one 5-year-old child.

Juana owns a store. She started her business 20 years ago, thanks to the motivation received from her parents. In the beginning she sold candy, but progressively she added more goods. She works from 6 am to 10 pm. She sells chickens (a chicken of 1.20 pounds for the price of $2.00), rice (30 quintals) and sugar (35 quintals). She wants to use her loan to buy more goods for her store, such as vegetables, basic provisions and chickens. In the future she wants to stock up more goods, expand her store and add a stationary section.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, basic provisions and chickens.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, ella vende pan todas las tardes en los caseríos cercanos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con el bienestar de sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina, huevos y leña, además de otros insumos que son necesarios para elaborar el pan, este préstamo le será muy útil pues no dispone de muchos materiales y espera solventar la situación.
Su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan y darles el estudio, que tengan un hogar estable y velar por sus necesidades.
texts.en:
María lives with her family. She is the mother of two children, aged 4 and 6. She sells bread in the nearby villages every afternoon. She is a hard-working woman and committed to the well-being of her children.

She applies for a loan to buy flour, eggs, firewood and some other ingredients that are needed to make bread. The loan will be very useful to her because she is about to run out of ingredients and she hopes to be able to resolve her situation.

Her dream is to see her children grow up and get a proper education and that she can provide them with a stable home and look after their needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and firewood for her bakery.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a married father of 10 children aged 5-26 years old. Johnson has other dependents and he is the only income earner in the family. Johnson works very hard to provide for his family of 13 people. He lives with them in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. 

His family's goal is to make sure that his children have a better life and get educated. For 15 years he has been running a produce business and he has no significant challenges in this business. He started by farming and then saved to start the business. He hopes his business will improve in the future. Johnson needs the loan to purchase maize for resale.

loans.use: To purchase maize for resale.

loans.name: Marcos Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marcos, es comerciante de cosméticos, vive con dos hijas, es madre soltera trabaja para ayudar a sus hijas en sus estudios y cubrir los gastos mensuales, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal, surgió por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de recibir ingresos.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería como: cremas, prendedores para el pelo y perfumería, le será una gran ayuda esta inversión, pues surtirá el negocio y con mejores oportunidades para vender.
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijas grandes, darles una buena educación que sean profesionales, y con respecto al negocio pues ganar cada día nuevos clientes y más experiencia.
texts.en:
Marcos is a cosmetics merchant.  She lives with two daughters.  She’s a single mother who works to help her daughters with their schooling and to cover monthly expenses.  She has a stand in the municipal market.  It arose through her own initiative because she needed to earn income.

She currently needs a loan to buy merchandise like creams, hairclips and perfumes.  This investment will be a great help to her because she’ll stock the business and will have improved sales opportunities.

She dreams with seeing her daughters all grown up and with giving them a good education so that they can be professionals.  With respect to the business, well that would be to win over new customers daily and to gain more experience.

loans.use: to buy creams, hairclips and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sewing notions, motor oil, and liquid soap.

loans.name: Duo Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO  AMOR D. DIOS
MIRNA Y ROSENDA, MIRNA ES SOLTERA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION D. TEJIDOS EN TELAR Y TAMBIEN FAJAS A MANO, ELLA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA PODER CONFECCIONAR MAS PRODUCTO PORQUE ELLA DICE QUE TIENEN UN PEDIDO PARA ESTA EPOCA Y ES POR ESA RAZON QUE NECESITA SU CREDITO. ROSENDA  ELLA TAMBIEN  ELLA ES CASADA TIENE 4 HIJOS ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. TEJIDOS EN TELAR O SEA A AL ARTESANIA ELLA TAMBIEN NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA HILOS PARA PODER ELABORAR SU PRODUCTO Y PODER TENER DIFERENTES COLORES Y ESTILO
texts.en:
DUO AMOR D. DIOS

Mirna is single and her business is weaving products on a loom.  She also weaves belts by hand.  She needs this loan so that she can buy raw materials for making more products.  She says that she has an order right now and this is why she needs the loan.

Rosenda is married and has four children.  She also weaves products on a loom and also needs a loan to buy raw materials (threads) so that she can make her products and offer different colors and styles.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 35 años de edad; La socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo que tiene en la municipalidad; la socia es miembro integrante de este banco y ella manifiesta que es toda un apoyo ser parte del grupo puesto que cuando ella requiere de un monto para invertirlo en la mejora de su vivienda o comprar algunos artefactos para la casa lo puede pagar en una sola cuota y al banco ir pagando en partes de tal modo que su sueldo puede ser bien distribuido en la educación de su hijo y en la alimentación y otros pagos de servicios básicos del hogar. La socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la vivienda ella manifiesta que desea mejorar su vivienda y está ampliando un ambiente una habitación para ello ella desea el crédito para comprar materiales como cemento, arenas, ladrillos para revestir las paredes, también el techo y el pago al albañil. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda. 

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo que le otorgarán y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” (Working Mothers) communal bank which is located in Tica Tica District, Cusco Province and Department.

The member is 35.  She has a live-in spouse and a 15-year-old son.  She alternates her household chores with a job she has with the city.  She is a member of this bank and she states that it’s quite an advantage to be part of this group because when she needs a slightly higher amount and can’t quite cover it with her salary the bank helps her to pay off all at once and then continue paying the bank bit by bit while still paying for her son’s education without problem.

On this occasion she needs a loan to invest in her home.  She states that she’d like to do some home improvements.  She is enlarging a room and needs the loan to buy the necessary materials.  She requests the loan to invest in her home.

She is satisfied with the granted loan and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tiene un taller de electrónica desde hace dos años, el repara todo tipo de electrodomésticos, aprendió a través del estudio y hoy día realiza su trabajo para sostener su hogar.
Él quiere invertir en la compra de repuestos y prensas para el taller, porque tiene unos trabajos que aun no termina, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra y así tener lo necesario para finalizar lo pendiente y tener para próximos que puedan llegar.
Su objetivo es mantener el trabajo, ampliar el taller y generar cada día mejores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his wife and children.  He has had an electronics repair shop for the last two years.  He repairs all kinds of electrical appliances.  He learned through studies and today does this work to support his family.

He wants to buy parts and clamps for the workshop because he has some unfinished jobs.  He is asking for the loan to do the purchase so that he can have available everything he needs to finish his pending jobs and be ready for the next ones that might arrive.  His objective is to stay in business, enlarge the shop and generate improved income every day for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts and clamps for the shop.

loans.name: Noel Medardo

texts.es: Noel Medardo se dedica a la venta de transporte de carga. Tiene más de 17 años en su negocio, por lo que siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos. Inicio este medio de vida por su Papa el cual le enseño el oficio fue así  que el por iniciativa propia decide comenzar con su negocio. Ha sido muy difícil mantener la actividad, pues el precio de la gasolina no es estable y proporciona pocas ganancias es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de llantas, combustible, focos, mantenimiento entre otros.
texts.en:
Noel Medardo sells cargo transportation services.  He’s been in this line of work for 17 years and is always seeking ways to generate income.  

He started this way of earning his living thanks to his father who taught him the occupation and it was through his own initiative that he decided to start his own business.

It has been very difficult to stay in business because gasoline prices are unstable and his profits are low.  He is, therefore, asking for this loan to buy tires, fuel, headlamps and pay maintenance costs, among others.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel, headlamps and to pay for maintenance costs.

loans.name: Bolivar Eduardo

texts.es:
Bolívar de 40 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta casado y tiene tres hijos y todos ellos estudian, la esposa es ama de casa y le gusta servir en la iglesia evangélica.

El empezó desde muy pequeño le gustaba mucho la reparación de artículos eléctricos que un a vez abrió una radio para ver como se así y la termino dañando pero desde ese entonce eligió esa actividad. El es dependiente aunque en su tiempo libre hace reparaciones de computadoras desde su casa. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere mejorar su vivienda en la compra de materiales para construcción para darle una mejor vida a su familia. Quiere comprar cemento bloques, madera. En un futuro desea darle unos buenos estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bolívar, 40, lives in an urban zone of El Suburbio in Guayaquil.  He’s married and has three children who go to school.  His wife is a housewife and enjoys serving in the Evangelical Church.

He started very young because he liked very much to repair electronic items.  One time he opened up a radio to see how it was made and ended up breaking it.  However, since then he decided to go into this occupation.  He is otherwise employed but in his spare time he repairs computers at home.  

He wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve his home and provide his family with a better quality of life.  He wants to buy cement, concrete blocks and lumber.  In the future he wants to provide good schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, lumber and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es:
Henry, vive con su esposa, él es comerciante tiene 3 años y medio de vender distinta mercadería como bocinas, carteras, controles para televisores y más. Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar más de estos productos: audifonos, lamparas, controles y mejorar su inventario, de esta manera siempre tener la disponibilidad para los clientes.
Él pretende mantenerse en el negocio e ir creciendo poco a poco, para ofrecer un mejor futuro y una vida más confortable con su esposa.
texts.en:
Henry lives with his wife.  He’s been a merchant for three years selling miscellaneous merchandise like speakers, wallets, television remote controls and others.  For the moment, he’s asking for a loan to buy more of these products: earphones, lamps, remote controls, to improve his inventory and always have availability for his customers.

He expects to stay in business and gradually grow to offer a better future and more comfortable life to his wife.

loans.use: to buy music CDs, DVDs, speakers, loudspeakers and other accessories.

loans.name: Roberto Daniel

texts.es:
Roberto de 30 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, tiene un taller de servicios técnicos “maquinaria pesada”, esta casado y ella vende productos por catálogos ropa y comesticos tienen un hijo de 2 años,

Empezó hace 10 años y escogió esta actividad porque desde pequeño ayudaba al papa en el negocio. El labora de 7H00 am a 18H00 pm con ayuda de una persona. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en su negocio con repuestos se maquinaria y ayudar a su esposa en las mercadería de ropa y comesticos por catálogos para incrementar sus ganancias. Su sueño es tener su casa, seguir con su negocio y familia juntos y que D-miro siga dándole créditos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Roberto, 30, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (named after a species of tree: Guazuma ulmifolia.  El Guasmo is a popular neighborhood of humble class that used to be a hacienda in Guayaquil).  His house is cement and has all basic utilities.  He has a shop providing technical services: “heavy machinery.”  He’s married and his wife sells clothing and cosmetics via catalogue.  They have a two-year-old son.

He started out 10 years ago and chose this occupation because he had helped his father since he was a little boy.  He works from 7am until 6pm with help from one person.  With help from the loan he wants to invest in his business buying spare parts for his machinery and help his wife with her catalogue clothing and cosmetics merchandise to increase her earnings. 

His dream is to have a house, stay in business, remain together as a family and that D-Miro will continue giving him loans in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to invest in his wife's catalogue clothing sales business and to buy machinery replacement parts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 30 años de edad; El socio es conviviente;  El socio pertenece a este banco conformado inicialmente por mujeres y ahora invitarona  sus conyugues y parientes; El socio tiene 2 hijos de 10, 8 años de edad; el socio alterna sus actividades con el servicio de taxi, el socio tienen un automóvil propio y el sale de su casa a las 6 de la mañana todos los días y toma un receso a la 1.pm hasta las 3p.m y vuelve a salir hasta las 10 de la noche; el socio desea el crédito en esta ocasión para poder hacer el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular, el socio planea comprar una llanata de repuesto para su vehiculo también y pasar por la revisión técnica, para todo ello el requiere el prestamo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su auto (taxi) y comprar una llanta de repuesto. 

El socio se encuentra satisfecho con el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is 30 and is a member of the “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” (Working Mothers) communal bank located in Tica Tica District, Cusco Province and Department.

He belongs to this bank, formed initially by women who now invite their spouses and relatives to join. He has a live-in spouse and two children who are 10 and 8 years of age.  He alternates his daily chores with providing taxi services.  He has a car of his own and leaves home at 6am every day.  He takes a break from 1-3pm and then goes out again until 10 at night.  He wants the loan this time to repair his vehicle. He is planning on purchasing spare rims for his car and also to pass the technical revision. He is asking for the loan to invest in vehicle (taxi) repair.

He is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle (taxi) repair.

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
Jorge de 49 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, tiene un taller de cerrajería y automotriz.

Comenzó como ayudante en un taller y luego empezó a comprarse poco a poco maquinas y herramientas para abrir su propio negocio. El labora junto con un empleado desde las 8H00 am a 18h00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar maquinas de cortar $240 planchas de moldear $150 herramientas varias $100 para mejorar su negocio. En un futuro quiere comprar otra maquinas para poder abastecerse con la demanda de trabajo que tiene.
texts.en:
Jorge, 49, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (named after a species of tree, Guazuma ulmifolia.  El Guasmo is a popular, humble neighborhood that used to be a hacienda in Guayaquil).  His house is cement and has all basic utilities.  He has a car repair and metal working shop.

He started out as a shop assistant and then gradually bought some machinery and tools to open his own shop.  He has an employee that helps him.  He works from 8am until 6pm.  

With help from the loan he wants to buy saws ($240), molding presses ($150) and assorted tools ($100) for his shop.  In the future he wants to buy other machines to equip himself for the demand of work he has.

loans.use: to buy saws, molding presses and tools.

loans.name: Jessica Del Rocio

texts.es:
Jessica de 34 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Esta casada y su esposo trabaja como abastecedor de agua y tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 13 años estudian en colegio fiscales.

Ella comenzó hace 2 años en la venta de ropa y comesticos por catálogos. Labora todos los días sale por las mañanas y por las tardes a recorrer el sector promocionando sus productos a amigos y conocidos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mercadería de ropa bisutería y maquillaje a $400 y materiales de construcción como cemento madera bloques a $400 para mejorar sus ingresos y adecuar su vivienda. Su principal meta es terminar su casa y darle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jessica, 34, lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso in Guayaquil, an area noted for its hilly streets.  She’s married and her husband works as a water purveyor.  They have two children who are 6 and 13 years of age and going to public school.

She started selling clothes and cosmetics via catalogue two years ago.  She works every day.  She goes out mornings and afternoons to canvass the sector promoting her products among friends and acquaintances. 

With help from the loan she wants to use $400 to buy clothing and costume jewelry merchandise and $400 to buy building materials and supplies to improve her home.   Her main goal is to finish her house and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, costume jewelry and cosmetics ($400) and building materials and supplies ($400).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy electrical equipment (starters, alternators, bulbs, etc)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil and pepper wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy melons, watermelons, plantain, oranges and avocadoes.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPIRITU SANTO” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Norah. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de plásticos, venta de cebolla y escabeche, tejido, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de pescado, cosméticos, macramé de mantas.

La señora Norah,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de plásticos que viene trabajando hace un año, mediante los viajes que realizaba al Desaguadero (frontera Bolivia Perú)  con su tía aprendió. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (compra de plásticos) los que venderá el la feria 16 de Julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro
texts.en:
The “HOLY GHOST” group will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Los Andes.  The group is comprised of eight members, and is led by a management board headed by Norah.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied, and include the sale of: plastics, onions and escabeche (a typical dish of Bolivia), knitwear, food, blankets, fish, cosmetics and macramé.

Norah indicates that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two years, having joined the group by invitation of a promoter.  Currently, she has a business selling plastic products that she has had for one year.  She learned the trade through her trips to the Desaguadero (on the border of Bolivia and Perú) with her aunt.

The loan she is taking out now is for the purchase of plastic products that she will sell at the 16th of July Market (a commercial area in the city of El Alto) every day.  This means of work allows her to generate income to support her family; she lives with her partner and has six children.  

When asked why she likes working with Pro Mujer, she replies that it’s because she likes the savings.

loans.use: buy merchandise (plastic products).

loans.name: Roque De Jesus

texts.es: Roque de 58 años tiene su negocio de venta de tubérculos, frutas y verduras en un lugar del centro de Barranquilla muy concurrido; él es un hombre casado y con tres hijos en las edades de 27 a 32 años,  que inició este negocio hace más de 15, cuando en pocas cantidades vendía verduras y gradualmente fue integrando en su oferta tubérculos y frutas, y ubicándose en un puesto interno del mercado público de la ciudad; aunque sus ventas las realiza de contado, también tiene clientes fieles  a quienes les da crédito desde que inició con esta actividad  y ellos lo venden de manera ambulante. La ola invernal por la que atraviesa Colombia y especialmente los municipios rivereños de donde traen las verduras y frutas, ha encarecido todos estos productos y Roque necesita comprar de contado para provisionarse y lograr precios competitivos, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva que es el décimo financiamiento que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en volumen estos productos de consumo diario, que forman parte de la dieta alimentaria de sus clientes. Con sus anteriores financiamientos a través de esta organización, Roque ha tenido muchos logros como manejar un pequeño capital de trabajo adicional, diversificar su oferta pasando de solo frutas, a verduras y tubérculos y también con las utilidades de su negocio logró tener su propia vivienda y brindarles  a sus hijos educación técnica superior, agotando todas sus posibilidades. Su sueño es continuar ampliando su negocio  y distribuir en mayor cantidad, mientras trabaja por lograr esta meta ,  maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 28%, que planea aumentar agregándole todos sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Roque is 58 years old and has a business selling tubers, fruits and vegetables at a busy location in the center of Barranquilla.  He is married and has three children ages 27 to 32.  He started the business more than 15 years ago, first selling small amounts of vegetables and slowly incorporating the sale of tubers and fruits.  He located his business at the city’s public market.

Although he sells his products on a cash basis, he also has a few loyal customers that he allows to buy on credit to sell the products door-to-door.  The wintry wave that Colombia has been experiencing, particularly the riverine municipalities, has made all these products more expensive.  Roque must pay in cash to supply his business and offer competitive pricing, which is why he is turning to Kiva credit.  

This is his tenth loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He plans to buy products in bulk, as they are part of his customers’ regular daily diets.  With his previous loans through this organization, Roque has had many achievements.  He has managed a small amount of additional working capital; he has diversified his offerings from just fruits, to include vegetables and tubers; and, through his business, was able to obtain his own house and provide a higher education for his children.  Thus, he has exhausted all his resources.

His dreams are to continue growing his business and to distribute his products in greater quantities.  While he continues working to meet these goals he achieves a 28% profit margin, which he plans to make higher by putting forth all his effort.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Daté Godwin

texts.fr: Marié à une tontinière, Daté est père d’un enfant. Il  a 26 ans s’approvisionne depuis 03 ans, de friperie  dans un marché de la place et revend de manière ambulante. Ce crédit va lui permettre d acheter en quantité  la friperie  et de louer dans la mesure du possible un local pour faciliter la revente sur son lieu d’approvisionnent.
texts.en: Married to a local tontine fund member, Daté is the father of one child. He is 26 years old and, for the past 3 years, has been buying clothing at a local market and re-selling these items door-to-door. This loan will allow him to buy second-hand clothing in bulk and, as far as possible, to rent a place to facilitate the resale of clothing near where he gets his supplies.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Maria Maira De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, vive con su familia y sus hijos de 15, 12 y 8 años de edad, tiene 10 años de comercializar mariscos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos: pescado, camarones, langostas, entre otras clases de mariscos, este préstamo le ayudara a tener mayor disponibilidad de productos para los clientes.
Su objetivo es comprarse de sus ahorros un vehículo para transportar el producto sin mayores inconvenientes.
texts.en:
María dedicates herself to selling seafood.  She lives with her family and her children ages 15, 12 and 8.  She has been in the business for 10 years, and counts on the support of her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy seafood:  fish, prawns, and lobsters, among other types of seafood.  This loan will help her better supply her business to meet customer demand.

Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle with her savings, so she can transport her products more conveniently.

loans.use: buy seafood: fish, prawns, and lobsters.

loans.name: Duo Cosuelo De Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO CONSUELO DE DIOS
AURA Y VILMA 
AURA ES UNA SEÑORA MUY TRABAJADORA TIENE TRES HIJOS A ASU CARGO ELLA ES VIUDA DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS FALLECIO SU ESPOSO TIENE TRES HIJOS CASADOS QUE TAMBIEN LA APOYAN Y LA AYUDAN EN SUS GASTOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE TEJIDOS A MANO YA DESDE VARIOS AÑOS SE DEDICA A ESA ACTIVIDAD Y AHORA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA CONFECCIONAR SU PRODUCTO. VILMA TAMBIEN ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN JUAN COMALAPA TIENE  DOS HIJOS YA GRANDES , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA TIPICA PERO SU NEGOCIO LO REALIZA DE AMBULANTE, TAMBIEN VENDE GUIPILES A MANO LOS VENDE EN LA COMUNIDAD DONDE ELLA VIVE, ELLA  NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU PRODUCTO Y TENER MAS VENTAS Y MEJORES GANANCIAS.
texts.en:
DUO CONSUELO DE DIOS
Aura is a very hard-working lady.  She is a widow and has three children in her care.  Her husband died four years ago.  She has three children who are already married.  They support her and help her with her expenses.  Her business is weaving products by hand.  She has been in this business for several years and needs this loan so that she can buy raw materials for making her products.

Vilma is from San Juan Comalapa.  She has two grown-up children.  Vilma's business is selling traditional clothes and she makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.  She also sells hand-made traditional blouses in her community.  She needs this loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business so that she can make more sales and better profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving products

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es un hombre muy querido en el municipio de La Paz, vive con su esposa y tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Con pocas cosas es que Wilfredo ha realizado obtener el negocio que tiene actualmente el ofrece jabones, desinfectantes, papel higiénico, fósforos, sopas, pan, y granos básicos así  poco a poco amplió el surtido hasta lograr adicionarle lo que le soliciten. Su sueño es tener la pulpería bien surtida que atraiga a sus clientes, esta es la razón por la cual solicito su crédito comprara víveres, grano básicos en mayor volumen y estantería.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a very well liked man in the La Paz municipality.  He lives with his wife and one minor child.

Starting out with just a few items, Wilfredo has managed to grow his business to what he has today.  He sells soaps, disinfectants, toilet paper, matches, soups, bread, and other basic products.  Little by little, he expanded his inventory until he could have the items that his customers were requesting.

His dream is to have a well-supplied general store that attracts customers.  This is the reason he is requesting the loan, with which he will buy provisions in greater quantities as well as shelving.

loans.use: buy provisions in greater quantities, as well as some shelving.

loans.name: Naya

texts.es:
Naya forma parte del banco comunal “Belén” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, vendiendo ropa para adultos y niños. Específicamente ropa de polar (tela abrigadora), su mercadería la compra de acuerdo a la temporada del año o alguna festividad, como por ejemplo, en verano vende poleras, jockey, bolsos para dama. Y durante las festividades, día de la madre; chocolates, artículos para dama, día del padre; artículos para varón, día del niño; juguetes y en navidad de todo tipo de artículos para regalo. Esta mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que existe mayor variedad de productos y además Naya invierte en productos de buena calidad, para mantener su clientela.
Naya trabaja de lunes a domingo en jornada completa en un puesto que acomoda en la calle. Ella se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 30 años. 
Con el préstamo comprará calzas, camisetas, calcetas y poleras de polar, para dama, varón y niño. Ya que es lo que más se vende durante la temporada de invierno. 
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, ya que es muy sacrificado trabajar en la calle durante los meses correspondientes a la temporada de verano e invierno, debido al calor o frío. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son debido al sustento económico que le brinda a su familia.
Naya vive junto a su marido e hija de 9 años de edad, actualmente ésta familia está enfrentando una situación de mucho dolor, ya que el hijo mayor de Naya falleció hace 6 meses atrás, debido a un asalto que sufrió.
Su sueño es brindarle una educación de calidad a su hija y verla desempañarse como profesional. 
Naya está muy agradecida del crédito y apoyo que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para emprender en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones, éstas son muy gratas y además forma parte de la directiva del grupo, ya que es secretaría de éste.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Naya belongs to the “Bethlehem” cooperative bank, located in the city of Valparaíso.

She dedicates herself to working as a street merchant, selling clothing for adults and children.  She buys her products based on the time of year, or for an upcoming holiday.  For example, in the summer she sells t-shirts and handbags.  She also focuses on certain holidays: for Mother’s Day, she buys chocolates and women’s accessories; for Father’s Day, she buys men’s products; for birthdays, she buys toys; for Christmas, she buys all types of items to give as gifts.  

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, since she can obtain a greater variety of products there.  Also, Naya likes to buy high-quality merchandise in order to keep her customers.  Naya works Monday to Sunday from a location she has on the street.  She has dedicated herself to this business for 30 years.

She will use the loan to buy socks, t-shirts, knitwear, and fleece for men, women and children, as these are the items she sells the most of during the winter season.  Her goal is to move her business to an established site, as it is difficult to work on the street during summer and winter because of the hot and cold temperatures.  Her motivation to continue working is her desire to help support her family.

Naya lives with her husband and 9-year old daughter.  This family is currently going through a very painful time, due to the passing of Naya’s oldest son 6 months ago.  Her dream is to provide a quality education for her daughter, and see her become a career professional.  Naya is very thankful for access to credit and the support provided by Fondo Esperanza for carrying on with her enterprise.  She finds the group’s meetings to be very pleasant, and serves as the Secretary of the management board.  

Valparaíso is located 120 km northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital, and also the seat of legislative power of the country.  It is the first port in the nation, and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque areas such as the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: buy hose, t-shirts, socks and fleece items for women, men and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish filets and crab.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy welding supplies (a welding machine, hand shears, etc.)

loans.name: Esbil

texts.es: Esbil, de 21 años es una joven soltera, que vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de “Santa Ana”, que lucha por salir adelante y ayudar a sus padres. Cuando esta en su localidad “Alto Yapaz”, vive en casa de sus padres, quienes son personas bastante generosas, que la impulsan a trazarse metas en la vida. Por eso, desde hace 5 años cultiva café, plátanos y frutas cítricas, sobre los terrenos que le cedieron sus padres. Paralelamente estudia la carrera profesional de “Ingeniería Agropecuaria”, que terminará este año, pero las ganancias que obtiene de la cosechas los presta a sus compañeros de clase, quienes se lo devuelven con intereses, de esta manera ella cubre sus gastos académicos, liberando de algunas responsabilidades a sus padres. Lo que más le gusta es recolectar los granos de café, sin embargo le molesta trasladar los pesados sacos hasta su domicilio. Como sus padres tienen un espacio disponible en su casa, al terminar su carrera profesional, instalará un negocio de venta de productos agroquímicos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Progresistas”, y esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con MFP, donde se compromete a trabajar de manera activa en las reuniones y sobre todo en cada pago mensual. Esbil, con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos para nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Esbil, 21, is a single young woman.  She lives in a leased house in the city of Santa Ana.  She struggles to get ahead and help out her parents.  When she’s in her location of Alto Yapaz she lives in her parents’ house.  They are quite generous and encourage her to set life goals for herself.  Because of this, for the last five years she’s been planting coffee, bananas and citrus fruit on fields her parents passed down to her.  At the same time, she’s enrolled in studies for a career in Farming and Husbandry Engineering that she will complete this year.  With profits from her harvests she makes loans to her classmates who repay with interest.  This is how she pays her academic costs freeing her parents from some of them.

What she likes most is gathering coffee beans although she doesn’t enjoy carrying the heavy sacks all the way home.  Since her parents have space available in their house when she finishes her studies she will set up a farming and livestock supply sales business there.

She is a member of the “Los Progresistas” (The Progressive Ones) communal bank and this is the second time she’s worked with MFP where she is committed to participate actively in the meetings and, above all, with each monthly payment.

Esbil will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of manure that she’ll spread among her plants to balance production.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Maria Berfalia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de frutas, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad, ella trabaja con frutas y verduras desde hace 18 años, comercializando para poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en frutas y verduras frescas, con este préstamo ella tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar su negocio.
Su principal objetivo es ayudar a su esposo a cubrir las mayores demandas en su familia y velar por sus hijos.
texts.en:
María sells fruit.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 20 and 25 years of age.  She has worked with fruit and vegetables for 18 years selling in order to help her spouse cover household expenses.

She is currently asking for a loan to invest in fresh fruit and vegetables.  This loan will give her the opportunity to increase her business.

Her main goal is to help her husband cover the family’s major needs and to watch over her children.

loans.use: buy fruit: grapes and strawberries and also to buy vegetables: potatoes, chayote and carrots.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
MARIA ELENA.
ELLA ,TIENE 44 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 4 HIJOS, QUE LA AYUDAN  A ATENDER SU NEGOCIO Y TAMBIEN CON EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO, TIENEN UN DEPOSITO DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBELES Y AGUAS GASEOSAS, ELLA DICE  QUE TIENE UN SUEÑO DE VER A SUS HIJOS SUPERADOS PROFESIONALMENTE Y TAMBIEN EN SU NEGOCIO QUE ELLOS TAMBIEN PUEDAN ONTENER UN BUEN FUTURO ESO ES LO QUE ELLA ANHELA, DOÑA ELENA ES UNA MUJER MUY EMPRENDEDORA MUY TRABAJADORA, ELLA DICE QUEN CON LA AYUDA DE DIOS HA CRECIDO SU NEGOCIO Y CON EL APOYO DE TODA SU FAMILIA, TIENEN UN VEHICULO QUE LES SIRVE PARA PODER REPARTIR SU PRODUCTO  HASTA DONDE LES PIDEN,ELLA SOLICITA ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES DE PRIMERA NECECIDAD POR MAYOR PARA REPARTIR UN POCO MAS.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 44 years old and has four children who help her to serve in her business.  She also has the support of her husband.  They have a store where they sell groceries and soda.  Elena tells us that she has a dream of seeing all her children become successful professionals.  She would like them to enjoy a good future.  

Elena is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman.  She tells us that with God's help, and the support of her family, she has managed to grow her business.  They have a vehicle which they use to deliver their products wherever they are requested.  Elena is requesting this loan to buy basic food products wholesale so that she can deliver a little more.

loans.use: to buy essential food products

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi est marié et père de 04 enfants. Blanchisseur de profession, il a ouvert sa blanchisserie en1996 à Lomé et s’approvisionne dans un super marché de la place ’’RAMCO’’ pour rendre au propre les vêtements de ses clients. Ce  premier crédit permettra de renforcer son activité en équipement.
texts.en: Kossi is married and has four children. A washerman by profession, he opened his laundry business in 1996 in Lomé and gets his supplies at the local "RAMCO" supermarket to clean his customers' clothes. This first loan will allow him to strengthen his business and get more supplies.

loans.use: To refurbish his store and buy laundry products.

loans.name: Fredi Enrique

texts.es: Fredi Enrique tiene 68 años, el es viudo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de hospedaje. En su propia casa está ubicado el local en donde ofrece 10 habitaciones, disponibles al público y lo que le brinda ventaja es que es un lugar muy transitado por clientes. El pretende realizar con la inversión es acondicionar dos cuartos, comprar colchones, materiales de construcción, pintura entre otros.  El cuenta con la experiencia y manejo de su negocio él quiere generar ganancias para mejorar su nivel de vida y seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en:
Fredi Enrique, 68, is a widower.  His occupation is providing lodgings.  He has a 10 bedroom unit located in his own house available for the public.  What gives him an edge is that it is a location with very heavy customer traffic.  

He intends to use the investment to furnish two rooms.  He will buy mattresses, building materials and paint, among others.  He has experience in running his business and wants to generate profits to improve his standard of living and to continue investing.

loans.use: to buy matresses, building materials and paint, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase snacks, candies, cookies, drinks, eggs and basic grains.

loans.name: Sébastien

texts.fr: Né en 1976, Sébastien est marié à Nikè une couturière. Le couple à cinq enfants à charge dont trois sont les leurs. Les enfants sont tous scolarisés. Sébastien et sa femme vivent  dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Sébastien à arrêté l’école au secondaire. Sébastien a appris le métier de soudure, métier qu’il exerce depuis treize ans ; ce qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Sébastien désire  agrandir son atelier en s’approvisionnant en matériels de soudure (plieuse, fer, perceuse, etc.). Sébastien s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que  Sébastien demande l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Born in 1976, Sébastien is married to Nikè, a dressmaker. The couple have five children in their care, of whom three are their own. All of the children attend or have attended school. Sébastien and his wife live in the same house with their children. Sébastien ended his studies in secondary school and trained to be a welder, a profession he has practiced for 13 years, and which allows him to meet his customers' demands and provide for his family. He wants to enlarge his workshop by supplying himself with welding equipment (a press, iron, a drill, etc.). Sébastien gets his supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. This is the first time that he is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), with the goal of raising the level of his business and increasing both his clientele and his income.

loans.use: To buy welding supplies (a press, iron, a drill, etc.)

loans.name: Maleki

texts.fr: Revendeur de kits et  cartes de recharge de tous les réseaux de communication (Togocel, Moov, Togo télécom) à Lomé depuis 2007, Maleki est marié et jeune père de 24 ans.il s’approvisionne sur place auprès des agréés.il est à son troisième prêt.il vend  dans une baraque  qu’il s’est fait construite devant sa maison.
texts.en: A retailer of phone kits and rechargeable cards for all the telecommunication networks in Lomé (Togocel, Moov, Togo Télécom) since 2007, Maleki is a married young father aged 24. He gets his supplies on the spot from authorized dealers. He is on his third loan. He sells his items at a small stand that he has had built in front of his house.

loans.use: To buy and sell rechargeable phone cards.

loans.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Brenda, tiene casa propia, donde vive con su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad, tiene 9 años de vender meriendas, también administra una tienda, este negocio le ayuda para solventar algunas necesidades en su hogar.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda y productos para hacer las meriendas como: bebidas, galletas, embutidos, carnes, aceite, lácteos y condimentos.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, ampliarlo y tener una mejor capacidad para atender las exigencias de los clientes.
texts.en:
Brenda owns her house where she lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  She’s been selling lunches for 9 years and also runs a store.  This business helps her meet some of her household expenses.

She needs a loan to buy merchandise for the store and ingredients for her lunches like:  beverages, cookies, cured meats, meats, oil, dairy products and condiments.

Her goal is to improve the business, enlarge it and have a better capacity to tend to customer demands.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cookies, cured meats, meats, oil, dairy products and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire laborers to help her pick coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Jeune femme dynamique de 33 ans, Afi est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Revendeuse de céréales et de condiment depuis 10ans  chez elle à domicile, elle s’approvisionne sur un marché de la place.elle aimerait voir son étalage s’agrandir d’où ce premier crédit.
texts.en: A young energetic woman, 33 years old, Afi is married and the mother of three. She has been selling cereals and condiments  by her home for 10 years. She stocks up at the local market. She would like to expand her stall, which is the reason for this first loan.

loans.use: to buy basic need products

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y lácteos, hace 5 años inicio el negocio como una fuente de ingreso permanente para su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y frijol, también lácteos ya que vende queso y crema, con este préstamo podrá reforzar el negocio y tener una mejor solvencia para atender a los clientes y ganar más ingresos. 
La aspiración de José es algún día tener una fábrica de producción de queso y crema con esto mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 11 and 9 years of age.  He sells basic grains and dairy products.  He started the business five years ago as a source of permanent family income.

He is asking for a loan to buy corn and beans and also dairy products since he sells cheese and cream.  With this loan he’ll be able to strengthen the business and have better solvency to tend to customers and earn more income.

José’s goal is to some day have a cheese and cream factory and improve his economic condition with this.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Solitario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Solitario”, se encuentra en el estado D. México en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. 

Natalia es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 46 años, estudio hasta el sexto año D. primaria, es comerciante. Ella se dedica a la venta D. verdura que inicio hace 10 años y solicita el prestamo para invertir en su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes y diariamente necesitan verduras para su comida. 

Al solicitar este prestamo las señoras se sienten muy contentas ya que estaban muy necesitaban el apoyo para poder solventar sus gastos para la temporada. Sus clientes nos cuentan que les gusta comprarle por que siempre tiene limpia y fresca sus verduras y es muy amable al atenderlos. 

La señora Natalia desea este prestamo para poder invertir en materias primas. Con esto esperan poder incrementar sus ventas y en consecuencias sus ganacias porque sus perspectivas son buenas y productivas al querer ampliar su negocio y tambien tener dentro D. sus posibilidades el poder pagar el prestamo que se le dará.
