También desea con las gananciasd ahorrar para apoyar a su familia en los gastos economicos y en lo que necesite su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Solitario” (Solitaire) and is located in the Mexican state of México.  The group has 9 members.  

Natalia is the group's President.  She’s 46 years old and completed 6th graD.; she’s a merchant.  She started selling vegetables 10 years ago and is asking for the loan to invest in her business since she has many customers who need vegetables daily for their meals.

While requesting this loan the women feel very happy because they were quite needy of support to meet their expenses for the season.  Their customers tell us that they like to buy from her because her vegetables are always clean and fresh and she is very kind to them.

Natalia wants the loan to invest in raw materials.  They hope with it to increase sales and consequently profits because their prospects are good and productive in wanting to expand their business as well as having repaying the loan within their possibilities.  She also hopes to use profits to save in order to help her family with expenses and whatever else they may need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio de 62 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su negocio con pocos productos el escogió es actividad porque estaba desempleado y necesitaba generar ingresos a su hogar. En la actualidad trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde su negocio consiste en la venta de frutas y verduras.  Este crédito es para la compra de melones, sandias, bananos, naranjas, pipianes, aguacate entre otros.
texts.en: Manuel Antonio is a hardworking man of 62 who began his business with just a handful of products. He chose this line of work because he was unemployed and he needed to generate some income to cover his living costs. He works every day from 7am til 6pm selling fruit and vegetables. Manuel Antonio will use this loan to purchase melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges, squash and avocados.

loans.use: to purchase melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges, squash and avocados.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to puchase coal and cereals.

loans.name: Aguilas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DEL SUR” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Justina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de muebles, ayudante de minibús, Tienda de barrio, costura de sombreros, venta de queso, venta de enaguas, macramé de mantas.

La señora Justina,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso la institución por invitación de su hermana. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás, con ayuda de su esposo. El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (para aumentar productos en su tienda) artículos que comprará de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos; pero no vive con su esposo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio

En la fotografía podemos observar que estan compartiendo un almuerzo comunitario, por esta razón la prima de doña Justina acompaña este grupo; pero no se encuentra Jorge, porque se le presento un examen.
texts.en:
The “AGUILAS DEL SUR” (Eagles of the South) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Justina.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are: furniture sales, minibus helper, neighborhood store, hat making, cheese sales, skirt sales, macramé blanket weaving.

Justina states that this is the first cycle she’s worked with Pro Mujer; her sister invited her to join.  She currently has a neighborhood store that she’s run for the last five years with help from her husband.  The loan she will take out now is to buy merchandise to increase the stock in her store.  She will buy it in La Ceja (commercial part of the city of El Alto).  This way of work allows her to generate income to support her family because she’s married and has six children but does not live with her husband.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the health office.

In the photograph we can see that they are enjoying a community breakfast and because of this Justina’s cousin appears with her in the group but Jorge is not in the photo because he had to take an exam.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seed in order to plan corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Acok Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ACOK est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent au même groupe d’artisan et mènent toutes la même activité, précisément la coiffure. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Anne Abakè, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Anne Abakè est née le 26 Juin 1975 et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Vincent. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs. Anne Abakè vit ensemble avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Anne Abakè a arrêté très tôt l’école au profit de la coiffure qu’elle a appris et qu’elle exerce depuis seize ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Anne Abakè vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. Anne Abakè  achète ses produits à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Anne Abakè et son groupe sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The ACOK group is made up of three persons who belong to the same trade and work in the same business, namely hairdressing. The representative of this group, Anne Abakè, is raising her hand in the photo. 

Anne Abakè was born on June 26, 1975 and is married to a carpenter named Vincent. The couple is raising three children, all enrolled in school, of whom two are their biological children. 

Anne Abakè lives together with her family. The couple share in supporting their family. Anne Abakè stopped attending school early on to learn haridressing which she has been involved in for 16 years. At the same time, she sells hair extensions and cosmetics in her beauty shop. 

Anne Abakè  buys her products in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin and also in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the second time that she and her group are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to expand their businesses so that they can better serve their clientele.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alma Marisol

texts.es:
Alma, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y cosméticos, tiene tres hijos D. 4, 11 y 15 años D. edad, ella inicio este negocio desD. hace 4 años, por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ropa y cosméticos, para la venta como por ejemplo, blusas, pantalones, camisas formales, en cosméticos maquillajes, labiales, cremas, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y generar mayores ingresos que le servirán para tener una mejor solvencia.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, ya que desea verlos formados académicamente para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Alma works selling clothing and cosmetics.  She has three children who are 15, 11, and 4 years old.  She started her business four years ago from her own initiative.  She works every day from 6:00am until 5:00pm.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics to sell, for example: shirts, pants, formal shirts, makeup, lipstick, and creams.  This loan will help strengthen her business and generate more income that will allow her to have better solvency.

Her objective is to help her children with their studies, since she wants to see them finish school so they can succeed.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like shirts, pants, formal shirts, makeup, lipstick, and creams.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, es soltero y vive con sus padres, estudia en la universidad y se dedica a la venta de pan y al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 10 años de trabajar en el área agrícola y desde hace un año a la venta de pan francés y dulce de forma ambulante en una bicicleta.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y tratamiento para plagas, esto para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta inversión le ayudara a llevar a cabo la siembra y recibir al final buenas utilidades de  una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es salir adelante con su carrera universitaria, por eso se esfuerza cada día para encontrar la forma de tener ingresos  y realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
Orlando is single and lives with his parents.  He studies at the university.  He works selling bread and growing corn and beans.  He has worked in agriculture for ten years and began selling French bread and sweet bread by bicycle one year ago.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizer and pest treatment for his corn and bean crops.  This investment will help him carry out the planting and earn good profits from a good harvest.

His objective is to continue his university studies, so he works hard every day to earn money and realize his dream.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pest treatment.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 47 años, convive desde hace 27 años con Jorge. Ambos forman una hermosa familia con 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). La sonrisa que la caracteriza es producto de su actitud en el trabajo. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando café y piña en sus terrenos agrícolas que se ubican en la zona alta de San Francisco, donde trascurre la mayor parte del día, según cuenta existen días donde se queda a descansar en un choza que acondicionó entre sus plantaciones. “Me gusta mantener limpio mis cultivos”, afirma. Cuenta además que en este año el precio del café es muy bueno. Por lo que augura obtendrá buenas ganancias. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo pues se dedica a la siembra paralela de piña, donde invierte mayor cantidad de dinero, y además de requerir mayores cuidados. Por ello más adelante está pensando comprar un camión con el que pueda trasladar su producción y vender por su propia cuenta sin intermediarios, logrando así tener mayor rentabilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de éxito que le brindan. Bertha, invertirá el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de café, ya que necesita nivelar su producción en esta temporada de extracción del primer grano de café.
texts.en:
Bertha is 47 years old and has lived with Jorge for 27 years.  Together they have a beautiful family with four children, but they only live with two of them in their own house located in the town of Alto Yapaz (central Peruvian jungle).  The smile that she is known for is a product of her attitude to work.  

For 20 years, she has been a farmer, planting coffee and pineapple in her agricultural lands located in the high area of San Fransisco.  She spends most of her day there, and says there are days when she stays there to rest in a hut she set up between her plantations.  She says, "I like to keep my crops clean."  She says that this year the price of coffee is very good, so she predicts she will earn a good income.  Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital, so she also plants pineapple, where she invests a larger quantity of money, and it also requires more care.  In the future, she is thinking of purchasing a truck to transport their crops and sell them themselves without intermediaries so they can earn more money.  

She is a member of the community bank Los Progresistas, and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is thankful for the opportunity for success that was given to her.  Bertha will use this loan to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee crops, since she needs to balance her production during the season's first coffee bean extraction.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent depuis longtemps à la même  association d’artisan. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Claire, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Claire est née le 04 Août 1973 et est mariée à un instituteur du nom de Wassi. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Claire et sa famille habitent ensemble. Claire a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au cours secondaire, au profit de la couture qu’elle a appris et exerce depuis dix neuf ans. De façon secondaire, Claire vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Claire achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. La clientèle de Claire devient de plus en plus grande, et Claire voudrait équiper son atelier d’une autre machine à coudre afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Claire et son groupe se sont rapprochés de AILDé, en vue d’un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO group is composed of three people, who have been members of the same craft association for a long time. The group's representative, named Claire, is the woman raising her hand on the picture. This is the first time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to raise their activity level.
Claire is born on August 4th, 1973, and is married to a schoolteacher named Wassi. The couple has three kids, who all attend school and depend on them financially. Claire and her family live together. Claire went to school but quit in middle school, to the benefit of sewing, which she learned and has been practicing for nineteen years. As a side activity, Claire sells sewing supplies at her workshop. Claire guys her supplies in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital.
Claire's clientele is growing, and Claire would like to equip her workshop with another sewing machine to better meet the demand. To this effect, and since she doesn't have the financial resources to make her dream a reality, Claire and her group contacted ALIDé for a first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Solidario Rosas De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Solidario Rosas de San Miguel: Este grupo esta formado por cuatro señoras.
Serapia,viuda de 55 años de edad tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estan casados y solo tiene a la hija mas pequeña a su cargo a la que le esta brindando estudios a nivel medio,ella se dedica a la venta de productos de usos domesticos ,como colchas,vajillas,etc inicio su negocio hace 25 años para darle apoyo a su esposo gracias a Dios podo darle estudio a sus hijos ella solicita este credito para la compra de productos de usos domesticos por mayor y asi poder ayudar a su hija,su sueño es poder ber a su hija graduada,para que tenga un mejor futuro.las otras socias solicitan este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para su tienda ya que tambien se dedican a la venta de productos de usos domesticos.
texts.en:
The Rosas de San Miguel Communal Bank is comprised of four women.  

Serapia is a 55 year old widow.  She has six children.  Five of them are married, and she only has her youngest daughter under her care.  She is providing her with a middle school education.  

Serapia sells domestic use products like bedspreads and dishes, etc.  She started her business 25 years ago in order to give her husband support.  Thanks to God, she was able to give her children an education.

She is requesting this loan to buy domestic use products wholesale.  That way she will be able to help her daughter.  Her dream is to be able to see her daughter graduate so that she will have a better future.

The other members request this loan to buy more merchandise for their store as they also sell domestic use products.

loans.use: to buy domestic use products.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la crianza y destazo de cerdos, vive con sus hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad y su esposo; Ana se dedica a este negocio desde hace 2 años, fue por iniciativa propia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y dar continuidad al negocio, este préstamo le será muy útil, pues cubrirá esta inversión de la cual espera recibir ganancias.
Su aspiración es crecer en el comercio de la carne y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana works raising and butchering pigs.  She lives with her husband and her children who are 7 and 9 years old.  Ana has worked at this business for two years, and started it herself.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase pigs and continue her business.  This loan will be very useful because she will earn income from this investment.  

Her dream is to grow in the meat trade and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marcos Antonio tiene 2  hijos menores de edad, él es un hombre muy responsable de 57 años que ha sostenido su hogar trabajando independientemente. Su  negocio que inició hace cuarenta años ya que anteriormente él trabajaba en una radio  luego decidió establecer su propio negocio de servicios musicales. Su meta a nivel familiar es que algún día sus hijos sean profesionales y su meta empresarial es aumentar su inventario con herramientas necesarias. Su crédito es para  comprar computadoras, controles, alambres, micrófonos entre otras herramientas que se solicitan.
texts.en: Marcos Antonio has 2 minor children.  He is a responsible 57 year-old man who has supported his household through his independent work.  He started his music services business 40 years ago after working for a radio station.  His goal for his family is to someday see his children become professionals, and his goal for his business is to have more equipment to use in his work.  This loan will be used to buy computers, controllers, wires, microphones and other equipment that he needs.

loans.use: to buy computers, controllers, wires and microphones

loans.name: Nelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelis, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 15 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, en ocasiones contrata a mozos para que le ayuden a preparar el terreno, su horario es de 6:00am a 3:00pm, o dependiendo de la necesidad que tengan.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y tratamiento para plagas, estos insumos agrícolas no pueden faltar para realizar el cultivo, por lo que este préstamo será una gran ayuda para contar con los materiales necesarios.
Su objetivo es trabajar por su hijo, ayudándolo para que estudie y se supere.
texts.en:
Nelis lives with her husband and 15 year old son.  She and her husband are farmers, raising corn and beans.  Sometimes they hire help to prepare the land.  Their schedule is from 6am to 3pm, or as needed.  

Nelis is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.  These agricultural products are essential for a successful crop, so the loan will be a great help for them to have the materials they need.  

Her goal is to work to help her son be able to study and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticide.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Mahougnon 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même association d’artisan. La présidente du groupe, Hélène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née en 1976 et est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs. Hélène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Hélène n’a jamais été à l’école, mais a appris le métier de couture, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Hélène achète des plastiques et des chaussures à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, et les revend dans son atelier de couture. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hélène sollicite pour la première fois un crédit avec les membres de son groupe. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son salon de couture par une nouvelle machine à surfilage.
texts.en: The “Matignon 1” group is composed of three individuals who are members of the same trade association. The group’s leader, Hélène (raising her hand in the photo) was born on 1976 and married to a man named Albert. The spouses have three children in their care, two  of whom are their own and all of whom are in school. Hélène and her husband live together with their chidlren. Hélène never attended school, but learned the trade of a seamstress. She is passionate about her work, and it also allows her to support herself and her children. As a secondary activity, Hélène buys plastic items and shoes in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, and resells these goods in her shop. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Hélène, together with her group members, is seeking a loan for the first time. This loan will allow her to better equip her sewingshop by adding a new overcastting machine.

loans.use: to buy an overcasting machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic crop fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, él es un agricultor dedicado a sembrar maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de trabajar y aprendió por su padre, su horario es de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y tratamiento para plagas, este préstamo le ayudara  para cubrir los gastos del inicio de la siembra.
Su objetivo es sacar adelante a sus hijos, que crezcan sanos y puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 1.  He is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He has been working for 15 years, and learned his trade from his father.  His schedule is from 6am to 3pm.  

José is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.  This loan will help him to cover his expenses at the beginning of the planting season.   

His goal is to help his children get ahead, so they grow up healthy and can attend school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ife Sowakpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE SOWAKPO est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à la même association d’artisan. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Chèfiou, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Chèfiou est marié à une certaine Mariama. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont les leurs. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Chèfiou a très peu fréquenté l’école, mais a appris le métier de coiffure. Il y a près de huit ans que Chèfiou exerce cette activité, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Chèfiou désire mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par l’achat d’autres matériels de coiffure performants. Pour ce faire, Chèfiou  sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Ife Sowakpo group is made up of three people who belong to the same craft association. The group's representative Chèfiou is the one raising his hand in the photo.

This is the second time the group has sought ALIDé's financial support in order to increase the level of their business. Chèfiou is married to a woman named Mariama, and the couple is raising five children, all in school and four of which are their own. The couple lives with their children, and together they meet the various needs of the family.

Chèfiou did not go to school much, but he learned the hairdressing business. He's been in the business for almost eight years, and it allows him to meet his family's needs without much difficulty. In order to better respond to the demand of his clients, Chèfiou would like to upgrade his hair salon by purchasing better equipment. To do that, Chèfiou is seeking, with his group, a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy clippers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jamil Francisco

texts.es: Jamil Francisco tiene 35 años, el es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Jamil se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de constructora y tiene 8 años de experiencia desempeñándose en esta labor. el es un cliente conocido por lo que su trabajo consiste en realizar obras verticales, inicio por su Papa quien le enseño todo el negocio y Jamil más tarde decide establecer su propio negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo que lo utilizará para invertir en piedrín, canteras, arena, bloques, ladrillos y maquinara para el buen desarrollo de su actividad y así optimizar la calidad de producción. Jamil desea seguir contando con nuestro apoyo solicitando préstamos para invertir en su actividad, así seguir creciendo poco apoco y lograr adquirir más clientes.
texts.en: Jamil Francisco is 35 years old.  He is married and has three minor children.  Jamil provides construction services and has done this work for 8 years.  He is well known and he works on tall buildings. He learned his trade from his father who taught him the business. He later decided to open his own business.  He is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase gravel, quarried stone, sand, cement blocks, bricks, and machinery to do his work and optimize his production quality.  Jamil would like to continue to rely on our support by requesting future loans for his business, so that he can continue growing bit by bit and gaining more customers.

loans.use: to purchase gravel, quarried stone, sand, cement blocks, bricks and machinery.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est marié et père de 01 enfant,il est agé de 31 ans et se bat au quotidien pour sa petite famille.revendeur de pièces détachées à lomé depuis 5 ans ,il s'approvisionne sur place.
texts.en: Kodjo is married and a father of one. He is 31 years old and struggles on a daily basis for his small family. A retailer of spare parts in Lome for five years, he gets his supplies locally.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: For the past 2 years, Esi has been selling kenkey (a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish) in Abura near Brasi. She is a widow with 9 dependents, and the money she earns from her sales is used to take care of them. Her loan will be used to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, corn husks and other ingredients to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a food joint. At the time of the visit, Esi had finished selling for the day and is showing the pan in which she sells the kenkey.

loans.use: to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, corn husks and other ingredients to expand her business.

loans.name: Santos Andrea

texts.es:
Santos se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas,ella tiene 22 años de edad, es casada tiene una hija de 4 años de edad actualmente vive con la madre de su esposo.
Tiene 10 años de dedicarse al negocio trabajando a tiempo completo, lo aprendió de su madre; actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de teja para el techo de su vivienda  también lámina para  las paredes; esto le servirá para construir una pequeña casa y así independizarse de su suegra.
Su aspiración es tener una vivienda más segura y trabajar para la educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Santos manufactures hammocks.  She is 22 years old, married, and has a 4-year-old daughter.  At present she lives with her husband’s mother.

She has been working in this business full time for 10 years, having learned the trade from her mother.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy roof tiles for her home, and also boards for the walls.  This will enable her to build a small house and thus be independent from her mother-in-law.  She aspires to have a safer home and to work to raise her daughter.

loans.use: buy roof tiles for her home, and also boards for the walls.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 52 años, está casada desde hace 27 años con Santiago, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, en su casa propia que fue heredada de parte de su padre; en la localidad de Alto Yapaz. Como tradición familiar, su actividad económica es la agricultura. Desde niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, desde entonces comenzó a sembrar café y plátanos en sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas donde trabaja con mucha dedicación. Pues sabe que depende mucho del buen cuidado y fertilización para btener un buen fruto. Según cuenta le va muy bien, pues los comerciantes de las diferentes ciudades (La Merced, Santa Ana), le pagan muy bien por sus cosechas. “Siempre me gusto sembrar, ahora estoy incursionando en la producción de Piña”, asegura. Además de abrir una tienda de comestibles hace 2 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como también productos que le solicitan constantemente, pues la zona donde vive es muy lejana e inaccesible. Ahora desea seguir expandiendo su tienda y convertirla en la mejor. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Progresistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se compromete a trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y ahínco en el logro de sus objetivos. Esther, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, así como útiles de escritorio, asimismo desea incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir y zapatillas.
texts.en: Esther is 52 years old, married to Santiago for 27 years, by whom she has 4 children.  She lives with 3 of them, in her own home, which she inherited from her father, in the Alto Yapaz area.  Her family has traditionally been involved in farming.  From childhood, her parents taught her to work the land, and since that time she started planting coffee and bananas in the 4 hectares of farmland, where she works diligently.  She knows that good care and fertilizers will enable her to have a good yield.  She says that things are going well, for merchants in the different cities (La Merced, Santa Ana) pay her well for her harvests.  “I always liked to plant, and now I’m moving into pineapple production,” she states.  This in addition to opening a grocery store two years ago, where she sells convenience items, and goods that people always ask for, since the area where she lives is remote and inaccessible.  She would like now to expand her store and become the best.  She belongs to the “Los Progresistas” communal bank, and this is her first loan with MFP.  She commits to working hard and enthusiastically to achieve her goals.  Esther will use the requested loan to purchase convenience items, as well as school supplies, and also wishes to expand into selling garments and sandals.

loans.use: buy goods to supply her store, school supplies, and also clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama, a high school graduate who is is married to a chain saw operator and has four children, has been selling soft drinks and provisions in Brasi, a village near Abura in Cape Coast, for three years.  Ama helps her husband to take care of the home and wants to expand her business and so is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, canned tomatoes, and other provisions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, canned tomatoes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos menores hijos en casa de su madre en una zona rural del distrito de Chiclayo. Juan es un hombre trabajador que lucha por darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.

Él se dedica al servicio de transporte público. Tiene una mototaxi, que es una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Juan se dedica a esto desde hace 5 años y esta actividad es la que le permite cumplir con la educación de sus hijos así como darle ciertas comodidades a su familia.

Juan solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles que destinará en el  mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, en el motor y los rodajes.

Juan ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha cancelado adecuadamente sus créditos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 46, lives with his wife and their two minor children.  They live in his mother’s house in a rural zone in the Chiclayo district.  Juan is a hard-working man who struggles to give his children the best education.

He devotes himself to providing public transportation service.  He has a “mototaxi”, which is a motorcycle with a passenger cabin in the back.  Juan has been doing this for five years.  This business activity allows his children to complete their education.  It also allows him to give his family certain comforts.

Juan is requesting a loan for 1,200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan for maintenance on the motor and the gears of his mototaxi. 

Juan has already worked with our institution, and he has satisfactorily paid back his loans.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to the motor and gears of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es: Luis Arturo ha demostrado buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable a sus clientes. Luis se dedica a la venta de cosméticos,  empieza su labor al rededor de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues algunas veces tiene que entregar ciertos pedidos que sus clientes le realizan, el trabaja arduamente diariamente para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El dinero del crédito es para la compra de pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, brillos, sombras, base, lápiz de ojos, brochas entre otras cosas. Es sacrificado el esfuerzo que el realiza para tener mejores condiciones de vida. El mayor sueño Luis es que su familia pueda tener un patrimonio estable.
texts.en:
Luis Arturo has demonstrated his willingness to make his payments and treating his customers well.  Luis dedicates himself to selling cosmetics.  He works from 7 am until 9 pm, as he sometimes has to deliver orders placed by customers.  He works very hard each and every day to generate the necessary income to support his family.

The funds from the loan will be used to buy lipstick, nail polish, eye shadow, blush, foundation, eyeliner, and brushes, among other items.  He has made many sacrifices to obtain a higher standard of living.  The greatest dream Luis has is for his family to have stability.

loans.use: buy lipstick, nail polish, eye shadow, blush, foundation, eye liners, brushes and other items for his cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her general store.

loans.name: Lindi Limber

texts.es:
Lindi de 48 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Esta casado y su esposa trabaja vendiendo frutas y cocos junto al negocio del papa. Y ellos tienen 7 hijos ya todos mayores de edad. Tiene un taller de soldadura.

Comenzó desde joven como ayudante de un taller y aprendió a soldar y a sus 22 años puso su propio taller. Labora desde las 8H00 am a 7H00 pm o mas dependiendo de las obras que hace. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar una maquina enrolladora y va a ayudar en el negocio de su esposa y así incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y ofrecer mas trabajos con empleados que aprenda este arte.
texts.en:
Lindi, 48 years of age, lives in a peri-urban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountainous roads.  He is married, and his wife works selling fruits and coconuts next to his business.  They have 7 grown children.  He has a soldering workshop.

He started very young as an apprentice in a workshop where he learned how to solder and, at 22 years of age, he started his own business.  He works from 8 am to 7 pm or so, depending on the work that he has.  With the help of this loan, he wants to buy a winding machine and help his wife’s business in order to augment his income.  In the future, he would like to grow his business with employees who learn his trade.

loans.use: buy a winding machine and help his wife's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy mesh and lumber to reinforce her farm.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 41 años; convive desde hace 16 años con Justina. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Alto Yapas. A pesar de que sus 3 mayores hijos ya formaron su familia; continúan trabajando conjuntamente. Ambos se ayudan en el cuidado de sus cultivos de Piña, los cuales siembra en terrenos agrícolas alquilados, pues no tenía el dinero necesario para comprar uno propio. Pero a pesar de las dificultades, pudo educar y sacar adelante a su familia. Además comenta que hace 10 años comenzó a incursionar en la elaboración de viveros de café, (una técnica de cultivo para conseguir una buena cosecha), por ello debe invertir gran cantidad de dinero.  Al año realiza un promedio de 100 mil viveros de café promedio, obteniendo una ganancia de 10 mil a 30 mil nuevos soles, todo depende de los pedidos que logra obtener. Le va muy bien, y mientras tenga las fuerzas para continuar trabajando ahorrará el dinero suficiente para poder comprar terrenos agrícolas y así dejar un legado para sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener buenos resultados gracias al apoyo conjunto de su asociación. Jorge, tiene un pedido de mil viveros, por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de café.
texts.en:
Jorge, 41 years of age, has lived with his partner Justina for 16 years.  Together, they have 5 children; only 2 still live with them currently in their own house located in the Alto Yapas locality.  Despite the fact that his older children have already started their own families, they continue to work together.  They help each other out tending to their pineapple crops, which they plant on rented land since he doesn’t have the necessary means to buy his own.

Despite the difficulties he has faced, he managed to educate and support his family.  In addition, he tells us that 10 years ago he embarked on creating a coffee plant nursery (a cultivation technique used to obtain a grow a good crop), in which he must invest a great deal of funds.  To date, he averages 100 thousand saplings, obtaining a profit of 10 to 30 thousand soles.  Everything depends on the orders he manages to obtain.  Things are going well for him and, while he has the strength, he will continue to work hard to save so he can buy land for his children to inherit.  

He belongs to “The Progressives” cooperative bank, and this is his first loan with MFP.  He hopes to obtain a good result thanks to the collective support of his association.  Jorge has an order for one thousand saplings, which is why he will purchase coffee seeds with the requested loan.

loans.use: buy coffee plant seeds.

loans.name: Teofano

texts.es:
Teofano tiene 56 años de edad y está felizmente casado. Él vive con su esposa en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande - Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla Teofano es la agricultura, tiene una parcela en la cual cultiva mango, limón y fríjol, estos están bien conducidos y se encuentran en producción. 

Teofano tiene gran experiencia en la agricultura él viene desarrollando esta actividad desde hace 15 años.  Adicionalmente Teofano se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino. 

Teofano solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará al mantenimiento del cultivo de mango, que actualmente es el fruto que más ganancias le produce.

Teofano y su esposa gozan de buenas referencias personales y laborales. Son una pareja trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Teofano is 56 years old and happily married.  He lives with his wife in the rural part of Tambogrande district - Piura.

Teofano is a farmer.  He has a plot of land where he grows mangos, lemons and beans.  He manages his crops well and they are currently producing.  Teofono has a lot of experience as a farmer.  He has been in this line of work for 15 years.  He also raises sheep.

Teofano is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to maintain his mango crop which is currently the fruit which makes him most profits.

Teofano and his wife have good personal and work references.  They are a hard-working couple who have a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to maintain his mango crop

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua buys and retails plastic bowls and cooking utensils in Abura in Cape Coast. She is married to a mason and has four children. Efua has a senior high educational background. She assists her husband to clothe and feed her family.

Since demand for her wares is increasing, Efua needs a loan to buy additional bowls and utensils. Any profit realized from her sales will be used to build a shop. At the time of the visit, Efua had run out of stock and was waiting to receive her new consignment.

loans.use: to buy additional bowls and utensils.

loans.name: Jacinto Alejandro

texts.es:
Jacinto de 31 años,  vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Esta casado y su esposa se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos. 

Empezó desde muy joven como ayudante al ver que le gusto se metió a cursos técnicos y de allí aprendió el arte y con esa experiencia hoy tiene su taller de electromecánica. El labora desde su casa y también hace sus trabajos a domicilio. Con la ayuda del préstamo quieres comprar mas repuestos de vehículos para vender en su taller y también cunado necesite el arreglo del mismo y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jacinto, 31, lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso in Guayaquil, an area known for its hilly streets.  He’s married and his wife sells beauty products via catalogue.

He started as a helper very young and seeing that he liked it took technical courses where he leaned the art and with that experience now has his own electromechanical shop.  He works from home but also goes to customers’ houses to work there.  With help from the loan he wants to buy more vehicle spare parts to sell in his shop and also when repairs need to be done to have them on hand thus increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha' and to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José,vive con su esposa y se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo, su horario generalmente es de 6:00am a 12:00pm, actualmente está iniciando la preparación del terreno, para lo que solicita un préstamo para el pago de mozos, compra de abono y semilla.
Este préstamo le servirá para tener los insumos disponibles para preparar de mejor manera los cultivos esperando tener buena cosecha para vender una parte.
Su aspiración es establecer un negocio que le permita una mejor vida a él y su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife.  He has been farming corn and beans for over 20 years.  His usual work schedule is 6am to noon.  He is currently staring soil preparation for which he needs a loan to pay day laborers and to buy manure and seed.

This loan will help him have supplies on hand to better prepare the crops hoping to have a good harvest to sell part of it.  His goal is to establish a business that will lead to a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay day laborers and to buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Tito Joel

texts.es:
Tito es un joven de 21 años de edad. Es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor que vive junto a su novia y su menor hijo en casa de su suegra, ubicada en el distrito de Chiclayo.

Tito se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público, él tiene una mototaxi.  La mototaxi es una moto que cuenta con una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden trasportar pasajeros, este servicio es muy común en las pequeñas comunidades del Perú. El trabajo que Tito realiza le permite mantener a su familia, obteniendo ingresos diarios.

Tito solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles que destinará en la reparación de su moto, pues últimamente esta le ha estado presentado algunas fallas, algo que ha disminuido las horas de trabajo de Tito y por lo tanto sus ganancias.

Tito tiene muchos deseos de independizarse y de formar su propio hogar. Él siente que con su trabajo y esfuerzo lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Tito is 21 years old.  He is a hard-working and entrepreneurial young man who lives together with his girlfriend and son in his mother-in-law's home which is located in Chiclayo district.

Tito provides a public transport service in his motorcycle taxi.  A motorcycle taxi is a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers.  This service is very common in the small communities of Peru.  Tito's work enables him to support his family and make daily income.

Tito is requesting a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to repair his motorcycle as it has been experiencing problems lately.  This has decreased the number of hours that Tito can work and therefore his profits.

Tito has a great desire to become independent and form his own household.  He feels that he will achieve this as a result of his effort and hard work.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer trabajadora D. 28 años D. edad, ella vive junto a su esposo, en la parte rural del distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura, en una comunidad  D. condición humilD. pero con muchos deseos D. superación.

Ana se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino y aves D. corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor y la apoya en las actividades que Ana realiza. Existe una buena relación en la pareja, ambos contribuyen con los gastos del hogar.

Ana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra D. alimento balanceado para el engorD. D. sus ovinos y aves D. corral. Esto le permitirá venderlos a un mejor precio y por lo tanto seguir creciendo económicamente.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working 28 year-old woman who lives together with her husband in the rural part of TambogranD. district - Piura.  She lives in a community which is a poor one but has a great desire to improve.

Ana raises and fattens sheep and poultry which she then sells in her local market.  Her husband is a farmer and supports her in her business activities.  The couple have a good relationship and they both contribute towards their household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed with which to fatten her sheep and poultry.  This will allow her to sell them at a better price and she will therefore be able to continue growing financially.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo es un cliente de 45  años de edad, es soltero pero tiene  2 hijos a su cargo que se encuentran en edad escolar. Arturo vive en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña de gente muy trabajadora.

Arturo se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales. Cuenta con ganado ovino el cual cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Arturo es muy dedicado a su actividad y por eso sus ovejas tienen buen tamaño y peso lo que hace que Arturo tenga una gran demanda. La crianza de  ovejas le ha permitido a Arturo obtener ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida,  obteniendo comodidades dentro de su hogar.

Arturo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de calaminas para renovar el techo de su casa y otra parte del crédito será destinada a la compra de alimento balanceado para que sus animales sigan teniendo un crecimiento adecuado.

Arturo tiene muchos deseos de superación y su responsabilidad le ha permitido desarrollarse poco a poco. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Arturo is 45 years old and single but he has two school-age children in his care.  He lives in the rural area of Túcume district - Lambayeque, in a small community made up of very hard-working people.

Arturo raises and sells animals.  He has sheep which he raises in an area behind his home.  Arturo is very dedicated to his business and, for this reason, his sheep reach a good size and weight which means that he has a lot of demand.  Raising sheep has allowed Arturo to make profits and improve his quality of life.  He has managed to acquire some comforts for his home.

Arturo is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he will invest in buying sheets of corrugated metal to replace his roof.  He will use the rest of his loan to buy balanced feed so that his animals continue to grow well.

Arturo has a great desire to improve himself and, owing to his responsibility, he has gradually made progress.  He is very grateful for this loan as it will be of great use to him.

loans.use: to replace his roof and buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana is married to a farmer and has three children. She has been selling provisions and food items such as garden eggs, okra, canned tomatoes, spices and other items in Abura for 15 years. Nana Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the family's basic needs. She will use this loan to purchase onions, pepper and other food items to sell.  She wishes to reinvest the new profit back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase onions, pepper and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna de 50 años, vive con su esposo Pedro. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero vive con uno de ellos, Jhon, en su acogedora casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Tapo. Desde hace 30 años se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, un buen día se dio cuenta que unos amigos se dedicaban a esta actividad y obtenían buenas ganancias, así  decidió empezar en este rubro, pero a pesar de su edad no dudo en trabajar. Al tiempo se casó, continuando en este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, y después de un tiempo empezó a ayudarle también  su hijo mayor: Desde entonces cada día se dirige a comprar verduras en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para venderlos al por menor,  obteniendo ganancias liquidas ya que el negocio le es muy rentable y no tiene mucha  competencia, además ya tiene clientes conocidos. Por otro lado comercializa sus propios productos que siembra, como: papa, habas y hortalizas, que cosecha en cada temporada. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de 11 vacas que tiene con lo que realiza queso, un promedio de 7 a 6 moldes diarios. También a la crianza de 18 carneros los cuales engorda y lleva a venderlos a los carniceros y pobladores de la localidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde se compromete a ser puntual, como siempre lo ha sido en cada uno de sus pagos ya que quiere seguir trabajando con su banco comunal compuesto por personas muy organizadas y trabajadoras. Reyna, comenzará su sembrío de arveja, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “canchan”.
texts.en:
Reyna, 50, lives with her husband, Pedro.  They have 8 children but only lives with one of them, Jhon, in her cozy house located in Tapo.  She has sold vegetables for the last 30 years.  One good day she realized that some friends who were in this occupation earned good profits so she decided to go into this line of work.  Despite her age, she did not hesitate to work.  In time, she married and continued in this business with help from her husband and after some time her oldest son started helping out too.  Since then, she heads out to the city’s wholesale market every day to buy vegetables to later resell at retail obtaining net profits since the business is quite profitable and she does not have much competition.  

On the other hand, she also sells the products she grows herself like potatoes, broad beans and leafy vegetables that she harvests each season.  In addition, she raises 11 cows that she has and makes six or seven cheeses daily on average.  She also raises 18 lambs that she fattens up to then sell to butchers and local residents.

She belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Tapo” (Holy Cross of Tapo) communal bank and this is the sixth loan with MFP where she commits to be punctual, as she’s always been, with each payment because she wants to continue working with her communal bank which is composed of very organized, hard working people.

Reyna will start her pea planting so will use the requested money to buy two bags of pea seeds as well as several sacks of organic manure to spread among her crops of “Canchan” variety of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thick thread for embroidery

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba has been buying and selling sacks of maize in Brasi, a village near Cape Coast, for 4 years. Aba has received senior high education. She is married to a farmer and has eight dependent children. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Aba's loan will be used to buy additional sacks of maize to increase her supply. She hopes to reinvest the new profit. At the time of the visit, Aba was yet to receive her new consignment. She is standing in front of the store where she keeps the maize.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of maize.

loans.name: Duo Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
DUO LIRIO DE LOS VALLES:
ESTA CONFORMADO POR LAS SIGUIENTES SOCIAS MIRIAM Y JUANA, MIRIAN ES CASADA TIENE TRES HIJOS ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE TEJIDOS A MANO, ELABORA MANTELES , CUBRECAMAS, TAPETES Y BLUSAS SU PRODUCTO LO VENDE DE AMBULANTE Y TAMBIEN LE ENCARGAN , ELLA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA SEGUIR CONFECCIONANDO SUS TEJIDOS.HILOS, DOÑA JUANA ELLA TIENE DOS HIJOS Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES,PRIMERA NECECIADA, NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA Y PODER SURTIR MAS SU TIENDA Y OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS.
texts.en:
DUO LIRIO DE LOS VALLES:
This group has two members: Miriam and Juana.  Mirian is married and has three children.  Her business is weaving products by hand.  She makes place mats, bedspreads, tablecloths and blouses.  She sells her products as an itinerant vendor and people also place orders with her.  She needs this loan to buy raw materials so that she can continue weaving her products.  She will buy threads.

Juana has two children and her business is selling food products and essential household products.  She needs her loan to buy more merchandise, stock her store and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving products and to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Adjoa sells different types of underwear in Abura. She will use this loan to purchase more underwear to expand her business. With the new profits generated from this loan, Adjoa plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear to expand her business.

loans.name: Edith Nicolette

texts.fr: Née le 19 Octobre 1970, Edith Nicolette est mariée à Pascal, un hôtelier. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Edith Nicolette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Edith Nicolette  a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et a appris la couture, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis vingt quatre ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Edith Nicolette vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Edith Nicolette s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Edith Nicolette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira certainement à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Born on October 19, 1970, Edith Nicolette is married to Pascal, a hotelier. They have two children, who both go to school. Edith Nicolette lives with her husband and her children. Edith Nicolette stopped attending school at the secondary level and learned how to sew, which she has been doing with a passion for 24 years, and which has enabled her to provide for herself. On the side, Edith Nicolette also sells sewing supplies in her shop. Edith Nicolette buys her supplies from Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the second time that Edith Nicolette is asking for a loan from ALIDé. This loan will most certainly help her enhance her business, in order to better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells fried fish and Fante kenkey (a staple dish similar to a sourdough dumpling) in Abura near Brasi. She is a widow taking care of seven dependents, whose needs are increasing. Efua therefore needs to increase her production to increase sales to be able to take care of them. A loan will help her buy more maize and fresh fish to fry for sale. She anticipates reinvesting her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize and fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba has been selling maize in both large and small quantities in Abura, near Brasi, for 10 years.  She and her husband take care of five dependents. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Aba uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Aba will use this loan to purchase more bags of maize for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle est née le 12 Octobre 1967. Mariée à un agent de pharmacie, Gisèle a quatre enfants à charge qui ne sont pas scolarisés. Gisèle et son mari vivent ensemble avec les enfants à charge. Ayant arrêté l’école au cours primaire, Gisèle a appris ensuite la couture, une activité qu’elle exerce depuis une quinzaine d’année et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Gisèle vend des boissons (bissap, sucette, glace, etc.) à son domicile. Gisèle s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Gisèle sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit ; crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son salon de couture par une nouvelle machine à surfilage.
texts.en: Gisèle was born on October 12, 1967. Gisèle is married to a pharmacy officer and takes care of four children, who do not go to school. Gisèle and her husband live with the children they are taking care of. Gisèle stopped attending school at the secondary level and then learned how to sew, which she has been doing for 15 years, and which has enabled her to provide for herself. On the side, Gisèle sells drinks (hibiscus tea, lollipops, ice cream, etc.) from home. Gisèle buys her supplies from Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. In order to meet the needs of her customers, Gisèle is requesting a loan for the second time. She will use this loan to equip her sewing room with a new serger.

loans.use: to buy a new serger and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Angel Gabriel Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su 2º ciclo. El comité es muy responsable, lo cual se puede apreciar en su comportamiento de pago y en la actividad.
La Sra. Inoncia solicita el crédito para invertir en la adquisición de artículos de limpieza de cutis; cremas para manos, pies y cuerpo; kits de maquillajes, entre otros.
Ella es una mujer humilde y sacrificada que busca mediante esta actividad, encontrar un espacio dentro del comercio, puesto que en la actualidad muchas personas, en especial las mujeres, recurren a estos artículos de belleza generando ingresos que pueden, sin dudas, ayudar a sostener la canasta familiar.
Todas las mujeres buscan contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas de Kiva para progresar en el día a día.
texts.en:
This committee is in its second cycle.  It is a very responsible committee, something that can be appreciated in their payment behavior and activity.

Inoncia is asking for the loan to buy skin cleansers, hand, feet and body creams, and make-up kits, among others.

She is a humble, longsuffering woman who seeks through this activity to find a niche in commerce since presently many people, especially women, rely on these beauty supplies generating income that can, no doubt, help her support her family’s basic needs.

All of the women hope to count on help from Kiva lenders to progress day to day.

loans.use: to buy skin cleaning supplies, creams for the hands, face and body, make-up kits, etc.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua sells dresses and cooks wakye (rice and beans cooked together) for sale in Abura. Wakye is normally served with wele (cowhide), macaroni, salad and hot pepper sauce. Akosua has completed senior high school. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She assists her husband in providing for her family's basic needs. Her loan will be used to buy rice, black-eyed peas and other items to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, black-eyed peas and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Maame Yaa

texts.en: Maame sells palm oil and palm kernel oil in the village of Brasi in Cape Coast. She has received junior high education. Maame is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She assists her husband to feed and educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to process into palm and kernel oil for resale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit. Maame is standing by the kernels she uses to produce the palm kernel oil.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to process into oil for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married to a farmer and has four children. She has been smoking various kinds of fish for sale in Abura, near Brasi, for 15 years. Adjoa uses the income she makes from her sales to help her husband pay utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale. Adjoa plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana has a pharmacy in Abura, near Brasi, in Cape Coast. and has been in this business for 15 years. She wants to supply more medicines to her customers and so needs a loan to fill her shop. Nana is married to a farmer and has four children. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She hopes to reinvest her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este comité inició gracias a la Señora Irmina, quien trabaja vendiendo remedios refrescantes en la Avda. Carlos Antonio López. Ella vive en la zona del Barrio San Miguel de Ciudad del Este y contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Torype Oñondivepa" y cuenta con 19  integrantes, las integrantes del grupo  se destacan  en el barrio por ser muy unidas y responsables en la comunidad, ya que realizan obras de caridad y actividades para el fondo del grupo. Ellas tienen actividades diferentes  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor y cuentan con un ingreso fijo.
Irmina desea poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro en el que puedan estudiar y ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
This committee started thanks to Irmina who works selling refreshing remedies on Carlos Antonio López Avenue.  She lives in the San Miguel neighborhood in Ciudad del Este and contacted her friends and neighbors to become part of the area committee.

The committee is called “Torype Oñondivepa” and has 19 members.  The group members stand out in the neighborhood for being very united and responsible in the community since they carry out charitable deeds and activities for the group’s fund.  They have different occupations and some are starting new work and have fixed incomes.

Irmina wants to provide her children with a better quality of life so that in the future they’ll be able to study and become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies or natural medicines to resell.

loans.name: Socorro Auxiliadora

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA SOCORRO AUXILIADORA, ELLA TRABAJA COMO INSPECTORA DE HIGIENE TIENE DIEZ AÑOS DE EJERCER ESE OFICIO, ES MADRE DOLTERA DE UN NIÑO Y ESTE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
ELLA VISITA NUESTRA OFICINA DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, PERLINES Y PINTURA PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
ESTE ES EL CRDITO NUMERO ONCE QUE SOLICITA  CON CEPRODEL, TODO ESTO PARA DARLES UNA MEJOR CONDICION DE VIDA A SU FMAILIA.
texts.en:
Socorro Auxiliadora works as a Health Inspector.  She’s been in this job for ten years.  She’s a single mother of a little boy who is school aged.  She visits Ceprodel’s office to ask for a loan to buy building materials and supplies like zinc metal sheeting, purlines and paint to repair her roof.

This is loan #11 that she requests from Ceprodel.  All of this is in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to make snacks and to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to fry doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Del Ejido Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DEL EJIDO", eligieron este nombre debido a que las señoras estaban trabajando juntas, consideran este prestamo como una nueva esperanza para los planes que tienen para sus negocios. Estan ubicadas en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes. Maria Rocio es una integrante del grupo. Ella tiene 49 años y culmino sus estudios de primaria en su comunidad. La señora se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en su localidad ya que cuenta con una tienda. Tiene dos hijos (una hija de 19 años y un hijo de 17 años). La sseñora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes ya varios años y solicita el prestamo para invertir en la mercancia para su negocio. Desea consolidar su negocio para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la universidad de sus dos hijos y asi ellos puedan tener una mejor oportunidad de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group is called "LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DEL EJIDO", (The Ejido’s New Hope).  They chose this name because the women had been working together and consider this loan as a new hope for the plans they have for their businesses.  

They are located in the State of México.  The group has 9 members.  María Rocío is one of the members.

She is 49 years old and finished elementary school in her community.  She is a Grocer in her locality and has a store.  She has two children (a 19-year-old daughter and a 17-year-old son).  She has sold groceries for several years now and is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise for her store.  She wants to enhance her business to help her husband pay for her two children’s university expenses so that they will have a better opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells fried fish at Abura near Brasi in Cape Coast. Ama has received a junior high education. She is a widow taking care of five dependants. Ama has been selling fish for 20 years. She feeds, clothes and educates her dependants with the income she makes from her sales. A loan from Kiva will enable her to buy larger quantities of fish to fry for resale. She hopes to provide a meaningful education for her children and reinvest into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of fish

loans.name: Xiomara Elena

texts.es:
Xiomara de 46 años de edad casada y con 5 hijos en las edades de 13 a 26 años, reside con su familia en el barrio Las Américas, comunidad que mediante  procesos de sociogestión,   ha logrado adecuar parques y la unidad entre vecinos, que allí habitan,  con el liderazgo de su madre, muchos de ellos son parte de la basta clientela,  que tiene Xiomara en su negocio de confeccionar prendas de vestir como camisas, pantalones y ropa femenina en general.
Desde muy pequeña Xiomara jugaba con sus amigas y ella era la modista de su muñecas, desde ahí mostró su inclinación por este arte, en el que hoy tiene 20 años de experiencia en el oficio y 17 como emprendedora de su negocio,  ubicado en un local de su propiedad. De este negocio  Xiomara se siente orgullosa de su desempeño, adicionándole que es  la actividad que más le gusta y con la que ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar, principalmente en lo relacionado con el estudio de sus hijos; en sus operaciones cuenta con una máquina sencilla, una fileteadora y una descubridora, además de herramientas para lograr un buen desempeño, aunque su sueño es tener su infraestructura de negocios con tecnología de punta,  para ofrecer muchos empleos a gente que lo necesitara. 
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará  rollos de telas e insumos para la fabricación de vestidos femeninos que tiene encargados y requiere dar respuesta oportuna a  sus clientes; esta  inversión será exitosa porque entregará a nuevos y recomendados clientes lo producido y con esta negociación aumentará su cartera de cuentas por cobrar, logrando también impactar sus utilidades. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda y en este sentido  se esfuerza diariamente por trabajar de manera persistente para lograrlo; mientras esto ocurre Xiomara  continua generando una rentabilidad no menor del 40%  que planea sostener, para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Xiomara, 46, is married and has 5 children whose ages range from 13 to 26 years.  She lives with her family in the Las Américas neighborhood, a community that is undergoing community organization; under her mother’s leadership the neighbors that live there have united and managed to equip parks.  Many of them are part of the vast clientele that Xiomara has in her dressmaking business.  She makes shirts, pants and women’s clothes in general.

Ever since she was a little girl, Xiomara would play with her friends and she was the dolls’ dressmaker.  Since then she showed her inclination towards this art.  Today, she has 20 years experience in the occupation and 17 running her business located in a site she owns.  

Xiomara is very proud of her development adding that it’s the activity which she most enjoys and with which she’s managed her home especially with respect to her children’s schooling.  

In her operation she has a simple sewing machine, an overlock machine and an interlock machine as well as additional tools to produce quality items although her dream is to have in her business’ infrastructure the most technologically advanced machines to offer employment to people who need it.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy three bolts of fabric and supplies to make women’s dresses she has on order and has to have ready on time for her customers.  This investment will be successful because she will deliver completed orders to new and recommended customers which will lead to an increase in her accounts receivable portfolio which, in turn, impacts her profits.

Her goal for later on is to modify her home so she strives daily with this in mind and works persistently in order to reach it.  While this happens, though, Xiomara continues generating a profit margin of no less than 40% that she plans to sustain so that her business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: For the past 11 years, Adjoa has been making kenkey (Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish) at Abura near Brasi. She is a single parent taking care of two children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more bags of maize to store for later use. At the time of the visit, Adjoa was yet to prepare the kenkey and so she is showing the pot she uses to cook the dough.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize

loans.name: El Pozito De Atotonilco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "El Pozito de Atotonilco", ya que en ese lugar hay un pequeño parque y hay agua que brota, esta ubicado en el Estado de México, el grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes, la señora Minerva es integrante del grupo, tiene 42 años, estudio solo hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica al comercio ya que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, actualmente solo mantiene a un hijo de 20 años. Solicito el prestamo para comprar un poco de mercancia para tener mejor surtida su tienda y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes que principalmente son de la misma localidad, comenta que el servicio que brinda y la disponibilidad le han permitido captar una mayor cantidad de clientes. Al momento de solicitar el credito se siente contenta ya que ha trabajando de la manera adecuada y sin contratiempos, al invertir en su negocio ella espera obtener un mayor ingreso que le permita seguir comprando mas productos, el esfuerzo y dedicacion es la base que tiene para seguir creciendo junto con su negocio. Con las ganancias que obtenga desea ahorrar para brindarle una carrera profesional a su hijo y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This group is called "The Small Atotonilco Well," since it is located in a small park with a well. It is located in the state of Mexico and formed by 11 members. Mrs. Minerva is a member, is 42 years old, studied up to junior high school, and sells items in a grocery store. At the moment she is just raising a 20 year old son.  She is requesting the loan to supply her grocery store with more merchandise to offer clients from her area. She comments that the service she offers and her availability have allowed her have a large number of clients. At the moment she feels confident in requesting the loan since she has worked properly and without any setbacks. By investing in her business she hopes to make the highest amount of profits possible to continue restocking. The effort and dedication are the foundation she has to continue growing with her business. She plans to save up the profits she makes to help her son get a career and have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité “5 de Mayo” tiene más de  2 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. La mayoría de sus integrantes ya realiza actividades productivas. Entre dichas actividades se encuentran la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso, venta de mercaderías varias como: fideo, azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos, venta de ropas, venta de remedios etc.
La Sra. Cirila específicamente desea el crédito para contar con su propio local en el cual se dedique al servicio de comidas y bebidas en general. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
texts.en:
The committee "May 5th" has been around for 2 years and has worked with the Paraguayan Foundation. The majority of the members already work. The activities they participate in include selling fruits and vegetables, snacks such as meat pies, chicken pies, cheese and ham pies, products such as: noodles, sugar, flour, oil, ham, including others, clothes, remedies, etc.

Mrs. Cirila specifically is requesting the loan to have her own locale to sell meals and beverages. She wants a better future for her children so she doubles her efforts to provide for their development and growth.

loans.use: buy beverages and products to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su 2º ciclo. Es un grupo excelente, se caracteriza por su humildad y su responsabilidad en cuanto al comportamiento en el pago y solidaridad con las vecinas. Todas las señoras son madres de familias que ayudan a su pareja en la manutención del hogar.
Liduvina es una mujer que desea progresar y por ello ha optado dedicarse a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, incluyendo remeras, camisas, pantalones, polleras, vestidos, etc. razón de la solicitud del crédito, para comenzar este emprendimiento que le permita hacer frente  a los grandes desafíos de la vida actual.
texts.en:
This group is in it's 2º phase, and its members are humble and responsible in terms of repaying credit.  All of this group's members are in solidarity as mothers of families whose earnings help sustain their households.
Liduvina has chosen clothing sales as her business, and she sells a variety of women's, children's and men's clothing (pants, shirts, suits, etc.)  Obtaining this credit will help her build a wholesale inventory for re-sale and attain better earnings to confront life's challenges.

loans.use: to buy inventory of women's, children's and men's clothing (pants, shirts, suits, etc.)

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su 8vo ciclo. Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, las participantes trabajan todos los días para salir adelante.
La Sra. Ramona anhela el crédito para levantar su negocio, dedicándose a la producción D. comestibles, como empanadas en su variedad, sandwiches, milanesas, papas fritas, etc. con los cuales espera generar ingresos que la ayuden a seguir dando una mano en la manutención D. hogar, y sobretodo lograr que sus hijos no pasen necesidad.
