Ella comparte su tiempo entre sus estudios y el comercio ya que se  dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días ya que donde que ella va lleva su revista para que sus clientes le realicen los pedidos de lo que necesitan, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos,  deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que ella aprovecha las ofertas ya que aquí le salen más baratas y luego ella las vende al precio normal con lo cual le quedan más ganancias, nos cuenta que su negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, y cremas.

Sus sueños es terminar sus estudios y conseguir un trabajo en una escuela para impartir sus conocimientos y su cariño por los niños.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita near Portoviejo we find a place known as the sandy ground, here find every two weeks the members of the Miraflores Communal Bank, the area is known for its beautiful beaches, the food and by the warmth of its people.

Jessica is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she enjoys it since all of her colleagues in the bank are very responsible. She is 21 years old, single and attends the Technical University of Manabí where she hopes to graduate as a schoolteacher and from she says she loves children, she lives in her parents’ home.

Jessica spends her time between schoolwork and business since she sells Esika products (beauty products, makeup, perfumes and accessories for women) by catalogue. She works everyday since she takes her magazine everywhere she goes so that her customers make their orders for whatever they need. She sells door to door and by order, and on credit and collects every week, Jessica says that she takes advantage of the sale items since they are cheaper and later sells them at the normal rate which gives her more income, she also states that she began her business with the first loan.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, makeup and creams.

Jessica dreams of finishing her studies and finding a job in a school to impart her knowledge and love for children.

loans.use: buy perfumes, costume jewelry, makeup and creams.

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabet de 36 años, es una mujer muy honesta y trabajadora, está casada con Ivan de 30 años, y en compañía de sus dos hijas, Camila de 4 y Yamila de 2 años, vive en casa  de su tío, ubicado en la localidad de Palcamayo. Ella vende todos lo viernes hortalizas en la feria de sus localidad, gracias a sus seis terrenos de cultivo, dos de ellos arrendados, que le producen en cantidad éste producto. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente para lograr abastecer la demanda que genera las verduras en la capital y está muy contenta del éxito obtenido, afirma que se dedica al 100 % en su siembra y asegura que todo cultivo  es rentable,”solo tienen que aprovechar al máximo las temporadas de siembra”, menciona. En estos meses ya cosechará una gran cantidad de espinaca de buena calidad gracias al cuidado y dedicación que les brinda. Próximamente sembrará lechuga y zanahoria; con el tiempo espera completar sus ahorros y poder comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Por otro lado, incursionó hace algunos meses, como promotora de educación; enseñando a niños menores de 5 años, actividad del que gana un dinero extra, y confiesa que le gusta mucho pues se dedica a trabajar durante las mañanas por lo que le da tiempo para dedicarse a sus cultivos en las tardes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde esperar aprender mucho de las capacitaciones que ofrecen en su asociación. Elizabet, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja, espinaca, zanahoria y flor de gladiolo, en este último comprará además semilla munición (primera etapa de maduración), y también bulbillos (segunda etapa de maduración), para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Elizabet is 36 years old; she is a very honest and hardworking woman. She is married and lives with Ivan who is 30 years old and with their two daughters Camila who is 4 and Yamila who is 2 years of age in her uncle’s home located in Palcamayo. Elizabet sells vegetables every Friday in the local market thanks to her six plots of land of which two are rented and the rest generate a great deal of vegetables. Elizabet has worked in agriculture for some 6 years, enough time to be able to meet the demand that her vegetables get in the capital and is very happy with her success and says that she dedicates 100% to her crops and assures that every harvest is profitable, “you only have to make good use of the harvest season” she says. In the upcoming months Elizabet, will harvest a great quantity and quality of spinach thanks to the care and dedication that she gives them. Later she will grow lettuce and carrots. With time, Elizabet hopes to save enough to be able to buy more plots of land. Some months back Elizabet worked as a teacher for children under 5, work that gave her extra income and she says that she enjoyed it a great deal and continues to work in the mornings which give her time to work her crops in the afternoons. She belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” Communal Bank; this is her second loan with MFP and hopes to learn a lot from the services that her association offers. Elizabet will use the loan to buy seeds: peas, spinach, carrots, and gladiolus flowers as well as ammunition seeds (the first stage of development) and bulbs (the second stage of development) for her second harvest.

loans.use: buy spinach seeds, peas and carrots as well as two types of seeds of gladiolus.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario José se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, tiene más de 32 años con este negocio. Inicio este medio de vida por un hermano que le enseño este medio de vida. Mario se ha caracterizado por brindarle a su clientes lo que ellos le solicitan, por lo que se sienten muy satisfechos. El crédito es para la compra de pomadas, pastillas, vitaminas, entre otros productos. el desea ampliar su negocio más para tener un inventario muy amplio y ofrecer una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en: Mario José sells medicine; he has done this job for over 32 years. He began working in this field through his brother who taught him. Mario is known for giving his customers what they need, which is why they are very pleased. The loan is to buy balms, pills, vitamins and other products. Mario wishes to expand his business to have a bigger inventory and to give a greater variety of products.

loans.use: buy balms, pills, vitamins and other products.

loans.name: Sugey Maria

texts.es:
Sugey, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, es madre de dos hijos de 13 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, ella es originaria de León, de oficio comerciante ella es dueña de una pulpería y tiene una  mini tienda de ropa y zapatos. Ella inicio este negocio cuando tenia 30 años de edad ella vende pantalones, sandalias, camisas, ropa, interior, productos Avon así como también vende arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche en su pulpería. Con los ingresos de su pulpería mantiene su hogar  y paga la educación de sus hijos, antes ella se dedicaba  a la venta de cosa de horno(Pan de maíz),ropa para  niños , vendía en las calles, además otro medio de subsistencia que tenia era que daba clases privadas de para niños de primaria. Hoy en día vive de los ingresos de su venta y del aporte de su esposo que trabajo como conductor de taxi.
Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos para la temporada del día de las madres, ya que en esta época es buena para las ventas. Esta inversión le ayudara a   poder ofrecer mas productos nuevos, disponibilidad de inventario para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, atraer más compradores, incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sugey is 36 years old, married and is a mother to two children of 13 and 6 years of age. She is originally from León and is a saleswoman and owns a general store and has a mini clothing and shoe store. She began her work when she was 30; Sugey sells pants, sandals, shirts, underwear, Avon products as well as rice, oil, sugar, and milk in her grocery store. With the earnings from her grocery store she is able to support her home and pays for her children’s education. Before she sold baked goods (cornbread) and children’s clothing in the street, another way to make money was giving private classes for primary school children. At present, she lives from her sales and her husband’s income as a taxi driver.

Sugey needs the loan to buy merchandize like clothing, shoes, makeup for the mothers’ day season since it is a good time for sales. This loan will help her offer new products, have the available inventory needed by her customers demands, have more buyers and to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: buy merchandize like clothing, shoes, makeup for the mothers’ day season.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 30 años de edad, soltera sin carga familiar directa, actualmente vive en el Caserío Sialupe Baca ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Lambayeque

Se gana la vida desde hace 15  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Milagros solicita el está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para  invertir en compra de aves menores para engorde, respectivo alimento balanceado para aves y cerdos, con la finalidad de poder ampliar su negocio y vender sus animales en diferentes localidades.

Milagros es una mujer que ha trabajado desde muy joven, bastante responsable que desea alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milagros is 30 years old, single, and she doesn't have any family in her care. She lives in the community of Sialupe Baca, located at 15 minutes from the city of Lambayeque. She has been earning her living for the past 15 years by raising and selling small livestock. She has a corral located in the posterior part of her property. She raises pork, sheep, turkeys, and ducks and she feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a good stage in their development she offers them for sale to the merchants who always visit the region where she lives.

Milagros requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of small livestock to raise and to purchase feed for poultry and pigs. Her goal is to expand her business and to sell her livestock in different locations.

Milagros is a woman who has worked since she was very young, who is very responsible, and who wants to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock to raise and to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco casado su esposa es comerciante, su hijo estudian carrera técnica que su hijo se prepare prioridad es. Tiene su propio negocio y junto con su esposa trabajan para salir adelante. Vende ropa, cosméticos. Iniciaron con fondo de microcréditos. Con el préstamo comprar mercadería: bisutería, capotes, ropa de dama, caballero y niños, también perfumes, cremas de piel, ropa interior para aumentar su negocio obteniendo mayores utilidades.
texts.en: Francisco is married and his wife is a merchant.  His son is studying for a technical degree and his priority is his education.   He has his own business and he and his wife work together to get ahead.  He sells clothing and cosmetics and started his business with microcredit funds.  He will use the loan to purchase merchandise: costume jewelry, capes, ladies’, gentlemen’s, and children’s clothing as well as perfume, skin cream, and underwear. His goal is to increase his business and obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dollyveetss

texts.es:
La Sra. Dollyveetss pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Gaviotas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 44 años y tiene 03 hijos, solo están a su cargo 02 de ellos.
Cunado sus padres fallecen le dejan como herencia la casa en la que vivían, ella rápidamente puso a funcionar allí su negocio. Ella ofrece en alquiler cuartos indipendientes, en la actualidad tiene 10 inquilinos.  Su capital para adecuar la casa como hospedaje fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles.
Entre sus clientes podemos encontrar a estudiantes y personas que  están de visita en la ciudad de Tarapoto.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sábanas, utensilios de limpieza y materiales de limpieza que puedan ayudar a dar un buen mantenimiento a su negocio. 

Dollyveetss es una mujer muy hábil en los negocios y su sueño es construir un segundo piso para poder ofrecer muchas más habitaciones y está muy segura que lo va a lograr gracias al apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dollyveetss belongs to the Las Gaviotas (The Seagulls) II Communal Bank, in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín.  She is 44 years old and unmarried.  She has 3 children but only 2 are in her care.

When her parents died, she inherited the house in which they lived.  She quickly put her business into operation there.  She offers self-contained rooms for rent and currently has 10 tenants.  The capital required to adapt her home as a guest house was S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.

Among her customers, we find students and people who are visiting Tarapoto.  She will use the loan of S/. 1,500.00 to purchase sheets, cleaning supplies, and cleaning products to help keep her guest house well-maintained.  

Dollyveetss is a very clever business woman and her dream is to build a second floor in order to be able to offer many more rooms for rent.  She is quite sure that she is going to achieve this goal thanks to the support of El Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, cleaning supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania, de 65 años, es una mujer que lucha contra las dificultades, ella vive con su mamá y su nieta en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Palcamayo. Hace 40 años se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como habas y arvejas; los cuales vende en el mercado central de su ciudad, ahora necesita expandirse más, ya que tiene mayores responsabilidades, pues perdió a su hija, dejándole a cargo a su nieta del cual se esfuerza para que no le falte nada, su deseo es verla como una profesional exitosa; por ello está invirtiendo en la compra de un pequeño terreno para poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas y llevarlas a la capital de su país, donde las verduras tienen mayor demanda. A pesar de su avanzada edad, quiere seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, “es una diversión”, asegura. Además de dedicarse al cuidado de animales menores como: cuyes, gallinas, carnero y burros, para engordarlos para luego venderlos a los carniceros y vecinos de su localidad, que constantemente le solicitan. Ahora ella desea mantener las fuerzas para seguir adelante, ahorrar lo necesario y cuidar de su madre que está un poco enferma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde está segura que podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de su asociación que es muy unida y solidaria. Epifania, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de espinaca y zanahoria; que cuesta un promedio de S/. 120 soles cada lata, de la misma manera invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Epifania is 65 years old and is a woman who struggles against difficulties.  She lives with her mother and her granddaughter in her own home, located in the town of Palcamayo.  For 40 years, she has grown vegetables such as broad beans and peas, which she sells at her city’s central market.  Now that she has greater responsibilities, she needs to expand her business further.  After she lost her daughter, she was left in charge of her granddaughter, whom she strives to provide for so that she will not lack anything. Her desire is to see her become a successful professional.  

For this reason, she is investing in the purchase of a small field in order to be able to cultivate a large amount of vegetables and take them to the capital of her country where there is a great demand for vegetables.  Despite her advanced age, she wishes to continue devoting herself to agriculture.  “It’s a hobby”, she assures us.  In addition, she cares for small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, rams and donkeys, which she fattens and then sells to the butchers and neighbors in her town who constantly request them.  

Now she wants to maintain the strength to go forward, to save what is necessary, and care for her mother who is mildly ill.  She belongs to the Patrón San Cristóbal Communal Bank, and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is sure that she will be able to get ahead with the help of the association as they are very united and supportive.  Epifania will use the loan to purchase spinach and carrot seed, which costs an average of S/. 120 soles per can.  She will also purchase several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy cans of spinach and carrot seeds as well as bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Julia Celina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julia, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tuvo cinco  hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, sus otros  hijos ya son mayores de edad y dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, un soltero y una hija que es madre soltera y que vive junto a su pequeño hijo. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que también se dedica a la limpieza de pescado. Ella realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y también al comercio del mismo, él además de pescar también compra a barcos pesqueros en alta mar, luego que comprar sus productos los lleva a tierra firme para venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta estas playas y en ciertas ocasiones también se desplaza hasta las empresas y entrega directamente sus productos. Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que el esposo lleva más de 40 años dedicado a estas actividades ya que empezó desde muy joven.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado y materiales de pesca como  combustible, redes, etc. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta por las charlas.
 
Su sueño es tener muy buena salud.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo, we find a place known as the sandy ground.  Here, the members of the Miraflores Communal Bank meet every fifteen days.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy, and the warmth of its people.

In this locale, we meet Julia, who is 53 years old. She in a common-law relationship and has five children, but one of them died.  Her other children are adults and two of them still live at home.  One is unmarried and one daughter is a single mother and lives with her small son.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a great housewife who also cleans the fish.  She is taking the loan for her husband who is in the fishing business.  In addition to fishing, he also buys fish from the fishing boats at sea.  As soon as he buys his products, he takes them ashore and sells them to traders who come to these beaches.  Sometimes, he also travels to the companies and delivers his products directly.  

Our friend tells us that her husband has devoted more than 4 years to this business as he started very young.

This loan is to buy fish and fishing equipment such as fuel, nets, etc.  She has been with the communal bank from the start and enjoys the conversations.    Her dream is to have very good health.

loans.use: to buy fish and fishing equipment such as fuel, nets, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagros pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza” D. Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia  y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada y tiene 2 hijos.

Motivada por una amiga, se inicia en la venta de productos de belleza con un capital de S / 500.00 nuevos soles, actividad que en la actualidad le da la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos y aportar así a la economía D. hogar, y como mujer sentirse realizada.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00 soles comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Milagros se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización de sus ideas y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Milagros belongs to the Luz y Esperanza (Light and Hope) Communal Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín.  She is married and has two children.  With S/500.00 nuevos soles in capital and motivated by her friend, she began selling beauty products.  Currently, this business gives her the opportunity to generate her own income and contribute to the household budget, as well as feel fulfilled as a woman.

With this loan of S/1700.00 soles, she will buy beauty products for stock such as ladies’ and gentlemen’s perfumes, creams, and powder compacts; talcum powder for both adults and babies; lipstick and nail polish.  In addition, she will purchase another showcase to display her products.  

Milagros is very happy and wishes to continue working toward the implementation of her ideas. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women such as herself to have opportunities to develop themselves in the communities where they operate.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfume, creams, powder compacts, taclum powder, etc.

loans.name: Emérita

texts.es:
La Sra. Emérita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 65 años  y es madre D. seis hijos. 

Ella se  inicio en el negocio con la venta D. frutas en un pequeño puesto en un mercado D. la zonas, del que fue desalojada por problemas D. ordenamiento urbano D. la ciudad. Con su préstamo inicial D. S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, deciD. dedicarse a la venta D. agua mineral y bebidas gaseosas D. diferentes tamaños y sabores. Sus clientes más asiduos  son transeúntes, vecinos y público en general a quienes ella atienD. con la amabilidad que lacaracteriza.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2 000.00, comprará más cajas y paquetes D. bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral para venderlas heladas y por unidad. 

La Sra. Emérita sueña con ampliar su negocio, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Emérita belongs to the “Alisson II” Communal Bank in Tarapoto District, in the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 65 years old and married, with six children. 

She began her business selling fruit at a small stall in a local market, but was forced to move as a result of municipal redevelopment plans. With her first loan of 400 nuevos soles, she decided to buy mineral water and soft drinks of different sizes and flavours. Her most regular customers are passers by, neighbours and the general public, which she serves with the friendliness that characterises her.
 
With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy more boxes and packs of soft drinks and mineral water, which she will sell individually and chilled. 

Emérita dreams of being able to expand her business and is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have the opportunity to develop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and mineral water wholesale

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz se dedica al negocio de venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio por su Mama quien anteriormente se hacía cargo del negocio, pues al ver que le generaba ganancias Alba decide establecer su propio negocio ubicado en su vivienda, ella se siente feliz pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar las deliciosas tortillas que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de leña, comal, bolsas, servilletas, cal, maíz, entre otros productos. Sueña con aumentar su inventario y además proporcionarle mejoras a su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alba Luz makes and sells tortillas. She has been in this business for more than 15 years; it was started by her Mom who used to be in charge. Alba saw the income that it was generating and decided to establish her own business in her home. She is happy because the majority of her customers come to her to buy the delicious tortillas that she offers.

The purpose of the loan is to buy firewood, a cast-iron skillet, bags, napkins, lime, corn and other things. She dreams of increasing her inventory and making improvements to her work area.

loans.use: to buy firewood, a cast-iron skillet, bags, napkins, lime, corn and other things

loans.name: Heydie Tatiana

texts.es:
Heydie, de oficio comerciante, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, esta casada, es originaria de un comarca llamada Cristo Rey ubicada en Quezalguaque un pueblo aledaño a la Ciudad de León, ella se dedica a criar cerdos y gallinas para venta. Inicio esta actividad por medio de su madre que le regalo un cerdo para reproducción, ella poco a poco fue haciendo crecer este negocio, después decidió dedicarse también a la reproducción y comercialización de gallinas.
Solicito el préstamo para  comprar material de construcción, mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y el negocio acondicionarlo mejor para la crianza de cerdos y gallinas.
Ella espera que este crédito le ayude a darle mejores condiciones a su casa, darles un techo digno a sus hijos y mejor presentación a su negocio. Su próxima meta es construir un galerón con desagüe para criar cerdos.
texts.en:
Heydie, a merchant, is 27 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is originally from a region called Cristo Rey, located in Quezalguaque, a town that neighbors the city of León. She raises pigs and hens for sale. She started doing this because of her mother, who gave her a pig for breeding. Little by little she grew the business, and she later decided to also breed and sell hens.

She asked for a loan to buy construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her house and to better equip her business for raising pigs and hens. 

She hopes that the loan will help her to improve the conditions of her home and give her children a dignified place to live, as well as improving the look of her business. Her next goal is to build a large shed with drainage for raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her house and better equip her business for raising pigs and hens.

loans.name: Arcelia Natividad

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
La señora Arcelia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta todo del banco, los créditos, los beneficios, las charlas y sobretodo la unión del grupo. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  siete hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos un viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que el esposo lo utilice en la agricultura, ellos siembran  arroz, verduras y ciertas frutas de ciclo corto,  trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 07h00 hasta las 15h00, nos cuenta que en ocasiones el contrata a otras personas para que le ayuden sobre todo cuando tiene que sembrar o  cosechar, cuando la cosecha esta lista la entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para comprar sus productos.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otras cosas.

Su sueño es tener buena salud para continuar hacia delante sin depender de nadie.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo, we find a place known as Los Arenales. Here the village bank Miraflores meets every 15 days. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its food and for the warmth of the people. 

Arcelia is a founding member of the village bank and she likes everything about the bank - the loans, the benefits, the presentations and above all the unity of the group. She is 52 years old, married and has 7 children who are now grown, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a farmer. 

She is a housewife who is taking out this loan so that her husband can use it for agriculture. They plant rice, vegetables and certain fruits with short growing cycles. They work Monday to Friday from 7:00am to 3:00pm. She tells us that on occasion they contract other people to help them when it's time to plant or harvest. When the harvest is ready they sell it to merchants that come to their house to buy their products.

Her dream is to have good health so that she can continue on without being dependent on anyone.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc.

loans.name: María Hilmer

texts.es:
La Sra. María Hilmer pertenece al Banco Comunal “Lideres del Futuro II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 30 años y tiene un niño de 1 año.

Desde muy pequeña le gustaba los negocios, es así que ya de joven decide trabajar a medio tiempo en el negocio de alimentos (preparación de comida), gracias a sus propios recursos y después de un año decide solo dedicarse a su negocio.

Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00  comprará más insumos como fideos, arroz, carnes, verduras  para la preparación de los menús  y futas para la elaboración de refrescos y así continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

María es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurant propio.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.

En la foto podrán apreciar a uno de sus más frecuentes clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Hilmer is a member of the community bank "Lideres del Futuro II" (Leaders of the Future II) which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province and department of San Martin. She is 30 years old, is single and has a one year old son. 

From a young age, she liked business so as a young woman she decided to work part time preparing food. Thanks to her own means she decided after a year to pursue her own business. 

With this loan of 1000 PEN she will buy supplies such as pasta, rice, meat and vegetables to prepare meals and fruits to make soft drinks so that she can take better care of her customers. 

Maria is a hard working woman. Her dream is to have her own restaurant. She is very grateful to field partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have the opportunities to realize their dreams. 

One of her frequent customers appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as pasta, rice, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Gina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gina de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta felizmente casada ya hace 25 años y su esposo trabaja con chófer en una cooperativa de bus y fruto de su relación tiene 7 hijos, 2 mujeres y 5 varones ya todos mayores de edad. Su actividad comercial es taller de costuras.

Comenzó hace unos años atrás cuando su mama cocía y ella le enseño posteriormente luego de casarse decidió abrir su negocio de confección en su casa para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. En lo general ella labora diariamente desde la mañana hasta el medio día que atiende a sus hijos y luego continua en su costuras. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea compara materiales para sus confecciones como telas y materiales para adecuar su vivienda. En un futuro con la bendición de Dios quiere tener mas fuerzas para seguir trabajando y ver a sus nietos crecer y lógicamente terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old and lives in an urban area in the the suburb of Guayaquil. She has been happily married for 25 years. Her husband works a driver for a bus cooperative. She has seven children, two women and five men all of them are adults. Her business is a sewing workshop.

She started sewing a few years ago. Gina's mother sewed and she showed Gina how to sew. After she got married she decided to open her own clothing business at home to support her husband with household expenses. In general, she works every day from morning until noon when she takes care of her children and then continues with her sewing. With the help of the loan she wants to purchase materials to make clothing such as fabric and materials to renovate her home. In the future, with God's blessing, she wants to have more strength to keep working and to see her grandchildren grow and of course to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials to renovate her home.

loans.name: Aracely Elizabeth

texts.es:
Aracely de 22 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Su negocio es la ventas de gaseosas.

Comenzó su actividad hace 8 meses en su domicilio vendiendo agua colas y bolos Bonice. Labora todos los días en su domicilio desde las 7H00 am a 6H00 pm. Su esposo trabaja en una Empresa llamada Sálica del Ecuador y tienen una hija de 5 años que estudia en una institución publica. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas producto para su negocio como colas bolos Bonice aguas para incrementar su capital. En un futuro desea mejorar su negocio y su vivienda para tener una vida mas tranquila con su familia.
texts.en:
Aracely is 22 years old and lives in a subdivision called Playas in one of the tourist areas of Ecuador that has a diverse selection of seafood. Her business is selling soft drinks. 

She started her business eight months ago in her home selling colas and "bolos" Bonice (a frozen sweet similar to a popsicle). She works every day from 7:00am until 6:00pm. Her husband works at a company called Salica del Ecuador. She has a five year old daughter that goes to public school. With the help of this loan she wants to buy more products for her store such as "bolos" Bonice and colas in order to increase her capital. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and her home so that she can have a more peaceful life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: El Cambio Va Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cambio Va está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Carmen del Socorro de 52 años quien se dedica a la venta de sandalia, ropa usada etc. desde hace 4 años.
Ella tiene cinco hijos mayores de los cuales sus dos hijas le ayudan una económicamente y la otra en el negocio. La señora Carmen invertirá en sandalia y ropa interior.
Las otras integrantes son la señora Cristina de 57 años quien vende nacatamales, leña, frijoles cocidos y horna etc. y la señora María Nieves de 63 años vende verduras, chiverías y leña.
texts.en:
The loan group "El Cambio Va" is comprised of three hardworking, enterprising women. The coordinator of the is group is 52 year old Carmen, who sells sandals, used clothes, etc, and has been doing this for 4 years.
She has 5 grown-up children and her 2 daughters help her out - one of them economically and the other by helping with the business. Carmen will use the loan to purchase sandals and underwear. 
The other members of the group are 57 year old Cristina, who sells steamed corn cakes, firewood, cooked beans, etc; and 63 year old María Nieves, who sells vegetables, dairy products, and firewood.

loans.use: to purchase sandals and underwear

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Carlos, es un humilde taxista, el tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, es padre de familia de un hijo el cual tiene 9 años de edad. Como todos los días Carlos sale en busca del sustento alimenticio de su familia, trabajando largas horas transportando a personas a diferentes partes de la ciudad, es un trabajo duro, pero el lo hace inspirado por sacar adelante a su familia dándoles lo mejor que el puede ,pues es le único que mantiene a su familia, el tuvo que vender una finca que tenia para poder comprar el taxi con el que trabaja, lleva 10 años laborando como conductor .
El solicito el préstamo para hacerle mantenimiento y reparación del motor, las partes externas del taxi. Este inversión le ayudara a darle mejores condiciones y servicio a sus clientes. El tiene como meta ahorrar lo suficiente para poder comprar un taxi un poco más nuevo que el que tiene esta un poco viejo.
texts.en:
Don Carlos is a humble taxi driver. He is 40 years old, lives in the city of León, and is the father of a 9 year old son. Carlos goes out every day to earn a living for his family, working long hours transporting people to different parts of the city. It is hard work, but he is motivated to help his family and give them the best that he can. He is the only one supporting his family, and he had to sell a farm that he owned to be able to buy the taxi that he drives. He has been working as a driver for 10 years. 
He is requesting a loan to maintain and repair the motor and exterior of his taxi. This investment will help him to offer better conditions and service to his customers. His goal is to save enough to buy a taxi that is a little newer than the one he has, which is a little old now.

loans.use: to maintain and repair the motor and exterior of his taxi.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a la ciudad de  Manta encontramos la ciudadela  Metropolitana, lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Metropolitana.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Narcisa, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen diez hijos, nueve de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una chica de 17 años que estudia en colegio y es la  que es la que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por enfermedad.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo de tipo y de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa va a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita mercadería. Nos cuenta que tiene un hijo que vende CD en el centro de la ciudad y este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar una máquina para quemar Cd y así poder tener un ingreso extra con esta máquina. También va comprar ropa y productos Avon para su negocio, nos cuenta que lleva tres años dedicada al comercio y le va muy bien.

Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, on the way to the city of Manta, is located the Metropolitana citadel, and this is where the members of the Banco Comunal Metropolitana meet every two weeks. 
Here we met Narcisa, who is 53 years old, married, and has 10 children from this marriage, 9 of whom are grown-up, and one girl of 17 who is at high school and is the only one who still lives at home. Her husband doesn't work due to an illness.
She is a house wife who, in order to earn her own living, sells clothes of all types and goods from Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works three days a week and she sells her goods door to door, giving her customers credit and collecting from them every week. Some of her goods are delivered to her home, but she goes to Guayaquil every time she needs to buy clothes to sell. She tells us that one of her sons sells CDs in the city center and she will use this loan to buy a machine for burning CDs so that he can make more profit. She will also buy clothes and Avon products. She tells us that she has been a merchant for 3 years and it suits her well.
This is the her third loan cycle with the community bank, and she likes it because the repayments are easy for her to make. 
Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, Avon products, and a machine for burning CDs.

loans.name: El 13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo el 13 lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Andrea de 53 años quien tiene una tortillería y fritanga. Ella inicio vendiendo yoltamal, atol y elote cocido con el cual saco adelante a sus seis hijos.
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite), carne, repollo, maíz…etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la señora Marisol de 38 años quien vende cosméticos desde hace 12 años y la señora Silvia Elena de 26 años comercializa calzado desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The group "El 13" is comprised of three hardworking, enterprising women. The group coordinator is 53 year old Andrea who has a tortilla and fried food business. She started out selling yoltamal (a type of tamale), atol (a corn-based desert), and cooked corn, and she did this to support her 6 children.
She will use the loan to buy basic groceries (rice, beans, oil), meat, cabbage, corn... etc.
The other members of the group are 38 year old Marisol, who has been selling cosmetics for 12 years, and 26 year old Silvia Elena, who has been selling shoes for 8 years.

loans.use: in groceries, meat, cabbage, corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Jacqueline

texts.es:
Patricia de 33 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años ambos en escuela fiscales. Tiene una papelería.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás viendo que por su sector no había una papelería donde los estudiante pueda comprar sus útiles escolares ya que tenían que ir hasta el centro y era peligroso para ellos. Con el pasar del tiempo fue incrementando su negocio ahora pueden encontrar de todo en su local. Labora desde las 6H00 am a 7H00 pm diariamente. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales ar su papelería como vitrinas , cuadernos, laminas todo para surtir mas su negocio. Lo que mas desea es tener un local mas apropiado y seguro para seguir incrementando su clientela con respecto a sus hijos espera poderles dar un lugar mas segura para vivir.
texts.en:
33 year old Patricia lives in a town called Playas, one of the tourist spots of Ecuador, which is known for its seafood. She is separated and has 2 children of 12 and 7 years old who are both in school. She runs a stationary store. 
She began doing this a while ago after seeing that her neighborhood didn't have a stationers where the students could buy their school supplies, so they had to go to the town center, which was dangerous for them. She has been growing her business over time, and today you can find everything in her store. She works from 6:00am until 7:00pm every day. She wants to use the loan to buy materials for her store such as display cases, notebooks, and sheets of paper, all in order to supply her store. What she wants much is to have a more secure and appropriate store so that she can continue growing her customer base. For her children, she hopes to give them a safer place to live.

loans.use: to buy display cases, notebooks, sheets of paper, and shampoos.

loans.name: Edwing

texts.es:
Edwing, 30 años, es un hombre trabajador y bueno, tiene dos hermanos pero solo vive con sus padres Aparicio de 60 y Teodora de 55 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Su vida es significado de esfuerzo, más aún que su razón de progreso y triunfo es su hermana Ana que estudia Gastronomía en la capital; motivo por el cual dejó sus estudios de Teología para apoyarla. Edwing lleva 15 años dedicándose al cultivo de espinaca, zanahoria y habas, las cosecha y las vende en el mercado central de su localidad también viaja dos veces por mes a la capital, donde lo comercializa a los mayoristas, a precios muy buenos que le permiten obtener buenas ganancias. Le gusta atender, regar y fumigar las plantas porque sabe que las hortalizas tiene mayor demanda que otros cultivos. Ahora él quiere incursionar en otros campos como la ganadería, “quiero comprar terrenos para la crianza intensiva”, afirma. Además de dedicarse al trasporte de productos con el camión que tiene, obteniendo así ganancias extras, que le sirven también para poder trasladar sus propios productos. Su mayor prioridad es sembrar y mejorar la calidad de sus productos para poder vender a un mayor precio sus cultivos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde está contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal donde puede compartir sus planes de negocio.
La camioneta de Edwing, está malograda por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará llantas para su repuesto, así como también invertirá en la compra de semilla de espinaca y abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Edwing, 30, is a good, hard working man.  He has two siblings but he only lives with his parents, Aparicio, 60, and Teodora, 55, in his own house located in Palcamayo.

His life is the epitome of effort; more so because his motivation for progress and triumph is his sister, Ana, who is studying Gastronomy in the capital.  He abandoned his Theology studies to support her.

Edwing has been growing spinach, carrots and broad beans for 15 years.  He harvests them and sells them in his locality’s central market.  He also travels twice a month to the capital to sell to wholesalers at very good prices that permit him to have good profits.

He enjoys caring for, watering and fumigating the plants because he knows that leafy green vegetables are in greater demand than other crops.  Now he wants to go into other fields like, cattle raising.  “I want to buy land for intensive cattle raising,” he affirms.  He also has a truck that he uses to transport products thus earning extra income; he can also use it to transport his own products. His main priority is to plant and improve the quality of his products so that he can sell his harvests at a higher price.

He belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” (Patron St. Christopher) communal bank and this is the 8th loan with MFP where he’s happy to belong to the communal bank where he can share his business plans.

Edwing’s truck is in disrepair so he will use the loan to replace the tires.  He will also buy spinach seeds and organic manure for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy tires as well as spinach seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Marina Santos

texts.es:
Marina de 53 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es viuda y tiene una hija mayor de edad. Tiene una papelería.

Empezó con su negocio hace 11 años con muy poco dinero ya que por una o otra razón le pedían en el sector artículos de papelería, con el pasar del tiempo a tenido sus altas y bajas en el negocio, hace unos 3 años su conyugue la abandono y a causa de eso su negocio bajo parcialmente, hace 4 meses su conyugue regreso pero al siguiente día falleció de un infarto, despues de esa tragedia ella se a dedicado 100% a su negocio. Labora de 7H30 am a 10H00 pm con ayuda de su hija .

Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas productos para su negocio como cuadernos, bolígrafos, papelería para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere arreglar su casa para que sus nietos puedan vivir en un ambiente acogedor y tener el negocio mas grande para que rinda mas.
texts.en:
Marina is 53 years old and lives in Playas canton which is one of Ecuador's tourist spots.  It has a wide range of seafood.  Marina is a widow and has a grown-up daughter.  She owns a stationery store.

Marina started her business 11 years ago with very little money since, for one reason or another, people in her sector were requesting stationery products from her.  Over time, she has had her ups and downs in her business.  Some three years ago, her husband left her and, as a result, her business declined slightly.  Four months ago, her husband returned but the next day he died of a heart attack.  Following this tragedy, she has dedicated herself to her business 100%.  She works from 7.30am to 10.00pm, with the help of her daughter.

With this loan, Marina would like to buy more products for her business such as composition books, pens and stationery to increase her income.  In the future, she would like to fix up her home so that her grandchildren can live in a welcoming environment.  She would also like a bigger business that can make her more money.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, composition books, pens and stationery

loans.name: Dorca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dorca lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Olivia de 54 años quien tiene una fritanga y realiza postres como atol, arroz de leche etc. el cual vende de manera ambulante desde hace 8 años.
Ella es madre y padre para sus tres hijos de 17, 10 y 7 años e invertirá el crédito en adquirir un tramo en el mercado. La meta de la señora Olivia es poner una panadería ya que tiene un horno con capacidad suficiente pero le falta la materia prima y unas mejoras para lograrlo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la señora Yuridia de 21 años quien tiene una fritanga y su meta es tener un puesto fijo, y la señora Aracely de 27 años quien vende nacatamales y postres tradicionales.
texts.en:
The group Dorca is made up of three hard working and enterprising women. One of these women is Olivia who is 54 years old and makes desserts such as porridge, rice pudding, etc. which she has been selling as a street vendor for eight years. 

She is both mother and father to her three children who are 17, 10 and 7 years old. She will invest this loan in acquiring a stall in the market. Olivia's goal is to establish a bakery since she has an over that would have a sufficient capacity. However, she lacks the raw materials and some improvements in order to achieve this. The other members of the group are Yuridia who is 21 years old, has a small restaurant and whose goal is to have a fixed stall and Aracely who is 27 years old and sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and traditional desserts.

loans.use: to acquire a stall in a market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, underwear, blouses, shoes, slippers, men's shirts, towels, irons, etc.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 34años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Esta casado y su esposa se dedica en la venta de comesticos por catálogos tienen2 hijos menores de edad que estudian en colegio fiscales. Tiene un taller de soldadura (metales).

El aprendió con sus hermanos que tenían un taller y se independizo ya que por su casa era conocido y comenzó realizando trabajos a amigos como enderezando autos o metales o en las pintadas.. Labora solo todos los días en su casa y se queda hasta la 10H00 pm o mas si el tiempo lo amerita. Le dificulta en su trabajo son las pintura ya que también hace ese tiempo de trabajo en su taller y con el tiempo que va inhalando eso su salud le va a afectando. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere adecuar su taller hacerlo mas grande para asi poder realizar sus trabajos mas tranquilo. En un futuro quiere ver a sus hijos profesionales y que no pasen por el trabajo duro como el lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Luis, age 34, lives in the periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountainous roads. Luis is married and his wife works in catalog sales of cosmetics. He owns a metalworking shop. The couple has two young children who attend school at a public high school. 

Luis learned his trade from his brothers, who have their own workshop. He was able to branch off and start his own workshop, thanks to the good reputation of his family's work. He started with jobs from his friends, repairing automobile dents and paintwork. He works alone every day until 10:00 p.m. or later, if necessary. Paint jobs are the most difficult part of his work, since they take a lot of time and the paint fumes are harmful to his health. 

With the help of this loan, Luis hopes to expand his workshop space so that he can work more effectively. He hopes to one day see his children pursue professional careers rather than taking a job like his, which requires hard manual labor.

loans.use: To buy cement and concrete blocks for repair shop.

loans.name: Zumilda Margarita Espera

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a la ciudad de Manta encontramos la ciudadela  Metropolitana, lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Metropolitana.

La señora Zunilda es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para poder financiar su negocio ya que con este ella puede ganarse la vida honradamente. Tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  y de esta relación tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero tres de ellos aun viven con ella.

Ella trabaja en una casa haciendo quehaceres domésticos por las mañanas pero en las tardes y fines de semana se dedica a vender agua en bidón, esto lo hace  en una tienda que tiene una sobrina en la cual le permite que ella venda este  producto, nos cuenta que gracias a los créditos ha podido sacar adelante este pequeño negocio que no es tan grande pero le permite por lo menos ganarse algo para su sustento diario. Lleva tres años en este negocio y nos cuenta que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar agua en bidones.
 
Su sueño es algún dia tener un soda bar.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo and on the way to the city of Manta, we find the the neighborhood of Metropolitana.  This is where, every 2 weeks, there is a meeting of the members of the communal bank, "Banco Comunal Metropolitana."

Señora Zunilda the is founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because of the help she has received through the loans.  With them she has been able to finance her business and earn an honest living.  Señora Zunilda is 52 years old.   Her husband passed away a number of years ago.  Together, she and her husband had 8 children.  They are all grown, but three of them still live with her.

In the mornings, Señora Zunilda works in a house as the housekeeper.  In the afternoons and on weekends, she earns a living selling bottled water.  Her niece has a store and allows her to sell her water from the store.  Señora Zunilda tells us that thanks to the loans, she has been able to keep her small business going; it's not so big, but it at least allows her to earn enough to meet her daily expenses.  She has been in the business for three years, and she tells us that it has gone well for her.

The loan is for purchasing bottled water.
 
Her dream is to, one day, have a soda bar.

loans.use: to purchase bottles of water.

loans.name: La Segunda Rosa Group

texts.es:
En esta foto se muestra al grupo llamado “LA SEGUNDA ROSA” el cual esta ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes. En la fotografia se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la señora Angela quien es una integrante del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y desayunos tanto para los alunmos de las escuelas como para quien lo solicite, comenta  que ya tiene varios años dedicandose a este negocio, comenta que inicio su negocio vendiendo jugos pero como le solicitaban tambien comida empezo a elaborar desayunos y le ha hido muy bien, sus clientes dicen que la comida que vende es deliciosa, limpia y la prepara en buenas porciones. 

Hoy esta contenta y satisfecha con con el prestamo que le van a otorgar, agradece el buen servicio, dice que este prestamo lo destinará a la compra de más insumos y productos para preparar su comida, tambien para adquirir una parrilla de gas pues la que tiene ya esta algo picada y desgastada por el uso. La señora Angela desea que con las ganancias que obtenga ahorrar para realizar la primera comunion a sus hijos en las fiestas de la comunidad y esta segura que con la ayuda a futuro lograra esta meta y más. 

Ella tiene 27 años y estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones.
texts.en:
The 'La Segunda Rosa' group can be seen in this photo.  The group is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico and has 11 members.  In the photo, you can see the business activity that Angela, one of the group's members, is engaged in.  Angela's business is selling meals and breakfasts to school pupils and others who request them.  She says that she has been in this business for several years.  She says that she started out in business selling juice but people were also requesting food so she started making breakfasts and it went very well.  Her customers say that the food she sells is delicious, hygienic and she provides good portions.

Angela is happy with the loan that she is being granted.  She is grateful for the good service and says that she will use her money to buy more supplies and products for preparing her meals.  She will also buy a gas broiler since the one she has is a somewhat worn through use.  Angela would like to use her profits to save up so that she can celebrate her children's first communion during her community's fiestas.  She is certain that, with this help, in the future she will achieve this goal and others. 

Angela is 27 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is a single mother and has two sons.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a gas broiler.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es: En esta fotografia se muestra al grupo llamado “NUEVA ESTRELLA” el cual esta ubicado en el estado D. Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 7 integrantes. La señora Epifania es una integrante del grupo, tiene una papeleria ubicada frente al kinder D. la localidad, comenta que ya tener varios años en este comercio y que le ha ido bien, dentro D. su negocio tambien venD. ropa, bolsas y un poco D. merceria, y aunque tiene una competencia cercana, ella dice que sa ha ganado la preferencia D. sus clientes para la compra D. sus articulos escolares, comentan algunas D. sus clientas q ella tiene carisma al atenderlas es muy sociable, da buen precio y les gusta la variedad D. productos que tiene. Este prestamo lo destinara a la compra D. más mercancia D. papeleria además que trabaja los domingos, las ganancias que obtenga lo utilizará para para invertir y hacer más granD. su negocio. Tiene el firme proposito D. construir un pasillo y llenarlo D. flores pues dice que le facinan. Ella tiene 67 años y estudio hasta la primaria, tiene 5 hijos, 3 hombre y 2 mujeres y busca lo mejor para ellos que tengan una mejor calidad D. vida y una carrera universitaria lo cual seria su más granD. orgullo.
texts.en:
In this photograph is the group called “Nueva Estrella” [New Star], which is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico. The group is maD. up of 7 members. Epifania has a stationary store located in front of a kindergarten. She says she has been in this business for several years and that it has gone well for her. She also sells clothing, bags, and some sewing supplies. Even though she has competition nearby, she has that she has earned her customer’s preference as the place to buy their school supplies. Some of her clients tell us that she has charisma, is very friendly when she tends to them, she has good prices, and they like the variety of products that she has. 

She says that this loan will be used to buy more stationary merchandise. In addition to working on Sundays, she says that the earnings will be used to invest in expanding her store. She also plans to build a covered porch and fill it with flowers, because she’d love to see this on her property. She is sure that with the help of the institution, and with the support of the loans, [she will be successful]. 

She is 67 years old and studied through primary school. She has 5 children—3 boys and 2 girls. She wants the best for them and wants them to have a better quality of life and a university degree, which would be her greatest priD..

loans.use: to buy stationary products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sorghum, corn, beans, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: El Camino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Camino lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Martha de 47 años es comerciante de ropa desde hace 6 años con 2,000 córdobas pero por un problema que tubo lo descontinuo por unos meses actualmente está volviendo de nuevo al negocio. 
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son mayores y solo su bebe le queda de dos años. Martha invertirá en mercadería en especial por el día de las madres.  
Las otras integrantes son Fátima de 31 años quien vende cosméticos y nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo la cual se vende generalmente los fines de semana y la señora Maribell de 40 años quien comercializa envases plásticos desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group “El Camino” is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. The coordinator of the group is Martha, who is 47 years old. She has been selling clothing for 6 years, and she began her business with NIO 2,000.00. However, due to a problem that she had, she discontinued the business for a few months and is now starting it up again.

She has four children, of whom three are grown, and only her two-year old child lives with her. Martha will buy merchandise for Mother’s Day.

The other members are Fátima, 31 years old, who sells cosmetics and nacatamales, a typical food of the region made of corn and pork, which she usually sells on the weekends. The other member is Maribell, who is 40 years old and has been selling plastic bottles for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Lourdes Del Rocío

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a la ciudad de  Manta encontramos la ciudadela  Metropolitana, lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Metropolitana.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lourdes, tiene 29 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  una niña de cuatro años. Vive en casa de sus padres. Ella estuvo estudiando secretariado ejecutivo pero por el embarazo tuvo que dejar sus estudios, ahora está estudiando un curso de belleza en un instituto de la localidad. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Trabaja haciendo trabajos de digitación en el centro de la ciudad, allí labora de lunes a viernes de 8h00 hasta las 14h00, a partir de esa hora ella se dedica a sus propias ventas ya que vende ropa por catalogo, productos de Avon, Sayson y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Sus productos los deja a crédito y nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes, lleva 12 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien y gracias a su trabajo a su hija no le falta nada.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería, ropa, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un local para ofrecer sus servicios de digitación e internet.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, on the road to the city of Manta, we find the Metropolitana development, where the members of the Communal Bank of Metropolitana meet every two weeks.

This is where we meet Lourdes, who is 29 years old and is a single mother to a four-year old girl. She lives in her parent’s house. She was studying to be an executive assistant when, because of her pregnancy, she had to leave her studies. She is now taking a beauty class at a local institute. She has been with the communal bank for four loan cycles and she likes it because of the benefits provided by the institution.

She does typing jobs in the city center. She works there from Monday through Friday, from 8:00 AM until 2:00 PM. At 2:00 PM she tends to her own sales. She sells clothing from catalogs, and also products from Avon, Sayson, y Yabal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She also sells phone cards and cell phone minutes. She sells her products on credit and she tells us that she has many clients. She has been in this business for 12 years and it has gone very well for her. Thanks to her work, her daughter has everything she needs.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, lotions, costume jewelry, clothing, phone cards, and cell phone minutes. This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her to get ahead. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can offer typing and internet services.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, costume jewelry, clothing, phone cards, and cell phone minutes.

loans.name: Bienvenida Reinelda

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a la ciudad de  Manta encontramos la ciudadela  Metropolitana, lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Metropolitana.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora bienvenida, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal, es fundadora del mismo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son bien ordenadas y responsables.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando él está desocupado, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local. Tiene más de 40 años que se dedica al comercio, empezó desde muy joven a ganarse la vida sola.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, on the road to the city of Manta, we find the Metropolitana development, where the members of the Communal Bank of Metropolitana meet every two weeks.

In this place we meet Bienvenida, who is 56 years old, is married, and has 6 children. All of them are grown, and one still lives with her. Her husband is a mechanic. She has been in the communal bank for two years. She founded it and she likes it because her fellow members are organized and responsible.

She has a grocery store in her house where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, cooking oils, detergents, etc. She works everyday from 6:00 AM until 9:00 PM, and sometimes until later. Her son helps her with her work when he isn’t busy. She buys her products in the center of Portoviejo, though she takes delivery of most of them at her store. She has been in this business for more than 40 years; she began earning a living when she was very young. 

She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic products.

Her goals are to continue with her business and for her business to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic products.

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es: Alexandra de 34 años vive en el barrio Montes de la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene una fritanguería donde también vende jugos de naranja, desde hace más de dos años;  ella inició en un puesto de trabajo alquilado  que luego compró y poco a poco lo ha ido adecuando con herramientas y equipos para ir día a día mejorando la oferta y lograr cada dia que pasa atraer muchos clientes. Aunque su capital de crédito no es de gran tamaño, Alexandra tiene un sueño y es tener un local grande en el cual pueda condicionar un restaurante,  para aprovechar al máximo el potencial de clientes que ya la conocen y se lo han pedido. Credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará insumos en mayor volumen,  para disminuir la frecuencia de compras y ganar descuentos por compras superiores a las que actualmente  acostumbra a hacer. Mientras Alexandra trabaja en la construcción de sus sueños, continua haciendo todos los esfuerzos para lograr la sostenibilidad permanente de su negocio y su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 34 years old and lives in Montes neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She has a fried snacks stall where she also sells orange juice.  She has been in this business for more than two years.  She started out with a rented sales location which she later bought and gradually she has been equipping it with tools and equipment so that she can improve her offerings every day and manage to attract more customers.

Although she doesn't have a lot of capital, Alexandra has a dream of owning large premises where she can set up a restaurant to make the most of her customer potential as her customers already know her and have asked her to do this. 

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Alexandra has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy supplies in larger volumes in order to decrease the frequency with which she buys her supplies and to gain discounts for making larger purchases than those which she is currently used to making.  While Alexandra works towards accomplishing her dreams, she continues putting all her efforts into achieving permanent sustainability and growth for her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, sugar and oil in larger quantities

loans.name: Kristal Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "kristal" se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Eva es tesorera del grupo, tiene 39 años, estudio una carrera tecnica, es casada y tiene 2 hijos varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo desde hace más de cuatro años por lo cual solicita el prestamo para invertir en su negocio. Planea en un futuro poner un local propio y así tener más clientes y ganancias, en este momento se siente satisfecha porque puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y desea ahorrar para brindarles educación a sus hijos y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called “Kristal” and is located in the State of México; it has 9 members.

Eva, 39, is group Treasurer.  She studied a technical career, is married and has two boys.  She has sold shoes via catalogue for over four years and is asking for a loan to invest in the business.

She plans in the future to install a locale of her own to have more customers and profits.  Currently, she feels satisfied because she can help her husband meet family expenses and she wants to save in order to provide her children with education so that they’ll have a better future.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Letesia

texts.en:
Letesia is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Letesia is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Letesia operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling cauliflower and broccoli in the local community. Letesia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Letesia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letesia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cauliflower and broccoli. This loan will be the first taken out by Letesia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional cauliflower and broccoli.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido, from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon, is 31 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Bienvinido owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, breads and green bananas in the local community. Engaged in his business for over a year, he earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 20111, Bienvinido joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and bananas, Bienvinido plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & bananas.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika es una mujer de 35 años casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 10 años;   en el barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde habita con su familia, ella es muy conocida por vender víveres, refrescos y dulcería en general, negocio que inició hace 5 años con la venta de obleas, arequipes  en un vitrina que le regaló su tía;  como gradualmente   empezaron a incrementarse los pedidos,  su negocio  se fue ampliando y hoy está un poco más estable pero con muy poco capital de trabajo, su principal mercado son las amas de casa, jóvenes y  niños  y  Erika se propone  incrementar sus ventas; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva con el cual comprará  en mayor volumen arroz, aceite, granos enlatados, y ganará descuentos, reducirá los gastos que generan la frecuencia de compra que en la actualidad es de dos días.  Su sueño más adelante es ampliar su negocio diversificando la oferta de productos, para  ella dedicarse a administrarlo teniendo  empleados que generen sus propios ingresos. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital con el que cuenta y con este primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo iniciará su camino dirigido a aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Erika, 35, is a married woman.  She has two children who are 9 and 10 years of age.  She lives in Barranquilla’s San Roque neighborhood with her family.  She is well known for selling foodstuffs, soft drinks and sweets in general.  She started the business five years ago selling “obleas” and “arequipes” (wafers and caramel) in a display case her aunt gave her.  Gradually her orders increases and her business grew.  Today, it’s a bit more stable but with very little working capital.  Her principal market is housewives, adolescents and children.  Erika intends to increase her sales and this is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan to buy large volumes of rice, oil and canned grains to qualify for discounts while also reducing costs associated with frequent purchases which currently are every two days.

Her dream for the future is to enlarge the business diversifying her stock merchandise so that she can run it with employees who will generate their own incomes.

Her greatest challenge is the little capital she can count on and this first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo will start her on the road towards an increase in working capital.

loans.use: to buy large volumes of rice, oil and canned grains to qualify for discounts.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 37 and widowed with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Narangerel’s oldest daughter attends a local secondary school and her youngest daughter is a year old. On days that she works, Narangerel leaves her youngest child at her partner’s home. She is responsible for taking care of her daughters. 

In 1992, Narangerel began operating a hair salon in Bulgan province. In 2007, she moved to Ulaanbaatar and began operating a hair salon in the center of the city. Narangerel is an experienced hairdresser who has been operating a hair salon for more than 12 years. She is popular in her area and has many regular customers. 

Narangerel is a responsible and honest person who cares about her children’s future. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay three months rent at her hair salon which will enable her to secure her workplace.

loans.use: to pay three months rent for her hair salon

In 2010, Everline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Everline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Everline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
