location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is now 52 years old and married with two adult-aged children. Danny is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 6,000 per month. 

Danny is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional breeding pigs and pig feed. He has had a hog-raising business for almost 10 years.

In the future, Danny hopes to improve this kind of business as one of the sources of their income. He dreams that someday his business will grow and become profitable so that their way of living will improve.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 48 years of age and married with three school-aged children. Danilo is into the hog-raising business where he generates PHP 4,000 when he sells one of his hogs.

Danilo is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional pigs and pig feed. He has been doing this business for almost eight years.

In the future, Danilo hopes to improve the business to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 28 years old. Rowelyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rowelyn  raises livestock, primarily buying and raising pigs for sell. Rowelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Rowelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rowelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 58 years old and already a widow. She is living in Natappian East, Solana, Cagayan with her five children.

To have a source of living, Hilaria has a hog raising business. She has been in the business for more than five years. Through this said business, she is able to earn a net income of PHP 3,500 when she sells one of her animals. She uses her income for the daily expenditures of her family.

At present, Hilaria needs additional capital for her business, so she is requesting a loan form ASKI and KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 18,000. She will spend the loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines.for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the new sewing machine as well as a hemming machine

loans.name: Olimsho

texts.ru: Олимшо проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Уже три года как он работает таксистом. Он развозит людей по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе - Вахдат. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Olimsho lives in Vahdat. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. He has worked as a taxi driver for three years. He drives people on a route between Vahdat and Dushanbe. He is taking out a loan to repair his car so that he can render his service safely.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a lady health worker in her community and does her responsibility to make her community ladies aware about health issues. She has given birth to two children. Both are young and have not started their education yet. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers and generates income for the family. 

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy a new body for his auto rickshaw which will not only give a presentable look to his rickshaw but also help him to attract passengers getting the transport facility from him. 

He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Surriya hopes that an investment will help him increase his profits and her family will be in a better financial condition as a result. She also hopes that with improved profits, she will be able to send her elder child to school next year.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Zulfiya's Group

texts.en:
Zulfiya is the leader of this group. She is 62 years old, married to a farmer, and has eight children. Five years ago with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, Zulfiya together with her husband purchased five sheep and started a livestock breeding business. They resell livestock at a higher price after being fattened. They earn 5,000 soms per month. Zulfiya is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more livestock and feed. In the future, she wants to see all her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали проживает в Дангаринском районе. Возраст, 24 года. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей у себя дома. Он в основном занимается продажей обуви. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара. То есть он хочет закупить детскую обувь и одежду.
texts.en: Rajabali lives in Dangara. He is 24 years old, married, and has one child. His wife is a housewife. He works trading from home. He primarily sells shoes.  He has been doing this work for five years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods. He wants to buy children's shoes and clothes.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Innocencia

texts.en:
Innocencia lives in the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, separated from spouse and has nine adult children. For the last five years, she has made a living by selling dried fish and earns about 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Innocencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 5,000 PHP, to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her business.  

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Shah Jahan's Group

texts.en:
Shah Jahan is married with two children. Her son is studying in class 5 while her daughter is unable to attend school due to poor financial conditions. 

Her husband is involved in milk and yogurt sales business. His shop is located in the community market. He provides good quality milk and yogurt to his customers; that’s why he earns reasonably good profits from his business. 

But that income was not enough for running the family expenses, and that’s why Shah Jahan started a sewing center a few years ago. She not only sews clothes for her neighboring clients but also teaches sewing skills to young girls and she also sells clothes part-time. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s milk & yogurt selling business. Through the loan, he will buy milk in larger quantity which should enable him to serve more clients and earn better profits. 

He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Shah Jahan hopes that he will make good use of the loan to get the desired results from his business.

loans.use: To buy milk for milk & yogurt selling business.

loans.name: Melca

texts.en:

In 2010, Melca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is applying for a new one to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

location.town: Guanzon Tuto St., Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.ru: Зебонисо жительница Дангаринского района. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее 5 детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Зебонисо имеет средне - специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности она работает уже три года. Кроме того она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В основном она шьет платья для продажи. Год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Zeboniso lives in Dangara. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children. Her children study in high school. Zeboniso has a vocational education as a nurse. She has worked in her profession for three years. Additionally, she works sewing traditional dresses. Basically she sews dresses for sale. She has been doing this work for a year.  She is taking out a loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno is a hard-working businesswoman who has been engaged in the business of selling women's shoes for the past 15 years. She has been engaged in selling women’s shoes. She sells her products at the market known as “Khair.” She has regular customers and earns a good income. She would like to request a loan of 10,000 Somoni in order to purchase new, fashionable, and high-quality goods, which will allow her to attract new customers. She is married and is the loving mother of one child.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road as well as the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase new, fashionable, and high-quality goods, which will allow her to attract new customers at market

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:

To make a living, Lily owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish such as milk fish and sardines, in the local community. Lily has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Lily joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as sardines and mackerel. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Lily plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Erlinda is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a dry goods business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  Erlinda has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy stocks for her dry goods business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 33 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж работает в колхозе. Сама Зебинисо занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Zebiniso lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works on a collective farm. Zebiniso is a farmer. She rents a plot of land where she grows wheat for sale. She has been doing this for eight years.  She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 46 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 10 years.  She also earns income from selling electronic loads (for mobile phones) and retailing rice.   

Marilou has  requested a loan of PHP 24500 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store, items such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Ogridor

texts.en:
Ogridor is 28 years old and married with one infant-aged child. Ogridor is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 3,500 per harvest. 

Ogridor is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Ogridor grows rice-and has been doing it for three years.

In the future, Ogridor hopes to increase his rice production so he can earn more income to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon is 34 years old. He is married and is the father of two children. His wife is a housewife. Abdumanon is a hardworking man who is engaged in providing car repair services. He has been in this business for a year now and is mostly engaged in providing wheel/tire repair services. Abdumanon is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase new equipment and repair his workshop building. Abdumanon would like to thank in advance all the lenders who will support him in his business, thus allowing him to improve his family’s living conditions. More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره 22 سنة يعمل في بيع وصناعة البلاط له في عمله 15 سنة اعزب يحب العائلة وهو مسؤول وتعتمد عائلته على دعمه لهم له تاريخ جيد في العمل فهو محب لعمله وقد طوره بشكل جيد يتميز عمله بالدقة والعمل الجيد لأنه يعمل بدقة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية للعمل حتى يتمكن من تجديد العمل وتوير لكي يتمكن من مواجهة المنافسة التي يتعرض لها في ظل الوضع المادي السيء فهو يسهى دائما الى الاعتماد على نفسه في العمل ويريد من خلال تحسين عمله الى تأسيس عائلة
texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old bachelor who works to support his extended family. He enjoys 15 years of experience in manufacturing and selling ceramics, work which he has developed through his attention to detail and excellence. Mohamad wanted to apply for a loan from A. Majmoua to procure raw materials for his business so that he can gain more of an edge against his stiff competition. He always seeks to be self-reliant and to advance his career so that he can start a family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his ceramics business.

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Amina Jamari runs a food vending service. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She works from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. Amina is in her early thirties. She and her husband have four children who are still enrolled in school. 

This will be Amina's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes to obtain a new loan in order to continue to increase her stock of food items required for her business. Her dream is to better support her children and to see them enrolled in good schools.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, "Mwaminifu." The group has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to continue to increase her stock of the food items required for her business

loans.name: Romelia Floreca's Group

texts.en: Romelia is the leader of 10 members taking a group loan. Romelia is married and is 47 years old. She has a retailing business where she sells veterinary supplies like vaccines, de-worming medicine and animal vitamins. She has been operating this business for almost 15 years. Romelia is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional supplies like vaccines, de-worming medicine and animal vitamins to sell in their villages. She usually earns about PHP 8,000 each month in this business. She hopes that her business will improve while taking the loan to continue sending her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as vaccines, de-worming medicine and  vitamins

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry lives in the village of Bulahan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 60 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. For the last five years, he has made a living running a sari-sari or variety store where he sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, shampoo, soaps and biscuits. He earns about 8,000 PHP a month from his work.

In 2009, Larry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 5,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to his customers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to continue expanding it. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 46 years old,  married and living in Natappian East, Solana, Cagayan. She has four children. Divina's spouse works as a farmer and together they work hard to meet their family's daily consumption.

Divina has been in the business of hog raising for 10 years now. She plans to use this loan to buy vitamins and medicines for the hogs and purchase vegetables to vend in order to have another source of income.

Divina has been a client of ASKI for five years. In the future, she would like to make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and medicines for her  hogs andto  purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 46, runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the village of Jasaan Misamis Oriental. She buys and sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in her store. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. She is widowed and has nine grown children.

Earlier this year, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack food items. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack food items

loans.name: Taleb

texts.ar: طالب عمره39 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع الخبز و(المناقيش)له في عمله 7 سنوات يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتكملة بناء بيته فهو يريد ان يؤمن لأولاده المسكن الأمن والاهتمام بكل متطلبات الحياة الخاصة به يسعى الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته وزيادة المدخول من خلال تحسين نوعية العمل وتطوير المحل هو طموح يحب عائلته وهي كل اهتمامه له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان للقرض السابق الأثر الجيد على العمل وكان يلقى الدعم من عائلته التي ساعدته في تخطي المصاعب المادية في العمل يتميز عمله وينفرد بالطعم الطيب والسعر الجيد والجودة في العمل
texts.en: Taleb is a 39-year-old husband and father of two who is driven to support his family who have helped him so much over the years. He has been working for the past 7 years at a patisserie where he serves delicious baked goods at low prices. Given Taleb’s good standing with Al Majmoua, he wanted to seek another loan to purchase more materials for his store and also to finish construction on his house to provide his children with a safe home.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his patisserie and to finish paying for his home construction.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 42 years old and married with five school-aged children. Anita is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 5,000 per month. 

Anita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional crops to raise. She has been growing root crops for 10 years.

In the future, Anita hopes to improve and strengthen their sources of income to support their family and give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional crops to raise

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife as well as a business woman. She operates a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from Lahore and Faisalabad and sells to her local area clients at a profit. She has a great business sense and she earns a good amount of money from her business every month.  

Razia is the mother of a son who works in a Punjab food restaurant for a low income. 
  
Her husband operates a food selling business. He sells a Punjabi food called "Naan Chaney" (made with chick peas and served with bread) on his cart. He starts his work early in the morning and sells by visiting different streets of the city.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as chick peas, cooking oil and spices, etc. to prepare a larger quantity of food and earn more profits by selling.  

He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Razia is confident about the financial growth of his business as a result of an investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for food selling business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is from the village of Aplaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old, married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Margarita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, beverages, shampoo, and soap in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Margarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages. This loan will be Margarita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Adelaida works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice as well as from rice farming.  She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old.  She is married and has 6 children.  With 2 children in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a Sari-Sari Store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  She sells a variety of items such as bread, spices, noodles, etc.  She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store, such as sardines, groceries, etc.

In the future, Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 46 years old.  She is married and has 6 children. 

Erma works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from selling timber.  Emma has requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.  

Erma has successfully repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: stock more rice to sell

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina, age 53, earns a living by preparing and selling cooked meals in the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She buys and prepares a variety of viands for different meals such as afritada, pancit bihon, and fried chicken. Cerelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have two school-aged children.

In 2007, Cerelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Cerelina has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and was employed as working capital. Cerelina is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare her meals, such as meat, spices, and vegetables. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cerelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare her meals, such as meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 68 years old and single.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 11 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Paz is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, and beverages in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Perla is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and beverages. This loan will be Perla's fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 35 years old, married and has five children. For the last 10 years, she has made a living selling curios along Capital Street in Nairobi and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more items to sell to her customers. Josephine will use the extra income she earns from this loan to pay for her children's school fees. In the future she hopes to grow her business and provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy more curios to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan is married with two children: a daughter and a son. Her son is 24 years old and operates a grocery store in the community while her daughter is studying in class 10. 

Hanifaan herself is a very caring wife and mother. She does her household responsibilities very well. Her husband is involved in an herbal medicine business. He treats his patients with herbs and herbal medicines. He is known as an expert in his field and has built up a good reputation and trust among his patients. 

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy herbs to make herbal medicines. This will help him treat his patients better and increase his profits.

He has been doing this business for the past 20 years and Hanifaan is confident that after a loan investment her husband’s business will grow further and make him even more money every month.

loans.use: To buy herbs for herbal medicine business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental, is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting her fifth loan for 7000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. Evelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Fevita

texts.en:
Fevita is married with three children. She has been a hog raiser for almost 10 years. Fevita has been running this business for five years and she would like to continue to  maintain it.

Fevita is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and medicine for her hogs. According to her, this amount will surely help her in fulfilling her dreams and goals in life. Although her children have their own families already, Fevita is still looking forward to the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for her hogs

loans.name: Hannah Njeri

texts.en:
Hannah, age 55, has operated her shoe shop in the town of Naivasha for the last three years. She is the widowed mother of three children. 

Hannah was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of her friends. This will be her third loan. She has repaid all her previous loans dependably and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount to buy more shoes to offer for sale in her shop.

In future, Hannah hopes to grow her shoe retail shop business into a wholesale endeavor.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Vanessa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Vanessa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional sidecar for her motorcycle transport business.

Vanessa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sidecar

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
May Joy is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. 

May Joy is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. May Joy requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

May Joy has been farming rice for five years, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

In the future, May Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Junelie

texts.en:
Junelie works hard to support her family. Junelie is married and has a business buying and selling personal-use items in the Philippines.

Junelie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Junelie has been in this business for 3 years, and also earns additional income from selling food.

In the future, Junelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell

loans.name: Reviewpeter

texts.en:
For the last 12 years, Peter has made a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the town of Naivasha. He is 42 years old, married to Mercy and has two children. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and is applying for his third loan. He repaid all his first two loans completely and on time. He plans to use this new loan to buy four bags of potatoes to sell to his customers. 

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his own vegetables and own a big grocery store.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lolita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lolita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, noodles, bread, chips, etc. 

In the future Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn crops to offer for sale. Arceli works hard to improve her business and increase her income. Her primary goal is to be able to sustain the costs of her children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. Arceli is confident that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

Arceli and her husband have five children between the ages of three and 27 years old.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jesee Muru

texts.en:
Jesse, age 30, has practiced farming in the town of Naivasha for the last two years. He and his wife, Juliana Wambui, have three children.  

This is the first time Jesse has accessed a loan from any microfinance institution. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our field officers, and he plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to help pay school fees for his children. In future, Jesse hopes to become a leading farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Kalysa

texts.en:
Kalysa is 42 years old, married to Fidelis and has eight children. She has been manufacturing detergents to sell in Nakuru town for the last 3 years. 

She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more chemicals for making detergents.

In the future, Kalysa hopes to stabilize her manufacturing business as well as start a poultry farm in Nakuru town.

loans.use: to buy more chemicals for making detergents.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Mr.Battur is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2000, Battur’s family moved from the countryside to the capital city in search of a better life.  Battur’s eldest daughter studies at  university. His eldest son helps in his father’s business and the youngest son studies in secondary school. Battur’s wife works in Saikhan Kharaa Co.Ltd. as a cement dealer. 

Battur runs a building materials delivery business using his truck. His family’s living condition is improving and they are happy that they moved to the capital city. Three years ago, they bought a plot of  land.  Currently they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Last year Battur started his building project for a family house. The house is half complete and he is planning to finish it now. The loan Battur is taking will be used to buy a necessary building materials such as cement, sand, plaster, paints, wall papers to complete the building project of the family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials, such as cement, sand, plaster, paints, and wall paper to complete the family house building project

loans.name: Dionalin

texts.en:
Dionalin is 42 years old and married. She has 2 children, aged 15 and 13. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Dionalin is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice and corn crops at their farm. Dionalin rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest. Dionalin does her part to provide for her family's needs.

This loan will be used by Dionalin to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Daniel Wanjii

texts.en:
Daniel has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 15 years.  He is 48 years old, married to Esther Muthoni, and they have four school-aged children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elwarth

texts.en:
Elwarth, age 63, is a farmer who tills an area of farmland in Banga, South Cotabato. Here, he grows rice and crops to harvest and offer for sale. Elwarth is married and works hard to help provide for his family. One of his primary goals is to help send his grandchildren to school.

Elwarth's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He is confident that this loan will help increase his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidering machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, aged 43, is a single mother to two children,  Mary aged 26 and Ruth who is 18 years old. Esther sells timber in Limuru town near Nairobi, which she has been doing for the last six years. The business earns her a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This is Esther's fifth loan from Kiva partner, KADET,  and she has successfully managed to pay her previous loans. WIth this loan, she wants to buy more timber for resale. In the future, Esther hopes to start a yard in Nairobi in order to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 45 years old and has three children.  Elisa is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elisa has been farming rice for 12 years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her activity.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: Née le 12 Juin 1975, Rachidatou est mariée à Soumaïla, un soudeur. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Rachidatou et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Rachidatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Rachidatou a appris la couture, ce qui l’aide à répondre aux besoins de ses enfants. Parallèlement à cette activité qu’elle mène, Rachidatou vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Rachidatou achète ses produits à Ilara au Nigéria. C’est la deuxième fois que Rachidatou sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Rachidatou was born on June 12, 1975 and is married to Soumaïla, a welder. They have four children, of whom a few attend school. Rachidatou and her husband share household expenses. Rachidatou lives together with her husband and their children. Since she never attended school, Rachidatou learnt dressmaking and this activity enables her to provide for her children. At the same time she has another activity, namely selling sewing supplies in her workshop. Rachidatou buys her supplies in Ilara in Nigeria. This is the second time that Rachidatou applies for a loan from the microfinance institution Alidé, which will help her to boost her activity level and better meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, age 39, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. He and his wife, Teresia have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one his friends and this will be his fourth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans dependably and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Jackson hopes to become a leading farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nyikira Okole Women's Group B

texts.en:
Betty, age 30, owns and operates a pub business in Kampala. She sells all types of beverages at her establishment, which has been the venture she has been relying on to shoulder her family-related and personal responsibilities over the course of the past six years. She feels that the prospects for betterment in her business are looking rosier with every passing day, given the increasing number of patrons who come to her establishment to partake of the beverages she offers. Notwithstanding the cut-throat competition prevalent in her genre of business, Betty is determined to give a good account of herself and to persist when push comes to shove. 

Betty reports that her weekly sales revenue totals up to 120,000 shillings. She tells us that she intends to use this loan to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to offer for sale at her pub.

Betty and her husband have two children who are both enrolled in school in Kampala.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to offer for sale at her pub

loans.name: Borbandi

texts.en:
Mr. Borbandi is a 36-year-old truck driver. He lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife runs a used clothes business at the outdoor market. Borbandi’s family temporarily live on Borbandi’s elder brother’s land in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. In March this year Borbandi bought a plot of land and now he is planning to build a proper fence using cement blocks. Later on, he is planning to build a family house.
Borbandi runs a delivery business at the timber market using his truck. He has permanent customers who use his service. He will use this loan to buy cement blocks and to build a fence around his plot of land.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks to build a fence around his plot of land.

loans.name: Marie A.

texts.fr: Née le 12 Septembre 1965, Marie est mariée à Félix, un rebobineur. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs.  Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Marie subvient ensemble avec son mari, aux besoins de la famille. Marie n’a pas été à l’école, mais  a appris la couture, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis vingt ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Marie vend des divers dans son atelier. Marie s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Marie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son atelier de couture à travers l’acquisition d’une machine à broder, et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Marie was born on September 12, 1965 and is married to Félix, an electrical technician. They provide for four children, all attending school, of whom two are their own. Marie lives with her husband and the children. The parents provide together for the family. Marie did not go to school, but learnt dressmaking, an activity that she has passionately done for the past twenty years and that enables her to provide for her needs. Marie has another activity, namely selling various sewing supplies in her workshop. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. It is the second time that Marie applies for a loan from the microfinance institution Alidé. This loan will help her to better equip her sewing workshop (she will buy an embroidering machine) and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy an embroidering machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and a mother of three grown-up children. She is now 42 years old and has had a manufacturing business for 10 years already. She makes and sells milk candies and pastries for the people in their community. According to Helen, her candy making is quite laborious but she is happy that she is able to sell all her finished products every time she makes them.   

Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that will serve as additional capital to buy milk, sugar, vanilla, and candy wrappers, which are the raw ingredients in her manufacturing business. Someday, Helen hopes to see her business grow to sustain the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, vanilla, and candy wrappers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shaving machines, surgical spirit, and other utilities required in a barber shop, as well as to buy more grocery supplies to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 10 bales of shoes for resale

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is already 57 years old, married and living together with her family in the village of Villa Magat somewhere in San Mateo, Isabela. She has three children who are adults. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Editha has been in her tailoring/dressmaking business for 15 years and she earns approximately PHP 7,000 monthly. She is planning to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy sewing materials like needles, chalk, and fabrics. 

Editha has been a client of ASKI for more than two years. In the future, she would like to see her business more competitive to create a productive living for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like needles, chalk, and fabrics.

loans.name: Eslyn

texts.en:
Eslyn is a married woman with seven children. She is 57 years old and has had a food selling business for three years. Eslyn sells vegetables to the people in her community. She has been in this business for three years. Eslyn is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase fruits and an additional variety of vegetables like cabbage, tomato, and squash.

In the future, Eslyn hopes to have a bigger business and offer a greater variety of products to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and an additional variety of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 23 years old, a craftsman from village Kisiskhevi, East Georgia. Gela is married and lives with his wife Anano and parents in the village.

He is a craftsman and makes various items from gypsum plaster. Besides his main handicraft, Gela is also busy with the agricultural business of the family. In particular, the family has a milk cow, three pigs, and two sheep. The family sells milk, piglets and lambs. The total income of the family is approximately 1200 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit Gela will purchase calves to raise. After a year they will be milked and the family will be able to sell more milk. That will positively impact the family’s income. In the future Gela plans to further expand their dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase calves for their dairy farm.
